title:CTR PvE !Backups Dupes - This is a compiled collection of god/recommended rolls from top community minds.
description:Thanks to u/Mercules904, u/pandapaxxy, @AyyItsChevy, @chrisfried, u/-seudonym-, u/zman2100, u/goddamtofu, Gleauxx, GodInGaming, Beenlab, CoolCheese, Critbuff, Apathettic, Ekuegan, Jarv, Ascendant Nomad, Shadow, Pijinnn, AbbyHour, GodinGaming, illPhysics, BRAVExHERO, Pattycakes, blueberries.gg, YeezyGT, @johnldixon, WarlockMaggie, 2bithacker, and whyayala for their contributions. Ping u/48klocs / @48klocs with any issues.

// Live Fire
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Live Fire doesn't do anything spectacular, but it's not trying to reinvent the wheel. Live Fire exists to specialize in Stasis. While it's nothing fancy it doesn't have to be. Shoot to Loot is interesting if you make crystals through your subclass (Prismatic or Stasis). Or it can be a generic scout rifle through Subsistence or Rapid Hit." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Neoptolemus II
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Ah yes. Nepotism the bow. What an interesting selection of perks. Not a single good reload perk through Rapid Hit or Archer's Tempo. You could go all 360-no-scope-Legolas-lite with Perfect Float and Air Trigger. But in reality this bow is more for ability regeneration. Pugilist or Strategist giving melee or class ability energy, respectively. Add in Wellspring for general ability energy and you've got a real quick way of getting your abilities back." Recommended MW: Accuracy ornDraw Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Legato-11
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Legato-11 seems to be Bungie’s answer to an updated FILO. Auto-Loading Holster and Cascade Point for almost Fourth Horseman like DPS or Focused Fury and Triple Tap for improved total damage. Incandescent and Heal Clip also synergize for Solar or any build really. It's kind of like a jack of all trades but keeps itself unique enough to not be a master of none." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// VS Gravitic Arrest
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "VS Gravatic Arrest has some steep competition. Royal Executioner, Techeun Force, Pressurized Precision, heck even Trinary System. Does Withering Gaze do enough to give it a spot in your loadout? Well it does apply the Weaken debuff for the low low cost of one ammo. That alone for any damage rotation will be highly helpful. It doesn't do anything flashy like double damage perks or infinite ammo, but it does make dealing damage easier. If you're not hurting for vault space then I would recommend grabbing one, otherwise it's a wash and you can apply Weaken through other means." Recommended MW: Charge Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// VS Pyroelectric Propellant
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Oh boy, did I not expect to see another Adaptive Frame auto rifle. We just got Khvostov, Summoner, and Ros Arago IV. And all those weapons are strong within their own right. VS Pyroelectric Propellent has one trick up its sleeve and that's Jolting Feedback. You can pair this with Attrition Orbs for some extra orb generation, or Eddy Current for faster reload when Amplified. The other weapons fit into their specific elemental roles and that applies here too. The more you like Arc the more this weapon shines." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// VS Velocity Baton
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "This is probably my favorite weapon to come out of this dungeon. The amount of orbs you can generate is almost as strong as OG Tether back in Year 1 Eater of Worlds. Lorathexplorer almost crashed my game multiple times with how many orbs she made. For general use Attrition Orbs is great but I feel the perk interaction is slightly unintended. You do have the Void Synergy, but outside of that it is a nice area denial frame for the energy slot versus the kinetic." Recommended MW: Blast Radius or Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// VS Chill Inhibitor
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Be glad if you completed Vesper's Host for the new shiny drop at Banshee. You know what you were looking for, Envious Arsenal and Bait and Switch. If you expect either or both perks to get a nerf in the foreseeable future you should instead try to get your own roll of Cascade Point and Explosive Light for incredible burst DPS." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Fair Judgment
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Our newest Ritual Weapon is Fair Judgement. A stasis auto rifle that has pretty low to medium tier stats across the board. Its uniqueness comes from being only the second precision frame stasis auto rifle. The other being last year's Horror Story that was dropped from the recently concluded Festival of the Lost. Rimestealer and Headstone are both fantastic together for stasis synergy and even outside of stasis to build up Frost Armor stacks." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=4176873718&perks=1955165503,1968497646,4090651448,95528736

// Exuviae
//notes:pandapaxxy & WarlockMaggie (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "[pandapaxxy] Rimestealer might just be one of the best perks to bless Stasis since the original Headstone. Rimestealer allows you to build Frost Armor which is incredibly useful in all activities. Extra damage resistance? We all remember changed with light giving damage resistance. It was the norm and it was odd when not used (outside of Warmind Cells). Definitely look for Rimestealer on your Exuviae. [WarlockMaggie] While Handcannons aren’t supported by Episode II’s Artifact, this Stasis 120 does provide some excellent options for both General and Advanced level play. The new hotness of Rimestealer and Headstone is a great option, while Stats for All and Frenzy will make this weapon feel incredible without a single kill required. Stability and Reload are high priorities for stat increases." Recommended MW: Stability or Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Liturgy
//notes:WarlockMaggie (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "It's no secret I absolutely love Stasis weapons and to get a double-fire launcher is exciting! First off, Rimestealer and Chill Clip work pretty well together. Two volleys will freeze a target, allowing Liturgy to self-proc Rimestealer. Alternatively, going hard into Blast Radius with Chain Reaction will make large icy kabooms!" Recommended MW: Blast Radius or Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Insurmountable
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Insurmountable looks to be a decent Void sidearm for most activities. The issue is most sidearms don't scare up to GM levels easily. The synergy is there but when it takes 2-3 mags to down a red bar what's the point. In low end activities it can be incredibly strong. Just please don't take it into any real high power level activities." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Sovereignty
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Holy cow did I not see this coming. A sniper that doesn't only have perks mixed in different slots, but a sniper that can apply Weaken. Explosive Payload will give you a slight damage bump and apply Weaken with Withering Gaze. This sniper doesn't really fit the conventional deal of great DPS or single target damage, nor does it “add clear” like other weapons could. It's almost like Bungie took the normal sniper perks, put them into a jar and shook them up." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=3818198556&perks=1087426260,1134488199,3038247973,839105230
dimwishlist:item=3818198556&perks=106909392,1134488199,3038247973,839105230
dimwishlist:item=3818198556&perks=1087426260,1134488199,1840239774,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=3818198556&perks=106909392,1134488199,1840239774,3038247973

// Vantage Point
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Without a standalone reload perk Vantage Point feels a little lackluster. Keep Away does give a sizable reload boost coupled with a reload MW or loader mods on your gauntlets you can make this weapon feel pretty quick. Stats for All does work with Jolting Feedback to instantly get you to max stacks after applying Jolt which is a nifty trick. Eddy Current’s buff to instantly apply the benefits when amplified is great but if you're using Prismatic or just using Jolting Feedback for add clear and aren't investing into Arc you're better off with either of the other perks." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=3830941962&perks=1087426260,1583705720,4049631843,839105230

// Ignition Code
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Ignition Code is back and better than ever? Not really but it has a neat origin trait. Slideshot still remains unique and allows for consecutive shots. High Ground is easy to proc and if you've got enough room you can keep sliding back and forth with your enhanced damage. Ambitious Assassin, Lead From Gold and Unrelenting are all great perks on their own and I wouldn't be upset with them. Paired with Frenzy or Vorpal Weapon for damage and you've got yourself a solid workhorse weapon. Outside of the Area Denial frame this can still fit most any loadout." // Arcane Embrace
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Arcane Embrace is the newest frame to Destiny 2. A double fire slug shotgun. Each trigger pull fires two semi-deadly slugs. (Only semi if you can hit your shots). Over in your regular PvE activities it shouldn't matter unless you regularly GM or something. Fourth Times the Charm will give you one extra trigger pull for two consecutive burst crits. Precision Instrument stacks quickly on double fire frames and will work nicely against chunky health bars and champions. Surrounded can work better depending on the encounter and how confident you are at staying alive. Bonus points for Desperado for shotgun go brrrrr." //notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Jurassic Green has always been an interesting weapon. It has worse base stats compared to other Rapid-Fire frame pulse rifles. Even with the deterministic recoil I preferred the base recoil with counterbalance or full send to 100 recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake. Heal Clip and Incandescent are tried and true rolls but you could opt for Frenzy for the big boost to reload and handling. Loose Change with Incandescent can also make you forget about the reload stat, but falls off a bit in higher level content." Recommended MW: Stability or Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Acosmic
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Acosmic is back and better than ever. Clown Cartridge and any of your favorite damage perks is going to be the roll to get. Impulse Amplifier is also good if you don't remember to reload before damage phases. Air Trigger can get you back to back mags with ease. I would say that Withering Gaze is not the perk to get. It's solid on special weapons and even though it's new it doesn't work well with the best in slot perk, Bait and Switch. /// Legato-11 (PvE)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), (Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Light Mag), (Triple Tap, Auto-Loading Holster), (Vorpal Weapon, Frenzy, Focused Fury)
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy written v8.1.5 (PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller): PvE pick for backup sustained Boss special weapon damage in general, and end-game underleveled content. There was a time when slug shotties like Legato-11 were the meta for CQC Boss damage. They're still decent, mind, and it wouldn't take much of a buff for their glory days to return. At base the stats are very good - 65 Range equates to 9.22m while ADS and 7.69m hipfire, 68 Handling is 0.32s ready speed, 0.29s ADS speed and 0.34s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 48 is a 0.72s reload per shell. With 0/1/2/3 reserve mods, you'll have total ammo of 19/20/22/23 shots (maximum is 23) and magazine size of 6 (maximum is 8). Slug SGs have the same vertical recoil boost as Precisions, so you can largely ignore recoil direction, and use the barrel perk to boost Handling. You have options for the magazine perk - Assault Mag increases your fire rate, and thus DPS. You can hit the maximum mag size of 8 with either Tactical Mag (which also boosts Stability and Reload Speed) or Appended Mag and a Backup Mag mod. Or you can boost Range and Reload Speed with Light Mag. For sustained boss damage, you can go one of two ways - Triple Tap will let you shoot 12 times before reloading with the max mag size of 8, or Auto-Loading Holster lets you swap to a kinetic slot slug SG continue DPS while it reloads in the background. For a damage perk, Vorpal Weapon or Frenzy (which also maxes out Handling and Reload Speed when procced) boost damage by ×1.15, or Focused Fury can provide ×1.2 damage after you've hit crits with your first four shots. The Suros Synergy origin trait only procs after a manual reload, but it's always nice to have extra handling. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags:PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller
dimwishlist:item=3753063346&perks=2896038713,3400784728,4090651448,791862061
dimwishlist:item=3753063346&perks=106909392,2896038713,3400784728,4090651448
dimwishlist:item=3753063346&perks=2896038713,3300816228,4090651448,791862061
dimwishlist:item=3753063346&perks=106909392,2896038713,3300816228,4090651448

// Live Fire (first-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), (Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell, Armor-Piercing Rounds), Rimestealer, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 123 from 19 November 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3n08KP410ui1TXoEdBmsvu?si=79e5ef3228b24096) with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways (PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add clearing minor enemies in general non-underleveled content, particularly for Stasis builds. Live Fire is a decent stasis scout rifle, if you're looking for one, offering better integration with the Stasis verb toolkit than previous versions. At base the stats are decent (except for maybe Reload Speed) - 45 Range equates to 74.61m while ADS and 37.31m hipfire, 46 Handling is 0.41s ready speed, 0.33s ADS speed and 0.39s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 40 is a 2.18s reload. With this being a precision frame, you can pretty much ignore the recoil direction stat, and use the barrel perk to boost Handling. Look for Reload Speed-bosting mag perks, although Armor-Piercing Rounds is another utility option for your vault for when scout rifles have the seasonal artefact anti-barrier mod, for a ×1.05 damage boost to shields and barriers. For Stasis synergy, the combination of Rimestealer and Headstone gives you Stasis crystals on crit kills, and Frost Armor stacks when you shatter them for AoE damage, which you can use fragments to enhance further. The Field Forged origin trait does boost gunfeel stats very subtly but, if you can stay alive to keep collecting stacks, you will start feeling the benefit at higher tiers as you rack up hits and kills. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod or, when masterworked, Synergy to create more Stasis shards or Stunloader when there's a matching artifact mod.|tags:PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller
dimwishlist:item=3612142623&perks=124408337,1840239774,1955165503,3230963543
dimwishlist:item=3612142623&perks=124408337,1955165503,3230963543,4090651448
dimwishlist:item=3612142623&perks=124408337,1840239774,1955165503,1968497646
dimwishlist:item=3612142623&perks=124408337,1955165503,1968497646,4090651448

// Live Fire (first-choice PvE)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 123 from 19 November 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3n08KP410ui1TXoEdBmsvu?si=79e5ef3228b24096) with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways (PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add clearing minor enemies in general non-underleveled content, particularly for Stasis builds. Live Fire is a decent stasis scout rifle, if you're looking for one, offering better integration with the Stasis verb toolkit than previous versions. At base the stats are decent (except for maybe Reload Speed) - 45 Range equates to 74.61m while ADS and 37.31m hipfire, 46 Handling is 0.41s ready speed, 0.33s ADS speed and 0.39s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 40 is a 2.18s reload. With this being a precision frame, you can pretty much ignore the recoil direction stat, and use the barrel perk to boost Handling. Look for Reload Speed-bosting mag perks, although Armor-Piercing Rounds is another utility option for your vault for when scout rifles have the seasonal artefact anti-barrier mod, for a ×1.05 damage boost to shields and barriers. For Stasis synergy, if you already have access to stasis shard creation through the verb kit, you can gain Frost Armor stacks through Rimestealer that way, and use Shoot to Loot as a utility perk to collect ammo remotely and auto-refill your weapons. The Field Forged origin trait does boost gunfeel stats very subtly but, if you can stay alive to keep collecting stacks, you will start feeling the benefit at higher tiers as you rack up hits and kills. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod or, when masterworked, Synergy to create more Stasis shards or Stunloader when there's a matching artifact mod.|tags:PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller
dimwishlist:item=3612142623&perks=1840239774,1955165503,3230963543,3700496672
dimwishlist:item=3612142623&perks=1955165503,3230963543,3700496672,4090651448
dimwishlist:item=3612142623&perks=1840239774,1955165503,1968497646,3700496672
dimwishlist:item=3612142623&perks=1955165503,1968497646,3700496672,4090651448

// Legato-11 (first-choice PvE)
// Fluted Barrel, (Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Light Mag), (Triple Tap, Auto-Loading Holster), (Vorpal Weapon, Frenzy, Focused Fury)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 123 from 19 November 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3n08KP410ui1TXoEdBmsvu?si=79e5ef3228b24096) with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways (PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for backup sustained Boss special weapon damage in general, and end-game underleveled content. There was a time when slug shotties like Legato-11 were the meta for CQC Boss damage. They're still decent, mind, and it wouldn't take much of a buff for their glory days to return. At base the stats are very good - 65 Range equates to 9.22m while ADS and 7.69m hipfire, 68 Handling is 0.32s ready speed, 0.29s ADS speed and 0.34s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 48 is a 0.72s reload per shell. With 0/1/2/3 reserve mods, you'll have total ammo of 19/20/22/23 shots (maximum is 23) and magazine size of 6 (maximum is 8). Slug SGs have the same vertical recoil boost as Precisions, so you can largely ignore recoil direction, and use the barrel perk to boost Handling. You have options for the magazine perk - Assault Mag increases your fire rate, and thus DPS. You can hit the maximum mag size of 8 with either Tactical Mag (which also boosts Stability and Reload Speed) or Appended Mag and a Backup Mag mod. Or you can boost Range and Reload Speed with Light Mag. For sustained boss damage, you can go one of two ways - Triple Tap will let you shoot 12 times before reloading with the max mag size of 8, or Auto-Loading Holster lets you swap to a kinetic slot slug SG and continue DPS while it reloads in the background. For a damage perk, Vorpal Weapon or Frenzy (which also maxes out Handling and Reload Speed when procced) boost damage by ×1.15, or Focused Fury can provide ×1.2 damage after you've hit crits with your first four shots. The Suros Synergy origin trait only procs after a manual reload, but it's always nice to have extra handling. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags:PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller
dimwishlist:item=3753063346&perks=1840239774,2896038713,3400784728,791862061
dimwishlist:item=3753063346&perks=106909392,1840239774,2896038713,3400784728
dimwishlist:item=3753063346&perks=1840239774,2896038713,3300816228,791862061
dimwishlist:item=3753063346&perks=106909392,1840239774,2896038713,3300816228

// Veleda-F (first-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), (Appended Mag, Tactical Mag, Extended Mag, Alloy Mag), Air Trigger, Withering Gaze
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 123 from 19 November 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3n08KP410ui1TXoEdBmsvu?si=79e5ef3228b24096) with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways (PvE PvE-Boss PvE-Utility PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE utility pick to weaken Bosses and Majors in general, and end-game underleveled content. Veleda-F is, hopefully, a harbinger future void snipers that we can consider in a fireteam's loadout for major and boss damage, even though aggressive frames aren't the optimal choice for damage. At base the stats are average - 47 Zoom, 80 Range, 30 Handling is 0.43s ready speed, 0.44s ADS speed and 0.38s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 27 is a 3.26s reload. With 0/1/2/3 reserve mods, you'll have total ammo of 21/23/24/25 shots (max is 27) and magazine size of 3 (maximum 5). Both Handling and Reload Speed could do with a little help with barrel and magazine perks, although there's also something to be said for a larger capacity mag too. Air Trigger in the first trait perk column provides the equivalent of 1.5 reserves mods (2 when enhanced) for more total ammo and, if you can co-ordinate starting reloading during a jump, adds 30 to Reload Speed and a ×0.8 reload animation duration. Withering Gaze in the second column applies the same weaken debuff as Divinity - effectively a ×1.15 boost to damage for 6s for the whole fireteam, so could be used in combination with a Boss damage heavy weapon. Interestingly, you can also extend the timer of sources of 30% weaken, such as Felwinter's Helm and Tractor Cannon (but not Hunter Tethers unfortunately) by using Withering Gaze to reapply the debuff. Hopefully in future we'll see the trait in the first column of a sniper rifle. If you're interested, Veleda was a priestess and prophet of the Bructeri Germanic tribe during the Batavian rebellion against Rome in 69–70 CE. The Hakke Breach Armaments origin trait increases damage against vehicles (×1.15), constructs (×1.3) and Stasis crystals (×1.45), which can be situationally useful. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags:PvE PvE-Boss PvE-Utility PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller
dimwishlist:item=4200122994&perks=1087426260,1134488199,1821614984,1840239774
dimwishlist:item=4200122994&perks=1087426260,1134488199,1821614984,839105230
dimwishlist:item=4200122994&perks=1087426260,1134488199,1821614984,4090651448
dimwishlist:item=4200122994&perks=106909392,1134488199,1821614984,1840239774
dimwishlist:item=4200122994&perks=106909392,1134488199,1821614984,839105230
dimwishlist:item=4200122994&perks=106909392,1134488199,1821614984,4090651448

// Fair Judgment (first-choice PvE)
// Corkscrew Rifling, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Rimestealer, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 123 from 19 November 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3n08KP410ui1TXoEdBmsvu?si=79e5ef3228b24096) with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways (PvE PvE-Utility PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add clearing minor enemies in general non-underleveled content, particularly for Stasis builds. Fair Judgment is a decent stasis auto rifle, if you're looking for one, offering better integration with the Stasis verb toolkit than previous versions. At base the stats are solid - 59 Range equates to 29.00m while ADS and 08.13m hipfire, 45 Handling is 0.39s ready speed, 0.31s ADS speed and 0.36s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 43 is a 1.92s reload. With this being a precision frame, you can pretty much ignore the recoil direction stat. Corkscrew Rifling adds a little bit of everything as the barrel perk, and Armor-Piercing Rounds is decent option to overpenetrate targets and a ×1.05 damage boost to shields and barriers - useful for when the anti-barrier seasonal artifact mod's around. For Stasis synergy, the combination of Rimestealer and Headstone gives you Stasis crystals on crit kills, and Frost Armor stacks when you shatter them for AoE damage, which you can use fragments to enhance further. The origin trait options of Vanguard Vindication, for a small health bump on a kill, or One Quiet Moment for +20 Handling, +40 Reload Speed with a ×0.95 reload animation duration when out of combat are both useful. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod or, when masterworked, Synergy to create more Stasis shards or Stunloader when there's a matching artifact mod.|tags:PvE PvE-Utility PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller
dimwishlist:item=4176873718&perks=124408337,1955165503,1968497646,4090651448

// BrayTech Werewolf
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Braytech Werewolf is the sole survivor of the two FotL auto rifle conundrum we've had. Poor Horror Story (though whether it's a glitch or not, you can enhance your old FotL weapons…SGA). When using Braytech Werewolf in PvE your best roll is Rewind Rounds or Subsistence paired with your choice of Onslaught or Kinetic Tremors. It entirely depends on how you would like to use this auto. All 4 perks are great on their own and make this auto feel incredible." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Arcane Embrace
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Arcane Embrace is the newest frame to Destiny 2. A double fire slug shotgun. Each trigger pull fires two semi-deadly slugs. (Only semi if you can hit your shots). Over in your regular PvE activities it shouldn't matter unless you regularly GM or something. Fourth Times the Charm will give you one extra trigger pull for two consecutive burst crits. Precision Instrument stacks quickly on double fire frames and will work nicely against chunky health bars and champions. Surrounded can work better depending on the encounter and how confident you are at staying alive. Bonus points for Desperado for shotgun go brrrrr." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Jurassic Green
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Jurassic Green has always been an interesting weapon. It has worse base stats compared to other Rapid-Fire frame pulse rifles. Even with the deterministic recoil I preferred the base recoil with counterbalance or full send to 100 recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake. Heal Clip and Incandescent are tried and true rolls but you could opt for Frenzy for the big boost to reload and handling. Loose Change with Incandescent can also make you forget about the reload stat, but falls off a bit in higher level content." Recommended MW: Stability or Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Mechabre
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Mechabre has always been a great sniper rifle. Even though High-Impact snipers aren't high meta their high single shot damage is great for solo play or short damage phases where accuracy isn't as important. Triple Tap or Clown Cartridge will get you better ammo with Appended Mag and a backup mag mod. If you're going to be with fireteam members, Firing Line is best in slot. Vorpal Weapon is second best but better for solo or dual fireteams." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Acosmic
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Acosmic is back and better than ever. Clown Cartridge and any of your favorite damage perks is going to be the roll to get. Impulse Amplifier is also good if you don't remember to reload before damage phases. Air Trigger can get you back to back mags with ease. I would say that Withering Gaze is not the perk to get. It's solid on special weapons and even though it's new it doesn't work well with the best in slot perk, Bait and Switch. If you can lead with Withering Gaze on another weapon you can swap to Acosmic for huge damage numbers." Recommended MW: Blast Radius.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// BrayTech Werewolf (first-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling), (Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Flared Magwell, Alloy Mag, Light Mag, Appended Mag), Rewind Rounds, Onslaught
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 121 from 5 November 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/64p7wnHATJnZB8jnnJUnhP?si=f5552155425a4d6a) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add clearing minor enemies in general non-underleveled content. BrayTech Werewolf returns for 2024 with a couple of new tricks, and its previous good stats. At base, 69 Range equates to 31.00m while ADS and 19.38m hipfire, 39 Handling is 0.41s ready speed, 0.32 ADS speed and 0.38s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 42 is a 1.94s reload. Being a precision frame, you can pretty much ignore the Recoil Direction stat, and use the barrel perk to boost handling and/or Stability, and pretty much any mag will do (except Extended) - so very much personal preference. For general add-clearing, the trait perk pairing of Rewind Rounds compliments Onslaught to passively refill your mag as you hit adds and reach the higher damage stacks. The Search Party origin trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Recommended MW: Handling, Stability or Reload Speed depending on your preference, with a Backup Mag mod or, when masterworked, Stunloader when there's a matching artifact mod.|tags:PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller

// Arcane Embrace (first-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Alloy Mag), Fourth Time's the Charm, Precision Instrument
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 121 from 5 November 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/64p7wnHATJnZB8jnnJUnhP?si=f5552155425a4d6a) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for backup sustained Boss damage in general and end-game, underleveled, content. Arcane Embrace is the first of a new subfamily of Heavy Burst shotguns, which look like they might be the new top pick for special weapon boss DPS, doing 9.88% more damage that slug shotguns if both shits hit. The stats look similar to Pin Point Slug shotties too, and by that standard are pretty decent. At base, with 0/1/2/3 Reserve mods, you hold total ammo of 26/29/33/34, but you can chew through ammo fast, firing two shots with each trigger pull. The usual play for shotguns of boosting handling with the barrel perk still applies and, as there's no Assault Mag, look to a magazine perk that helps with Reload Speed. For sustained boss damage, once you're out of heavy ammo, the perk trait combination of Fourth Time's the Charm and Precision Instrument, if you can consistently hit a boss crit spot to take advantage of the up to ×1.25 boost to precision damage and extend your mag. The Search Party origin trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Recommended MW: Handling, Reload Speed depending on your preference, with a Backup Mag mod or, when masterworked, Stunloader when there's a matching artifact mod.|tags:PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller
dimwishlist:item=3649985571&perks=106909392,1354429876,1840239774,555281244
dimwishlist:item=3649985571&perks=106909392,1354429876,4090651448,555281244
dimwishlist:item=3649985571&perks=1354429876,1840239774,3230963543,555281244

// Acosmic (first-choice PvE)
// (Hard Launch, Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), Spike Grenades, Air Trigger, Bait and Switch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 121 from 5 November 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/64p7wnHATJnZB8jnnJUnhP?si=f5552155425a4d6a) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Bosses in general and end-game, underleveled, content. Void rapid-fire grenade launcher Acosmic returns with a couple of new tricks for a boss damage. The stats look decent out of the box. At base, 25 Handling translates to 0.48s ready speed, 0.45s ADS speed and 0.43 stow speed, and with 0/1/2/3 Reserve mods, you hold total ammo of 33/35/37/38 shots. For boss damage, Hard Launch as the barrel perk squeezes a tiny bit more damage out of Spike Grenades, but otherwise look for one that boosts velocity. Air Trigger may sound like a weird recommendation for the first trait perk, but it's more for the additional reserves - equivalent to 1.5 reserve mods (2 mods when enhanced) and, as long as you start your reload animation while in the air, the whole reload will be sped up. You'll need a fast reload to use with Bait and Switch for the ×1.3 damage boost for 10s. The Search Party origin trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced, but don't overlook Nadir Focus for extra velocity. If you're interested, Acosmic is named after one of the two Hindu aspects of god; to be acosmic is to deny the objective reality of the temporal world - transcendental in a world-negating sense (according to Merriam-Webster). Recommended MW: Velocity or Reload Speed (if it's Blast Radius, leave it well alone with Spike Grenades) depending on your preference, with a Backup Mag mod or, when masterworked, Synergy to generate Void Breaches, or Stunloader when there's a matching artifact mod.|tags:PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller
dimwishlist:item=425681240&perks=1421772400,3078487919,3301904089,3525010810

// Jurassic Green (PvE)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), Subsistence, Frenzy
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy written v8.1.0.4 (PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller): PvE first-choice roll for clearing Minor adds in end-game content. Dreadful stats compared to any other energy rapid-fire pulse rifle, but it's still the only non-endgame solar one currently available. The Range of 27 equates to 30.64m ADS and 18.02m hipfire, 19 Handling is 0.48 ready speed, 0.42s ADS speed and 0.48s stow speed, while 27 Reload Speed is 2.30s reload. It's got a wonky recoil direction of 50, so you'll need to straighten that out as much as possible with a Recoil Direction or control it with a Stability barrel perk 9or a bit of both) and then add a bit more stability with the magazine perk with Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell. In the first trait perk slot, Subsistence passively refills your mag on enemy kills, and Frenzy in the second provides a decent ×1.15 damage boost in combat, as well as maxing out Handling and Reload Speed. The Search Party origin trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Recommended MW: Stability, with a Backup Mag mod or, when masterworked, when masterworked, Synergy to generate Firesprites or Stunloader when there's a matching artifact mod.|tags:PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller

//notes:Adamsdown_Boy written v8.1.0.4 (PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): PvE first-choice roll for clearing Minor adds in end-game content. Dreadful stats compared to any other energy rapid-fire pulse rifle, but it's still the only non-endgame solar one currently available. The Range of 27 equates to 30.64m ADS and 18.02m hipfire, 19 Handling is 0.48 ready speed, 0.42s ADS speed and 0.48s stow speed, while 27 Reload Speed is 2.30s reload. It's got a wonky recoil direction of 50, so you'll need to straighten that out as much as possible with a Recoil Direction or control it with a Stability barrel perk 9or a bit of both) and then add a bit more stability with the magazine perk with Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell. In the first trait perk slot, Perpetual Motion passively boosts gunfeel stats just by moving about, or Subsistence passively refills your mag on enemy kills. In the second, Desperate Measures provides up to a decent, refreshable ×1.3 damage boost for 7s at three stacks, if you combine weapon and ability kills. The Search Party origin trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. // Jurassic Green (PvE)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), Heal Clip, Incandescent
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy written v8.1.0.4 (PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): PvE first-choice roll for clearing Minor adds in end-game content, particularly with solar builds. Dreadful stats compared to any other energy rapid-fire pulse rifle, but it's still the only non-endgame solar one currently available. The Range of 27 equates to 30.64m ADS and 18.02m hipfire, 19 Handling is 0.48 ready speed, 0.42s ADS speed and 0.48s stow speed, while 27 Reload Speed is 2.30s reload. It's got a wonky recoil direction of 50, so you'll need to straighten that out as much as possible with a Recoil Direction or control it with a Stability barrel perk 9or a bit of both) and then add a bit more stability with the magazine perk with Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell. If you can't run a dungeon, this is the only way you can get the popular Heal Clip/Incandescent trait perk combination - good on their own to spread scorch and ignitions to clear add-dense areas while applying Cure to you and nearby fireteam members on reload after a kill - even better when synergising with solar fragments. The Search Party origin trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Recommended MW: Stability, with a Backup Mag mod or, when masterworked, Synergy to generate Firesprites or Stunloader when there's a matching artifact mod.|tags:PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller

// Jurassic Green (PvE)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), Loose Change, Incandescent
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy written v8.1.0.4 (PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): PvE first-choice roll for clearing Minor adds in end-game content, particularly with solar builds. Dreadful stats compared to any other energy rapid-fire pulse rifle, but it's still the only non-endgame solar one currently available. The Range of 27 equates to 30.64m ADS and 18.02m hipfire, 19 Handling is 0.48 ready speed, 0.42s ADS speed and 0.48s stow speed, while 27 Reload Speed is 2.30s reload. It's got a wonky recoil direction of 50, so you'll need to straighten that out as much as possible with a Recoil Direction or control it with a Stability barrel perk (or a bit of both) and then add a bit more stability with the magazine perk with Tactical Mag or Flared Magwell. There's a rare trait perk pairing of Loose Change and Incandescent available, with the scorch spread by Incandescent kills proccing both +50 reload speed and +20 aim assist boosts, making crits more consistent. It's not essential, but you can use solar fragments to further improve scorch and ignitions. The Search Party origin trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Recommended MW: Stability, with a Backup Mag mod or, when masterworked, Synergy to generate Firesprites or Stunloader when there's a matching artifact mod.|tags:PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller

// Mechabre (PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), Appended Mag, (Triple Tap, Clown Cartridge, Air Trigger), (Firing Line, Vorpal Weapon)
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy written v8.1.0.4 (PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Boss enemies in end-game content. Mechabre (it's so obviously a Transformers pun on Macabre, so let's just pronounce it Mech-ah-bruh) is reportedly excellent in PvP, but like all aggressive snipers it struggles to find a role in PvE. At base, Handling of 26 equates to 0.44s ready speed, 0.45s ADS speed and 0.39s stow speed, and Reload Speed of 30 is a 3.20s reload. With 0/1/2/3 reserve mods, you'll have total ammo of 22/24/26/26 of a max total ammo of 27. As with most snipers, look for a handling-boosting barrel perk, and then Appended Mag with a Backup Mag mod gets you to the maximum of 5 in the mag. If you don't have a well-rolled rapid-fire sniper for backup boss damage, you could start in the first trait perk slot with one of Triple Tap (7 crits before reload), Clown Cartridge (6-8 shots before reload), or Air Trigger to boost Reload Speed by +30 when you start the reload animation off the ground and boost total ammo by the equivalent of 1.5 reserves mods (2 when enhanced). Combine one of those with Firing Line for a ×1.2 damage boost in a fireteam or Vorpal Weapon for a flat ×1.15 boost to majors and bosses in the second. The Search Party origin trait is more PvP-orientated, but faster ADS speed is always nice to have. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags:PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller

// VS Gravitic Arrest (first-choice PvE)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel), (Enhanced Battery, Ionized Battery), Unrelenting, Chain Reaction
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy written v8.1.0.2 (PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): PvE pick for add clearing minor enemies in general and end-game, underleveled content. VS Gravitic Arrest is the first ever legendary void adaptive FR in D2 so, if you've been yearning for one, your wait is over! The stats are on the low side though. At base, 34 Range equates to 15.73m while ADS and 12.10m hipfire, 30 Handling is 0.46s ready, 0.36s ADS speed and 0.36s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 31 is a 2.27s reload. With 0/1/2/3 reserves, you have 20/23/26/27 total ammo. For the barrel perk, Arrowhead Brake or Fluted Barrel pump up the Handling stat. Enhanced Battery gots you to 7 shots or Ionized Battery provides 8 in as the battery perk. TBH, most of the trait perks are PvP focused, but there''s a nice trait perk synergy between Unrelenting and Chain Reaction - any CR detonation kills count as weapon kills for Unrelenting to help keep you alive in CQC. The Bray Legacy origin trait is useful in PvE, working in the background to add ability energy to the one closest to a full charge on every tick of weapon damage. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag mod or, when masterworked, a Tactical mod for bumps to handling and Reload Speed, Synergy to generate Void Breaches, or Stunloader when there's a matching artifact mod.|tags:PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller
dimwishlist:item=93061497&perks=1483536627,2396489472,3108830275,839105230

dimwishlist:item=93061497&perks=2396489472,2680121939,3108830275,839105230
dimwishlist:item=93061497&perks=1840239774,2396489472,2680121939,3108830275

// VS Pyroelectric Propellant (first-choice PvE)
// (Arrowhead brake, Chambered Compensator, Extended Barrel, Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling), (Appended Mag, Extended mag, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell, Light Mag), Eddy Current, Jolting Feedback
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 120 from 29 October 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3tLWOteO62mxx6Yh2Ll4k3?si=bb40d9918c564281) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways (PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add clearing minor enemies in general and end-game, underleveled content, particularly with an Arc build. VS Pyroelectric Propellant is funky-looking arc adaptive auto-rifle with very decent stats. At base, 42 Range equates to 25.60m while ADS, 60 Handling is 0.35s ready, 0.28s ADS speed and 0.32s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 50 is a 1.81s reload. To be honest, you'll be good with pretty much any barrel and magazine perk combination (except maybe Full Bore) - play into your own preferences. If you are looking towards the new-to-season-25 Jolting Feedback trait perk in the second column though, larger magazines work well - you might be able to apply Jolt to three targets before you need to reload. For arc builds, you can pair this with Eddy Current in the first column for gunfeel boosts while Amplified. Jolting Feedback is a great end-game trait perk, applying Jolt on the 16th bullet (12 when Amplified) - and one fewer (15 and 11) when Enhanced - and not requiring a kill to proc. Maybe pair with Sparks of Amplitude, Ions and Discharge or Facets of Awakening and Purpose to synergise with arc builds. The Bray Legacy origin trait is useful in PvE, working in the background to add ability energy to the one closest to a full charge on every tick of weapon damage. Recommended MW: your choice depending on your preference, with a Backup Mag mod or, when masterworked, a Synergy mod for additional Ionic Traces for more frequent Amplification, or Stunloader when there's a matching artifact mod.|tags:PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller

At base, 42 Range equates to 25.60m while ADS, 60 Handling is 0.35s ready, 0.28s ADS speed and 0.32s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 50 is a 1.81s reload. // (Arrowhead brake, Chambered Compensator, Extended Barrel, Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling), (Appended Mag, Extended mag, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell, Light Mag), Attrition Orbs, Jolting Feedback
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 120 from 29 October 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3tLWOteO62mxx6Yh2Ll4k3?si=bb40d9918c564281) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways (PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add clearing minor enemies in general and end-game, underleveled content, particularly with an Arc build. VS Pyroelectric Propellant is funky-looking arc adaptive auto-rifle with very decent stats. At base, 42 Range equates to 25.60m while ADS, 60 Handling is 0.35s ready, 0.28s ADS speed and 0.32s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 50 is a 1.81s reload. To be honest, you'll be good with pretty much any barrel and magazine perk combination (except maybe Full Bore) - play into your own preferences. For end-game activities, Attrition Orbs in the first trait perk column makes a lot of sense to generate orbs, as you'll not get as many from siphon mods, and it works well with Jolting Feedback in the second to apply Jolt passively, not requiring a kill to proc, on the 16th bullet (12 when Amplified) - and one fewer (15 and 11) when Enhanced. Maybe pair with Sparks of Amplitude, Ions and Discharge or Facets of Awakening and Purpose to synergise with arc builds. The Bray Legacy origin trait is useful in PvE, working in the background to add ability energy to the one closest to a full charge on every tick of weapon damage. Recommended MW: your choice depending on your preference, with a Backup Mag mod or, when masterworked, a Synergy mod for additional Ionic Traces for more frequent Amplification, or Stunloader when there's a matching artifact mod.|tags:PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller

// VS Gravitic Arrest (first-choice PvE)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel), (Enhanced Battery, Ionized Battery), Demolitionist, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 120 from 29 October 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3tLWOteO62mxx6Yh2Ll4k3?si=bb40d9918c564281) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways (PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add clearing minor enemies in general and end-game, underleveled content. VS Gravitic Arrest is the first ever legendary void adaptive FR in D2 so, if you've been yearning for one, your wait is over! The stats are on the low side though. At base, 34 Range equates to 15.73m while ADS and 12.10m hipfire, 30 Handling is 0.46s ready, 0.36s ADS speed and 0.36s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 31 is a 2.27s reload. With 0/1/2/3 reserves, you have 20/23/26/27 total ammo. For the barrel perk, Arrowhead Brake or Fluted Barrel pump up the Handling stat. Enhanced Battery gots you to 7 shots or Ionized Battery provides 8 in as the battery perk. TBH, most of the trait perks are PvP focused, but there''s a nice trait perk synergy between Demolitionist and Chain Reaction - you'll get 20% (22% when enhanced) grenade energy from Chain Reaction kills, and then use your grenade for an instant reload. The Bray Legacy origin trait is useful in PvE, working in the background to add ability energy to the one closest to a full charge on every tick of weapon damage. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag mod or, when masterworked, a Tactical mod for bumps to handling and Reload Speed, Synergy to generate Void Breaches, or Stunloader when there's a matching artifact mod.|tags:PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller

// VS Gravitic Arrest (first-choice PvE)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel), (Enhanced Battery, Ionized Battery), Repulsor Brace, Withering Gaze
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 120 from 29 October 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3tLWOteO62mxx6Yh2Ll4k3?si=bb40d9918c564281) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways (PvE PvE-Utility PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE utility pick for majors and bosses in general and end-game, underleveled content, particularly with Void builds. VS Gravitic Arrest is the first ever legendary void adaptive FR in D2 so, if you've been yearning for one, your wait is over! The stats are on the low side though. At base, 34 Range equates to 15.73m while ADS and 12.10m hipfire, 30 Handling is 0.46s ready, 0.36s ADS speed and 0.36s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 31 is a 2.27s reload. With 0/1/2/3 reserves, you have 20/23/26/27 total ammo. For the barrel perk, Arrowhead Brake or Fluted Barrel pump up the Handling stat. Enhanced Battery gots you to 7 shots or Ionized Battery provides 8 in as the battery perk. TBH, most of the trait perks are PvP focused, but there''s a nice trait perk synergy for void subclasses between Repulsor Brace and the new-for-season-25 Withering Gaze, which provides a quick and easy way to apply weaken for an effective ×1.15 damage boost (technically you're debuffing the target, but the calculation's the same). Defeat the target, and you gain a Void Overshield for 8s. The Bray Legacy origin trait is useful in PvE, working in the background to add ability energy to the one closest to a full charge on every tick of weapon damage. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag mod or, when masterworked, a Tactical mod for bumps to handling and Reload Speed, Synergy to generate Void Breaches, or Stunloader when there's a matching artifact mod.|tags:PvE PvE-Utility PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller

// VS Velocity Baton (first-choice PvE)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), High-Velocity Rounds, (Demolitionist, Under-Over, Unrelenting, Repulsor Brace), Attrition Orbs
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 120 from 29 October 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3tLWOteO62mxx6Yh2Ll4k3?si=bb40d9918c564281) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways (PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE utility pick for general and end-game, underleveled content. VS Velocity Baton is the only second Area Denial GL if you 've been looking for a void flamethrower. The stats look pretty good, with pretty much all stats a little better than Lost Signal. With 0/1/2/3 reserves, you have 24/25/25/25 total ammo. For the barrel and mag perks, look to boost velocity without damaging Blast Radius. You'll likely be looking to Attrition Orbs in the second trait perk column and its ability to print multiple orbs with each shot -  it's not clear yet whether this is bugged and in need of a nerf (but it kinda feels like it might). To pair with that in the first trait column, Demolitionist should get grenade ability back quickly to use as a reload perk, Under-Over should quickly cook non-matching elemental shields and the hidden damage resistance shields of Subjugators, or Unrelenting provides health regeneration. If you have access to void debuffs, Repulsor Brace is another option, to gain Void Overshields. The Bray Legacy origin trait is useful in PvE, working in the background to add ability energy to the one closest to a full charge on every tick of weapon damage. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag mod or, when masterworked, a Tactical mod for bumps to handling and Reload Speed, Synergy to generate Void Breaches, or Stunloader when there's a matching artifact mod.|tags:PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller

VS Velocity Baton is the only second Area Denial GL if you 've been looking for a void flamethrower. The stats look pretty good, with pretty much all stats a little better than Lost Signal. With 0/1/2/3 reserves, you have 24/25/25/25 total ammo. For the barrel and mag perks, look to boost velocity without damaging Blast Radius. The void build synergy of Repulsor Brace in the first trait perk column, for Void Overshields on debuffed targets, and Destabilizing Rounds in the second, to spready volatility to nearby enemies should be entertaining when you're dealing with dense add crowds. // VS Chill Inhibitor (first-choice PvE)
// (Hard Launch, Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), (Spike Grenades, Augmented Drum, Mini Frags), Envious Arsenal, Bait and Switch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 120 from 29 October 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3tLWOteO62mxx6Yh2Ll4k3?si=bb40d9918c564281) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways (PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against bosses in general and end-game, underleveled content. VS Chill Inhibitor is the first rapid fire Stasis heavy GL. The stats are excellent. At base, 59 Velocity equates to 52.26m/s, 25 Handling is 0.48s ready, 0.45s ADS speed and 0.43s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 29 is a 3.47s reload. With 0/1/2/3 reserves, you have 34/36/38/39 total ammo. For the barrel perk, if you have Spike Grenades as your magazine Perk, Hard Launch squeezes a little extra damage as well as providing the biggest Velocity boost, otherwise Quick Launch and Smart Drift Control also work well. To get the most out of your magazine size, Augmented Drum or Mini Frags are decent magazine perk alternatives. The trait perk pairing of Envious Arsenal and Bait and Switch both proc on the same condition of damaging a target with your other weapons to reload the mag, and boost damage by ×1.3 for 10s. The Bray Legacy origin trait is useful in PvE, working in the background to add ability energy to the one closest to a full charge on every tick of weapon damage. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling, with Quick Access Sling mod or Backup Mag mod to get to the maximum of 8 shots.|tags:PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller
dimwishlist:item=1762785662&perks=3078487919,3301904089,3525010810,3987942396
dimwishlist:item=1762785662&perks=3078487919,3301904089,3798852852,3987942396

// Exuviae (first-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell), Rimestealer, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 119 from 22 October 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6CEZXurwhqejVZpX506M2a?si=7ef44c5f06ae4412) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways, and @CourtProjects (PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add clearing minor enemies in general, non-underleveled content, particularly with a Stasis build. Exuviae is only the second Stasis aggressive hand cannon and, while the stats are pretty much in-band, has a new trick that makes it worth looking at. At base, 61 Range equates to 35.23m while ADS, 32 Handling is 0.38s ready, 0.28s ADS speed and 0.42s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 29 is a 2.46s reload. On controller, you might benefit from some stability from the barrel perk or, if you prefer, focus on handling. You could look to boost Reload Speed with the magazine perk but, if you're willing to play into the Dark Ether origin trait, you'll get value from boosting the magazine size. For Stasis synergy, the new-to-season-25 trait perk Rimestealer is a natural pairing to Headstone - break the stasis crystal generated from a crit kill, or a frozen enemy, to generate a stack of Frost Armor (two stacks when enhanced). The Dark Ether origin trait is one of the best in the sandbox for PvE - generate a Dark Ether charge for 5s from kills, and then shoot with any weapon (or run into) the charge to proc a Dragonfly-type detonation which also overflows your weapon to ×1.4 (rounded up) base capacity or ×1.8 when enhanced, completely bypassing reload. For anyone interested, exuviae are sloughed off natural animal coverings, such as arthropods after they molt. Recommended MW: Stability (Controller) or Handling (M+KB), with a Backup Mag mod or, when enhanced, a Synergy mod for additional Stasis shards.|tags:PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller
dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=106909392,124408337,1840239774,1955165503
dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=106909392,124408337,1392496348,1955165503
dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=106909392,124408337,1955165503,4090651448
dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=1087426260,124408337,1840239774,1955165503
dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=1087426260,124408337,1392496348,1955165503
dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=1087426260,124408337,1955165503,4090651448
dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=124408337,1840239774,1955165503,3230963543
dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=124408337,1392496348,1955165503,3230963543
dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=124408337,1955165503,3230963543,4090651448

// Exuviae (first-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell), Stats for All, (One for All, Frenzy, Explosive Payload)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 119 from 22 October 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6CEZXurwhqejVZpX506M2a?si=7ef44c5f06ae4412) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways, and @CourtProjects (PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add clearing minor enemies in both general and end-game, underleveled content. Exuviae is only the second Stasis aggressive hand cannon and, while the stats are pretty much in-band, offers a solid kinetic-slot option for anyone who doesn't already have one - if you do, you can safely pass. At base, 61 Range equates to 35.23m while ADS, 32 Handling is 0.38s ready, 0.28s ADS speed and 0.42s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 29 is a 2.46s reload. On controller, you might benefit from some stability from the barrel perk or, if you prefer, focus on handling. You could look to boost Reload Speed with the magazine perk but, if you're willing to play into the Dark Ether origin trait, you'll get value from boosting the magazine size. For trait perks, there's the fan-favourite SOFA roll of Stats for All and One for All, boosting gunfeel and damage by ×1.35 for 10s for hitting three enemies, or Frenzy to max out handling and reload and boost damage by ×1.15 just for being in combat for 12s, or good old Explosive Payload for a straight ×1.15 damage boost with no proccing. The Dark Ether origin trait is one of the best in the sandbox for PvE - generate a Dark Ether charge for 5s from kills, and then shoot with any weapon (or run into) the charge to proc a Dragonfly-type detonation which also overflows your weapon to ×1.4 (rounded up) base capacity or ×1.8 when enhanced, completely bypassing reload. For anyone interested, exuviae are sloughed off natural animal coverings, such as arthropods after they molt. Recommended MW: Stability (Controller) or Handling (M+KB), with a Backup Mag mod.|tags:PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-God M+KB Controller

dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=106909392,1392496348,1583705720,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=2823644677&perks=106909392,1583705720,4090651448,4104185692

// Liturgy (first-choice PvE)
// Volatile Launch, Spike Grenades, (Rimestealer, Slideways), (Chill Clip, One for All, Chain Reaction)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 119 from 22 October 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6CEZXurwhqejVZpX506M2a?si=7ef44c5f06ae4412) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways, and @CourtProjects (PvE PvE-Utility PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE utility pick for crowd control in both general and end-game, underleveled content. Liturgy is the fourth double fire GL, and the first Stasis energy type with a weirdly lower Blast Radius of 40 - that aside, the stats are decent. At base, 89 Velocity equates to 63.78m/s, 47 Handling is 0.42s ready, 0.41s ADS speed and 0.38s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 32 is a 2.62s reload. At base, with 0, 1, 2 or 3 chest reserves mods, you'll get total ammo of 22/23/24/25 which can be boosted by trait perks. For a general purpose crowd control roll, maximise the Blast Radius with Volatile Launch and then, as there's no other magazine perk options that really work, Spike Grenades provides a ×1.027 damage boost on direct impacts. As the trait perks, in the first column Rimestealer can work if you have access to other Stasis verbs as part of your build, to generate Frost Armor on frozen enemy kills or stasis crystal shattering, or bypass reloads with Slideways. In the second, Chill Clip pairs well with Rimestealer, One for All procs easily on double-fire GLs for a ×1.35 damage boost, or Chain Reaction adds AoE damage on enemy kills and boosts ammo reserves when enhanced. The Dark Ether origin trait is one of the best in the sandbox for PvE - generate a Dark Ether charge for 5s from kills, and then shoot with any weapon (or run into) the charge to proc a Dragonfly-type detonation which also overflows your weapon to ×1.4 (rounded up) base capacity or ×1.8 when enhanced, completely bypassing reload. For anyone interested, a liturgy is a form or formulary according to which public religious worship, is conducted. Recommended MW: Blast Radius, with a Quick Access Sling mod, or possibly a Tactical mod when enhanced.|tags:PvE PvE-Utility PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller

// Liturgy (PvE)
// Hard Launch, (Implosion Rounds, Spike Grenades), (Envious Arsenal, Slideways), Chill Clip
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy written v8.1.0.2 (PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): PvE pick for a boss damage rotation in both general and end-game, underleveled content, particularly with Stasis builds. Liturgy is the fourth double fire GL, and the first Stasis energy type with a weirdly lower Blast Radius of 40 (which is actually a plus for this roll), the stats are decent. At base, 89 Velocity equates to 63.78m/s, 47 Handling is 0.42s ready, 0.41s ADS speed and 0.38s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 32 is a 2.62s reload. At base, with 0, 1, 2 or 3 chest reserves mods, you'll get total ammo of 22/23/24/25 which can be boosted by trait perks. Counter-intuitively, for single-target damage, the lower the blast radius, the more damage you cause, so reduce the low BR even further with Hard Launch as the barrel perk, and Implosion Rounds in the magazine - although Spike Grenades, for its ×1.027 damage boost on direct impacts, is also very good. If you're using this in a Bait and Switch weapon rotation, Envious Arsenal in the first trait column will reload (and also boosts ammo reserves by the equivalent of 1 reserves mod, or 2 when enhanced), or if not, and you're moving between damage plates, Slideways does the same. There's no useful damage perk in the second column, but if you have Chill Clip, then you can use Prismatic's Facet of Courage for a ×1.1 damage multiplier with a light-based heavy weapon or super. You won't get much use from the excellent Dark Ether origin trait from this roll, unfortunately, as it's more about setting up for boss damage than kills. For anyone interested, a liturgy is a form or formulary according to which public religious worship, is conducted. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling, with a Quick Access Sling mod.|tags:PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller

// Chronophage (first-choice PvE)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel), Enhanced Battery, Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 115 from 6 September 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6axWXT6NCn4jZVuRkCTfiu?si=72aafbad8138409a) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add clearing minor enemies in end-game content, particularly with void builds. Chronophage is only the second legendary void trace rifle since season 17 and, unfortunately its stats are on the low side. At base, 67 Range equates to 34.51m while ADS, 51 handling is 0.38s ready, 0.29s ADS speed and 0.35s stow speed, while the reload speed of 44 is a 2.06s reload. Total ammo is the lowest of its peers at only 430 out of the box (478/527/551 with 1/2/3 reserve mods), so to be useful this does need addressing. On controller, Stability is useful to keep the beam on a crit area, or if you're using M+KB you can add Handling with the barrel park. For the battery perk, Enhanced Battery boosts the total ammo to 456 (508/559/585) and with Backup Mag added gets to 461 (513/565/591). For end-game use, this is the first time the Repulsor Brace + Destabilizing Rounds trait combination has been available on a trace rifle, for clearing add crowds while providing a void overshield to keep safe. The Radiolaria Transposer origin trait is extra AoE damage that inherits the weapon's damage multiplier, so the initial explosion can be more damaging than a special ammo Chain Reaction explosion - what's not to love? For anyone interested, the name's derived from Greek words "chronos" and "phage", literally meaning "time-eater" and is used colloquially in French to mean "time-consuming". Recommended MW: Stability (Controller) or Handling (M+KB), with a Backup Mag mod.|tags:PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller

Breachlight is back, this time as a Strand version of the heavy burst sidearm. Its stats are decent at base - 48 Range equates to 15.50m while ADS, 35 Handling is 0.33s ready, 0.27s ADS speed and 0.36s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 23 is a 1.87s reload. The range is pretty compressed on sidearms, so you'll probably feel the most benefit with barrel perks that boost handling, and then look to boost your magazine size, preferably while not harming reload too much with the mag perk. Desperate Measures is a really strong second trait column damage perk, providing up to a ×1.3 boost for Guardians that actively use their abilities, and is very easy to proc while transcendent. To pair with that, in the first column, Demolitionist and Pugilist look like natural partners, or if gunfeel is more important to you Threat Detector should be proccing constantly. The Cast No Shadows origin trait is great for topping off roughly 20% of your magazine and boosting handling for a short time on dealing melee damage. If you're interested, a Speleologist is someone involved in the scientific study or exploration of caves. // Breachlight (first-choice PvE)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel), (Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag), (Threat Detector, Demolitionist, Pugilist), Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 115 from 6 September 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6axWXT6NCn4jZVuRkCTfiu?si=72aafbad8138409a) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add clearing minor enemies in end-game content, particularly with Strand builds. Breachlight is back, this time as a Strand version of the heavy burst sidearm. Its stats are decent at base - 48 Range equates to 15.50m while ADS, 35 Handling is 0.33s ready, 0.27s ADS speed and 0.36s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 23 is a 1.87s reload. The range is pretty compressed on sidearms, so you'll probably feel the most benefit with barrel perks that boost handling, and then look to boost your magazine size, preferably while not harming reload too much with the mag perk. To synergise with a Strand build using Hatchling in the second trait column to generate Threadlings for extra damage, Threat Detector boosts overall gunfeel, or Demolitionist or Pugilist generate ability energy. The Cast No Shadows origin trait is great for topping off roughly 20% of your magazine and boosting handling for a short time on dealing melee damage. If you're interested, a Speleologist is someone involved in the scientific study or exploration of caves. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags:PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller

// Patron of Lost Causes (first-choice PvE)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Polygonal Rifles), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Appended Mag), Rapid Hit (Kinetic Tremors, Explosive Payload)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 115 from 6 September 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6axWXT6NCn4jZVuRkCTfiu?si=72aafbad8138409a) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor in end-game content. Okay, Scout Rifles aren't meta and, if you do opt for one, Rapid Fire frames are most people's top choice subfamily, but don't pass too fast on Patron of Lost Causes. It's a lightweight frame, so you gain +20 mobility and +6.25% movement speed to start. Its stats are in-band at base - 33 Range equates to 70.85m while ADS, 63 Handling is 0.36s ready, 0.30s ADS speed and 0.34s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 53 is a 1.94s reload. With it being fast-firing, recoil control needs looking at, either with Arrowhead Brake or Polygonal Rifling as the barrel perk. As the magazine perk, Tactical Mag offers a bit of everything, but Flared Magwell and Appended Mag are worth a look too. In the first trait perk column, Rapid Hit helps with both recoil control and reload on crit hits, while to boost damage, Kinetic Tremors is good for a bit of flinch and AoE damage after 6 hits, or Explosive Payload does much the same job is a smaller area. The Cast No Shadows origin trait is great for topping off roughly 20% of your magazine and boosting handling for a short time on dealing melee damage. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags:PvE PvE-MinorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller
dimwishlist:item=2249996761&perks=106909392,247725512,3891536761,839105230
dimwishlist:item=2249996761&perks=247725512,3230963543,3891536761,839105230
dimwishlist:item=2249996761&perks=1087426260,247725512,3891536761,839105230

// Line in the Sand (first-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake), Ionized Battery, (Rapid Hit, Clown Cartridge), Bait and Switch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 115 from 6 September 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6axWXT6NCn4jZVuRkCTfiu?si=72aafbad8138409a) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against bosses in end-game content. Line in the Sand is back from the great sunsetting and provides an avenue for new players to obtain a solid arc LFR if you don't already have one. Its stats are decent at base - 26 Handling equates to 0.46s ready, 0.37s ADS speed and 0.37s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 23 is a 2.44s reload and you'll start with 23 total ammo (24/26/27 with 1/2/3 reserve mods). Handling can be improved with the right barrel perk, to improve snappiness and, with there being only one way to the maximum battery size of 7 shots, which is Ionized Battery and a Backup Mag mod (although this does increase reload time to 2.81s). In the trait perk slots, for boss damage, Rapid Hit can offset the reload speed malus - 5 crits bring the reload to 1.72s and boost stability by 25 to make landing crits easier or, if you can live with the slow reload, Clown Cartridge can overflow your mag so it's at 8-11 shots. Pair one of those with Bait and Switch for a ×1.3 damage boost for 10s when procced. Unless you're using a ranged melee, you probably won't see much benefit from the Cast No Shadows origin trait which reloads, and boosts handling for a short time on dealing melee damage. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags:PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller
dimwishlist:item=2450049485&perks=1483536627,1840239774,247725512,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=2450049485&perks=1483536627,247725512,3078487919,839105230
dimwishlist:item=2450049485&perks=1483536627,1840239774,2284787283,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=2450049485&perks=1483536627,2284787283,3078487919,839105230

// Line in the Sand (first-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake), (Enhanced Battery, Ionized Battery), Clown Cartridge, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 115 from 6 September 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6axWXT6NCn4jZVuRkCTfiu?si=72aafbad8138409a) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE PvE-Boss PvE-MajorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Majors, Minibosses and Champions in end-game content. Line in the Sand is back from the great sunsetting and provides an avenue for new players to obtain a solid arc LFR if you don't already have one. Its stats are decent at base - 26 Handling equates to 0.46s ready, 0.37s ADS speed and 0.37s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 23 is a 2.44s reload and you'll start with 23 total ammo (24/26/27 with 1/2/3 reserve mods). Handling can be improved with the right barrel perk, to improve snappiness and, the maximum battery size of 7 shots, can be achieved with Enhanced or Ionized Battery (although this does increase reload time to 2.81s), plus Backup Mag and the Reservoir Burst trait. In the first trait perk slot, for burst damage, Clown Cartridge can overflow your mag so it's at 8-11 shots. Reservoir Burst will apply a ×1.25 damage boost to the first 2-5 shots, and proc an explosion on a kill for chunky AoE damage. Unless you're using a ranged melee, you probably won't see much benefit from the Cast No Shadows origin trait which reloads, and boosts handling for a short time on dealing melee damage. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags:PvE PvE-Boss PvE-MajorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller
dimwishlist:item=2450049485&perks=1427256713,1840239774,2284787283,2680121939

// Breachlight (first-choice PvE)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel), (Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag), Slice, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy written v8.0.5.4 (PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-MajorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): PvE utility pick for use against major and boss enemies in end-game content, particularly with Strand builds. Breachlight is back, this time as a Strand version of the heavy burst sidearm. Its stats are decent at base - 48 Range equates to 15.50m while ADS, 35 Handling is 0.33s ready, 0.27s ADS speed and 0.36s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 23 is a 1.87s reload. The range is pretty compressed on sidearms, so you'll probably feel the most benefit with barrel perks that boost handling, and then look to boost your magazine size, preferably while not harming reload too much with the mag perk. As a utility pick, pairing Slice in the first trait column, particularly on a Hunter with the quick dodge cooldown, to apply the Sever verb to up to five targets and reduce their damage output by 40% (that's a multiplier of ×0.6 - very handy against heavy-hitting enemies, working even when they're immune). In the second column Vorpal Weapon boosts damage by ×1.2 against majors and bosses with no proccing, which makes this an excellent choice for use in a Bait and Switch weapon rotation. The Cast No Shadows origin trait is great for topping off roughly 20% of your magazine and boosting handling for a short time on dealing melee damage. If you're interested, a Speleologist is someone involved in the scientific study or exploration of caves. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags:PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-MajorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller

// Patron of Lost Causes (first-choice PvE)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Polygonal Rifles), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Appended Mag), Triple Tap (Precision Instrument, Focused Fury)
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy written v8.0.5.4 (PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-MajorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller): PvE pick for add clearing Minor in end-game content. Okay, Scout Rifles aren't meta and, if you do opt for one, Rapid Fire frames are most people's top choice subfamily, but don't pass too fast on Patron of Lost Causes. It's a lightweight frame, so you gain +20 mobility and +6.25% movement speed to start. Its stats are in-band at base - 33 Range equates to 70.85m while ADS, 63 Handling is 0.36s ready, 0.30s ADS speed and 0.34s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 53 is a 1.94s reload. With it being fast-firing, recoil control needs looking at, either with Arrowhead Brake or Polygonal Rifling as the barrel perk. As the magazine perk, Tactical Mag offers a bit of everything, but Flared Magwell and Appended Mag are worth a look too. If you're able to hit consistent crits, the trait perk combination of Triple Tap and either Precision Instrument or Focused Fury will help keep the higher damage stacks up for longer before reloading. The Cast No Shadows origin trait is great for topping off roughly 20% of your magazine and boosting handling for a short time on dealing melee damage. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags:PvE PvE-Boss PvE-BossSpec PvE-MajorSpec PvE-EndGame PvE-God M+KB Controller
