Line in the Sand is back from the great sunsetting and provides an avenue for new players to obtain a solid arc LFR if you don't already have one. Its stats are decent at base - 26 Handling equates to 0.46s ready, 0.37s ADS speed and 0.37s stow speed, while the Reload Speed of 23 is a 2.44s reload and you'll start with 23 total ammo (24/26/27 with 1/2/3 reserve mods). Handling can be improved with the right barrel perk, to improve snappiness and, with there being only one way to the maximum battery size of 7 shots, which is Ionized Battery and a Backup Mag mod (although this does increase reload time to 2.81s). In the trait perk slots, for boss damage, Rapid Hit can offset the reload speed malus - 5 crits bring the reload to 1.72s and boost stability by 25 to make landing crits easier or, if you can live with the slow reload, Clown Cartridge can overflow your mag so it's at 8-11 shots. For an easy ×1.2 damage boost with easy proccing conditions (just stand near your fireteam), Firing Line is still a decent choice. Unless you're using a ranged melee, you probably won't see much benefit from the Cast No Shadows origin trait which reloads, and boosts handling for a short time on dealing melee damage. // Imminence (first-choice PvE)
// (Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling), (Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Alloy Mag), Slice, Chaos Reshaped
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 111 from 30 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4KO3Yr8AkPRBgKlNmacrGS?si=6dfa9e466dde41a0) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects (PvE / PvE-Utility / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for a Bait and Switch rotation weapon end-game actives, particularly with ability-focussed builds. Shapeable. Base stats are okay by comparison to its peers and equate to 17.24m ADS range before damage dropoff, 0.23s ADS speed, 0.31s ready and 0.27s stow speed, and 2.17s reload speed. Even if you hit 100 recoil, it's still tough to control on controller, so look to boost stability with your barrel and mag perks - a little extra reload speed never hurts too. If you want a primary to use in a boss damage phase, particularly on Hunter, then Slice will sever after a dodge reload, for -40% damage reduction to outgoing boss damage. While you're not going to be using this as your primary damage option, Chaos Reshaped should be procced while stowed for both stacks, so you should get the +35% damage and maybe a burst of healing when you use it with a Bait and Switch heavy weapon. The Collective Purpose origin trait only works in a fireteam, but offers small boosts to range and handling, which is always useful. Recommended MW: Stability or Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod.
dimwishlist:item=1258168956&perks=1482024992,3230963543,3640170453,923806249
dimwishlist:item=1258168956&perks=106909392,1482024992,3640170453,923806249

Shapeable. Base stats are okay by comparison to its peers and equate to 17.24m ADS range before damage dropoff, 0.23s ADS speed, 0.31s ready and 0.27s stow speed, and 2.17s reload speed. Even if you hit 100 recoil, it's still tough to control on controller, so look to boost stability with your barrel and mag perks - a little extra reload speed never hurts too. If you want a primary to use in a boss damage phase, particularly on Hunter, then Slice will sever after a dodge reload, for -40% damage reduction to outgoing boss damage. // Critical Anomaly (first-choice PvE)
// Fluted Barrel, Extended Mag, Reconstruction, (Chaos Reshaped, Firing Line, Bait and Switch)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 111 from 30 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4KO3Yr8AkPRBgKlNmacrGS?si=6dfa9e466dde41a0) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects (PvE / PvE-Boss/ PvE-MajorSpec / PvE-BossSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for backup Boss damage. Shapeable. Base stats are excellent by comparison to its peers, and equate to 0.45s ADS speed, 0.44s ready and 0.39s stow speed, and 3.30s reload speed. Handling is always useful on aggressive snipers - stability is less of a concern if you pace your shots - so Fluted Barrel is the barrel perk to choose. Even though it tanks your reload to 3.72s, Extended Mag plus a Backup Mag mod takes you to 5 shots. You can double this with Reconstruction in the first trait column and then, for a backup boss damage weapon, in the second column, Chaos Reshaped is likely to have built up two stacks in your back pocket for a chunky +35% damage boost and occasional bit of healing, or Firing Line provides an easy +20% to damage just for standing near your fireteam. Alternatively, time your Bait and Switch rotation for +35% damage. The Collective Purpose origin trait only works in a fireteam, but offers small boosts to range and handling, which is always useful. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.
dimwishlist:item=445197843&perks=1523832109,1771339417,1840239774,2420895100
dimwishlist:item=445197843&perks=1523832109,1840239774,2420895100,3078487919

// Critical Anomaly (Adept) (first-choice PvE)
// Fluted Barrel, Tactical Mag, Reconstruction, (Chaos Reshaped, Firing Line, Bait and Switch)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 111 from 30 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4KO3Yr8AkPRBgKlNmacrGS?si=6dfa9e466dde41a0) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects (PvE / PvE-Boss/ PvE-MajorSpec / PvE-BossSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for backup Boss damage. Shapeable. Base stats are excellent by comparison to its peers, and equate to 0.45s ADS speed, 0.44s ready and 0.39s stow speed, and 3.30s reload speed. Handling is always useful on aggressive snipers - stability is less of a concern if you pace your shots - so Fluted Barrel is the barrel perk to choose. Tactical Mag plus an Adept Backup Mag mod takes you to 5 shots (and boosts a couple of useful stats a little). You can double this with Reconstruction in the first trait column and then, for a backup boss damage weapon, in the second column, Chaos Reshaped is likely to have built up two stacks in your back pocket for a chunky +35% damage boost and occasional bit of healing, or Firing Line provides an easy +20% to damage just for standing near your fireteam. Alternatively, time your Bait and Switch rotation for +35% damage. The Collective Purpose origin trait only works in a fireteam, but offers small boosts to range and handling, which is always useful. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.

dimwishlist:item=172461430&perks=106909392,1523832109,1771339417,1840239774

// Non-Denouement (first-choice PvE)
// Elastic String, Straight Fletching, (Archer's Tempo, Dragonfly), Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 111 from 30 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4KO3Yr8AkPRBgKlNmacrGS?si=6dfa9e466dde41a0) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec red-bar adds in end-game content, particularly with an arc build. Shapeable. Non-Dénouement is French for "No final outcome" - make of that what you will! Base stats are good by comparison to its peers, and equate to a 0.622s draw time, 0.42s perfect draw window, 0.43s ADS speed, 0.58s ready and 0.44s stow speed, and 0.78s reload speed. As with most bows, the bowstring and arrow perks will reduce the draw time with Elastic String (reduces to 0.556s), and recover the lost accuracy with Straight Fletching. The roll that everyone's looking for is the "baby" Trinity Ghoul, with Voltshot in the second trait column for jolting and chaining arc damage - which you can improve on with arc aspects and fragments. To pair with this in the first column, Archer's Tempo is reliable as ever, reducing draw time to 0.417s after a crit hit but, if you're after all the explosions, Dragonfly is there too. The Collective Purpose origin trait only works in a fireteam, but offers a small boost to draw speed, which is always useful. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a Quick Access Sling or Sprint Grip mod.
dimwishlist:item=1770490683&perks=201365942,2173046394,2801223209,3827198035
dimwishlist:item=1770490683&perks=2173046394,2801223209,2848615171,3827198035

// Non-Denouement (Adept) (first-choice PvE)
// Elastic String, Straight Fletching, (Archer's Tempo, Dragonfly), Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 111 from 30 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4KO3Yr8AkPRBgKlNmacrGS?si=6dfa9e466dde41a0) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec red-bar adds in end-game content, particularly with an arc build. Shapeable. Non-Dénouement is French for "No final outcome" - make of that what you will! Base stats are good by comparison to its peers, and equate to a 0.622s draw time, 0.42s perfect draw window, 0.43s ADS speed, 0.58s ready and 0.44s stow speed, and 0.78s reload speed. As with most bows, the bowstring and arrow perks will reduce the draw time with Elastic String (reduces to 0.556s), and recover the lost accuracy with Straight Fletching. The roll that everyone's looking for is the "baby" Trinity Ghoul, with Voltshot in the second trait column for jolting and chaining arc damage - which you can improve on with arc aspects and fragments. To pair with this in the first column, Archer's Tempo is reliable as ever, reducing draw time to 0.417s after a crit hit but, if you're after all the explosions, Dragonfly is there too. // Nullify (first-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), Heal Clip, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 111 from 30 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4KO3Yr8AkPRBgKlNmacrGS?si=6dfa9e466dde41a0) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec red-bar adds in general content, particularly with solar builds. Shapeable. Nullify offers a stacked trait perk set, in the best pulse rifle subfamily. Base stats are very good and equate to 37.40m ADS range before damage dropoff, 0.39s ADS speed, 0.44s ready and 0.43s stow speed, and 2.05s reload speed. The recoil isn't too bad, if you pace your shots but the handling and reload speed could do with some help from the barrel and mag perks. It's not as uncommon as it once was, but the trait combination of Heal Clip and Incandescent is still great for keeping you alive while clearing add-dense areas - even better when synergising with solar fragments. The Collective Purpose origin trait only works in a fireteam, but offers small boosts to range and handling, which is always useful. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.

// Nullify (first-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Alloy Mag), Firefly, (Desperate Measures, Chaos Reshaped)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 111 from 30 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4KO3Yr8AkPRBgKlNmacrGS?si=6dfa9e466dde41a0) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec red-bar adds in end-game content, particularly with solar builds. Shapeable. Nullify offers a stacked trait perk set, in the best pulse rifle subfamily. Base stats are very good and equate to 37.40m ADS range before damage dropoff, 0.39s ADS speed, 0.44s ready and 0.43s stow speed, and 2.05s reload speed. The recoil isn't too bad, if you pace your shots but the handling and reload speed could do with some help from the barrel and mag perks. In the first trait column, Firefly is an additional AoE damage perk that also boosts Reload Speed by 50 on a crit kill. Pair that in the second column with Desperate Measures for up to +30% damage or maybe Chaos Reshaped for +35% damage and healing at two stacks. The Collective Purpose origin trait only works in a fireteam, but offers small boosts to range and handling, which is always useful. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod.

// Summum Bonum (first-choice PvE)
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, (Relentless Strikes, Attrition Orbs), (Bait and Switch, Whirlwind Blade, Surrounded, Chaos Reshaped)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 111 from 30 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4KO3Yr8AkPRBgKlNmacrGS?si=6dfa9e466dde41a0) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects (PvE / PvE-Boss / PvE-BossSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for sustained boss DPS in end-game activities. Shapeable. Summon Bonum is a Latin expression meaning "the supreme good from which all others are derived", and also now an interesting sword too. Stats are pretty much uniform with swords, and this is our first legendary wave frame - much like a a grenade launcher with the heavy attack, with a follow-up targeted attack - hopefully to finish off a weakened enemy. For a boss damage roll, Jagged Edge - with an Backup Mag mod and three reserves mods you'll have 68 ammo, only 2 shy of the maximum of 70 - and Swordmaster's Guard are the usual safe pairing for the blade and guard perks. In trait column one you've got a choice - Relentless Strikes returns one ammo for every third hit but Attrition Orbs might not be the worst call as, with the heavy wave attack you'll get multiple hits counting towards the 10 you need to generate an orb, which you can use to keep weapon surges active, and heal. In the second column Bait and Switch offers a 35% damage bonus when procced, or you could use Whirlwind Blade for up to 30%, Surrounded (depending on the encounter and whether you have adds around or not) for +35% (+41.75% when enhanced). Chaos Reshaped might work, but it'll depend how long you're out of combat (you only have 5s of not dealing or taking damage) before a boss damage phase begins. The Collective Purpose origin trait only works in a fireteam, but offers a small boosts to charge rate, which is always useful. Recommended MW: Impact, with a Backup Mag mod.
dimwishlist:item=3569407878&perks=1749209109,269888150,3078487919,3666208348
dimwishlist:item=3569407878&perks=1749209109,269888150,3640170453,3666208348

// Summum Bonum (Adept) (first-choice PvE)
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, (Relentless Strikes, Attrition Orbs), (Bait and Switch, Whirlwind Blade, Surrounded, Chaos Reshaped)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 111 from 30 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4KO3Yr8AkPRBgKlNmacrGS?si=6dfa9e466dde41a0) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects (PvE / PvE-Boss / PvE-BossSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for sustained boss DPS in end-game activities. Shapeable. Summon Bonum is a Latin expression meaning "the supreme good from which all others are derived", and also now an interesting sword too. Stats are pretty much uniform with swords, and this is our first legendary wave frame - much like a a grenade launcher with the heavy attack, with a follow-up targeted attack - hopefully to finish off a weakened enemy. For a boss damage roll, Jagged Edge and Swordmaster's Guard are the usual safe pairing for the blade and guard perks. In trait column one you've got a choice - Relentless Strikes returns one ammo for every third hit but Attrition Orbs might not be the worst call as, with the heavy wave attack you'll get multiple hits counting towards the 10 you need to generate an orb, which you can use to keep weapon surges active, and heal. In the second column Bait and Switch offers a 35% damage bonus when procced, or you could use Whirlwind Blade for up to 30%, Surrounded (depending on the encounter and whether you have adds around or not) for +35% (+41.75% when enhanced). Chaos Reshaped might work, but it'll depend how long you're out of combat (you only have 5s of not dealing or taking damage) before a boss damage phase begins. The Collective Purpose origin trait only works in a fireteam, but offers a small boosts to charge rate, which is always useful. Recommended MW: Impact, with an Adept Impact mod.
dimwishlist:item=2001697739&perks=1749209109,269888150,3078487919,3666208348

// Critical Anomaly (PvE)
// Arrowhead Brake, Extended Mag, Reconstruction, (Chaos Reshaped, Firing Line)
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy written v8.0.0.8 (PvE / PvE-Boss/ PvE-MajorSpec / PvE-BossSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): PvE pick for anti-Champion use. Shapeable. Base stats are excellent by comparison to its peers, and equate to 0.45s ADS speed, 0.44s ready and 0.39s stow speed, and 3.30s reload speed. Handling is always useful on aggressive snipers - stability is less of a concern if you pace your shots - Arrowhead Brake boosts recoil direction to 100, and adds 10 to Handling. Even though it tanks your reload to 3.72s, Extended Mag plus a Backup Mag mod takes you to 5 shots. You can double this with Reconstruction in the first trait column and then, for a backup boss damage weapon in the second column, Chaos Reshaped is likely to have built up two stacks in your back pocket for a chunky +35% damage boost, or Firing Line provides an easy +20% to damage just for standing near your fireteam. The Collective Purpose origin trait only works in a fireteam, but offers small boosts to range and handling, which is always useful. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.
dimwishlist:item=445197843&perks=1523832109,1771339417,2420895100,839105230

// Critical Anomaly (Adept) (first-choice PvE)
// Fluted Barrel, Tactical Mag, Reconstruction, (Chaos Reshaped, Firing Line)
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy written v8.0.0.8 (PvE / PvE-Boss/ PvE-MajorSpec / PvE-BossSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): PvE pick for anti-Champion use. Shapeable. Base stats are excellent by comparison to its peers, and equate to 0.45s ADS speed, 0.44s ready and 0.39s stow speed, and 3.30s reload speed. Handling is always useful on aggressive snipers - stability is less of a concern if you pace your shots - Arrowhead Brake boosts recoil direction to 100, and adds 10 to Handling. Tactical Mag plus an Adept Backup Mag mod takes you to 5 shots (and boosts a couple of useful stats a little). You can double this with Reconstruction in the first trait column and then, for a backup boss damage weapon in the second column, Chaos Reshaped is likely to have built up two stacks in your back pocket for a chunky +35% damage boost, or Firing Line provides an easy +20% to damage just for standing near your fireteam. The Collective Purpose origin trait only works in a fireteam, but offers small boosts to range and handling, which is always useful. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.

// Non-Denouement (PvE)
// (Flexible String, Polymer String), Straight Fletching, (Archer's Tempo, Dragonfly), Voltshot
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy written v8.0.0.8 (PvE / PvE-Boss/ PvE-MajorSpec / PvE-BossSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec red-bar adds in end-game content, particularly with an arc build. Shapeable. Non-Dénouement is French for "No final outcome" - make of that what you will! Base stats are good by comparison to its peers, and equate to a 0.622s draw time, 0.42s perfect draw window, 0.43s ADS speed, 0.58s ready and 0.44s stow speed, and 0.78s reload speed. As with most bows, the bowstring and arrow perks will reduce the draw time and improve accuracy. The roll that everyone's looking for is the "baby" Trinity Ghoul, with Voltshot in the second trait column for jolting and chaining arc damage - which you can improve on with arc aspects and fragments. To pair with this in the first column, Archer's Tempo is reliable as ever, reducing draw time further after a crit hit but, if you're after all the explosions, Dragonfly is there too. The Collective Purpose origin trait only works in a fireteam, but offers a small boost draw speed, which is always useful. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a Quick Access Sling or Sprint Grip mod.
dimwishlist:item=1770490683&perks=201365942,2173046394,3827198035,4067834857
dimwishlist:item=1770490683&perks=201365942,2173046394,3827198035,852209214
dimwishlist:item=1770490683&perks=2173046394,2848615171,3827198035,4067834857
dimwishlist:item=1770490683&perks=2173046394,2848615171,3827198035,852209214

Shapeable. Non-Dénouement is French for "No final outcome" - make of that what you will! Base stats are good by comparison to its peers, and equate to a 0.622s draw time, 0.42s perfect draw window, 0.43s ADS speed, 0.58s ready and 0.44s stow speed, and 0.78s reload speed. As with most bows, the bowstring and arrow perks will reduce the draw time and improve accuracy. The roll that everyone's looking for is the "baby" Trinity Ghoul, with Voltshot in the second trait column for jolting and chaining arc damage - which you can improve on with arc aspects and fragments. To pair with this in the first column, Archer's Tempo is reliable as ever, reducing draw time to 0.417s after a crit hit but, if you're after all the explosions, Dragonfly is there too. // Non-Denouement (PvE)
// (Elastic String, Flexible String, Polymer String), Straight Fletching, (Archer's Tempo, Shoot to Loot, Dragonfly), Explosive Head
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy written v8.0.0.8 (PvE / PvE-Boss/ PvE-MajorSpec / PvE-BossSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec red-bar adds in end-game content. Shapeable. Non-Dénouement is French for "No final outcome" - make of that what you will! Base stats are good by comparison to its peers, and equate to a 0.622s draw time, 0.42s perfect draw window, 0.43s ADS speed, 0.58s ready and 0.44s stow speed, and 0.78s reload speed. As with most bows, use the bowstring and arrow perks to reduce the draw time, and improve accuracy. If you don't already have an arc bow for end-game use, in the first column Archer's Tempo is reliable as ever, reducing draw time further, or Shoot to Loot is handy to pick up remote ammo bricks and reloading all your weapons. If you're after all the explosions, Dragonfly is there too. In the second column, Explosive Head adds a little extra damage and AoE - which will also pick up ammo bricks with Shoot to Loot. The Collective Purpose origin trait only works in a fireteam, but offers a small boost draw speed, which is always useful. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a Quick Access Sling or Sprint Grip mod.
dimwishlist:item=1770490683&perks=201365942,2801223209,3365897133,3827198035
dimwishlist:item=1770490683&perks=201365942,3365897133,3827198035,4067834857
dimwishlist:item=1770490683&perks=201365942,3365897133,3827198035,852209214
dimwishlist:item=1770490683&perks=2801223209,3365897133,3700496672,3827198035
dimwishlist:item=1770490683&perks=3365897133,3700496672,3827198035,4067834857
dimwishlist:item=1770490683&perks=3365897133,3700496672,3827198035,852209214
dimwishlist:item=1770490683&perks=2801223209,2848615171,3365897133,3827198035
dimwishlist:item=1770490683&perks=2848615171,3365897133,3827198035,4067834857

// Non-Denouement (Adept) (PvE)

As with most bows, use the bowstring and arrow perks to reduce the draw time, and improve accuracy. If you don't already have an arc bow for end-game use, in the first column Archer's Tempo is reliable as ever, reducing draw time further, or Shoot to Loot is handy to pick up remote ammo bricks and reloading all your weapons. If you're after all the explosions, Dragonfly is there too. In the second column, Explosive Head adds a little extra damage and AoE - which will also pick up ammo bricks with Shoot to Loot. The Collective Purpose origin trait only works in a fireteam, but offers a small boost draw speed, which is always useful. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a Quick Access Sling or Sprint Grip mod.

// The Riposte (first-choice PvE)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Flared Magwell), Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 110 from 23 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6VJFjsCdq5QckUaK2qXQn7?si=9032e578e9874dda) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing minor enemies in general actives, particularly with Void fragments. The Riposte is the Final Shape expansion's Competitive playlist reward - a unique Lightweight frame AR which grants the usual +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed with the fire rate of a rapid-fire. Base stats equate to 24.00m ADS range before damage dropoff, 0.30s ADS speed, 0.38s ready and 0.35s stow speed, and 1.79s reload speed, which compares well with the raid rapid-fire AR Rufus's Fury. Recoil is not great on controller, but stability barrel and mag perks can help, and you also get a choice of stocks that can assist too - Fitted Stock adds 20 Recoil Directions and 10 Stability for a small Handling loss. Aim to get to around 80 Stability, and you should be fine. If control isn't so much of an issue for you, then Short Action Stock or Composite Stock will boost Handling for a snappier gunfeel. For add-clearing, the void trait perk pairing of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds work really well together, and synergise with builds using void aspects and fragments. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod.

The Riposte is the Final Shape expansion's Competitive playlist reward - a unique Lightweight frame AR which grants the usual +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed with the fire rate of a rapid-fire. Base stats equate to 24.00m ADS range before damage dropoff, 0.30s ADS speed, 0.38s ready and 0.35s stow speed, and 1.79s reload speed, which compares well with the raid rapid-fire AR Rufus's Fury. For add-clearing, Repulsor Brace will proc on Gyrfalcon volatile round kills, which you can use with Desperate Measures to boost damage by up to +30%. //notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 110 from 23 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6VJFjsCdq5QckUaK2qXQn7?si=9032e578e9874dda) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing minor enemies in end-game activities. The Riposte is the Final Shape expansion's Competitive playlist reward - a unique Lightweight frame AR which grants the usual +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed with the fire rate of a rapid-fire. Base stats equate to 24.00m ADS range before damage dropoff, 0.30s ADS speed, 0.38s ready and 0.35s stow speed, and 1.79s reload speed, which compares well with the raid rapid-fire AR Rufus's Fury. Recoil is not great on controller, but stability barrel and mag perks can help, and you also get a choice of stocks that can assist too - Fitted Stock adds 20 Recoil Directions and 10 Stability for a small Handling loss. Aim to get to around 80 stability, and you should be fine. If control isn't so much of an issue for you, then Short Action Stock or Composite Stock will boost initial Handling for a snappier gunfeel. Enlightened Action in the first trait column will maximise Handling and Reload Speed at 12 stacks. Then in the second column Desperate Measures can boost damage by up to +30% and is easy to proc with Prismatic, or Target Lock gives an average +25% damage boost across a magazine for landing shots continuously. Recommended MW: Stability or Range, with a Backup Mag mod.

// Aisha's Care (PvE)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel), (Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Flared Magwell), Slice, (Hatchling, Collective Action, Golden Tricorn)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 110 from 23 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6VJFjsCdq5QckUaK2qXQn7?si=9032e578e9874dda) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing minor enemies in end-game actives, particularly when using Strand fragments. Aisha's Care is the first heavy burst frame pulse rifle that sits in the kinetic slot, as a Strand weapon, but unfortunately the trait perks are mainly PvP focussed, with it being a Trials weapon. Base stats are excellent compared to the small family of peers, and equate to 37.40m ADS range before damage dropoff, 0.39s ADS speed, 0.44s ready and 0.43s stow speed, and 2.05s reload speed. Saying that, handling and reload speed could definitely do with some help from the barrel and magazine perk slots. Slice is always useful in the first trait perk column when facing a boss, to apply Sever and reduce damage output by -40% - particularly running a Hunter. You can go all-in to Strand with Hatchling, and benefit from Strand aspect and fragment synergy for both perks - you should be getting plenty of easy crit kills to generate Threadlings, or boost damage output through Collective Action or Golden Tricorn. You have a choice of three useful origin trait, so just go with whatever suits your playstyle or current activity. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod.

// Aisha's Care (PvE)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel), (Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Flared Magwell), Keep Away, (Desperado, Hatchling, Collective Action, Golden Tricorn)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 110 from 23 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6VJFjsCdq5QckUaK2qXQn7?si=9032e578e9874dda) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing minor enemies in general activities. Aisha's Care is the first heavy burst frame pulse rifle that sits in the kinetic slot, as a Strand weapon, but unfortunately the trait perks are mainly PvP focussed, with it being a Trials weapon. Base stats are excellent compared to the small family of peers, and equate to 37.40m ADS range before damage dropoff, 0.39s ADS speed, 0.44s ready and 0.43s stow speed, and 2.05s reload speed. Saying that, handling and reload speed could definitely do with some help from the barrel and magazine perk slots. At the ranges you'll be engaging enemies, Keep Away in the first trait perk column will improve accuracy, as well as improving reload time to 1.58s. That makes it ideal to pair with Desperado, which provides an effective +33% increase in damage output. Alternatively, you can synergise with Strand fragments with Hatchling - you should be getting plenty of easy crit kills to generate Threadlings, or boost damage output through Collective Action or Golden Tricorn. You have a choice of three useful origin trait, so just go with whatever suits your playstyle or current activity. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod.

Aisha's Care (Adept) is the first heavy burst frame pulse rifle that sits in the kinetic slot, as a Strand weapon, but unfortunately the trait perks are mainly PvP focussed, with it being a Trials weapon. // Shayura's Wrath (PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Flared Magwell, Light Mag, Alloy Mag), Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 110 from 23 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6VJFjsCdq5QckUaK2qXQn7?si=9032e578e9874dda) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing minor enemies in general actives, particularly with void fragments. Shayura's Wrath might not be the monster it once was, with SMGs being power crept by ARs but, if you're still looking for a good void version, it's still work considering. Base stats are excellent compared to the small family of peers, and equate to 19.79m ADS range before damage dropoff, 0.31s ADS speed, 0.41s ready and 0.38s stow speed, and 2.20s reload speed. As a precision, you doing have to worry about Recoil Direction, so you can spec into your preferred stats with the barrel perk, and reload speed in the mag slot. The trait perk pairing of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds work well to clear crowds at the CQC distances you'll be using an SMG in, and synergise with builds using void aspects and fragments. You have a choice of three useful origin trait, so just go with whatever suits your playstyle or current activity. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod.

// Corrasion (first-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag), High-Impact Reserves, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 110 from 23 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6VJFjsCdq5QckUaK2qXQn7?si=9032e578e9874dda) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing minor enemies in general activities. Shapeable. Corrasion - the process of mechanical erosion by abrasion - is the arc member of the new meta pulse rifle - it looks good, and is easily available during Final Shape. Base stats are, as you'd expect, poor compared to the small family of peers, and equate to 36.76m ADS range before damage dropoff, 0.39s ADS speed, 0.44s ready and 0.43s stow speed, and 2.12s reload speed. It fires slowly enough for recoil not to be too much of an issue, so you can focus on Handling and Reload Speed with the barrel and mag perks. Unusually, there's a damage perk in the first trait column - High-Impact Reserves, so you can double up damage multipliers in the second column with Frenzy for +15% and maxxed handling and reload speed. The Radiolaria Transposer origin trait is extra AoE damage that inherits the pulse rifle's decent damage multiplier and any damage bonus, so the initial explosion can be more damaging than a special ammo Chain Reaction explosion - what's not to love? Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod.
dimwishlist:item=2126178511&perks=1840239774,2213355989,3230963543,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=2126178511&perks=106909392,1840239774,2213355989,4104185692

// Aberrant Action (first-choice PvE)
// (Volatile Launch, Confined Launch, Linear Compensator, Quick Launch), (High-Explosive Ordnance, Tactical Mag, High-Velocity Rounds, Appended Mag), Heal Clip, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 110 from 23 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6VJFjsCdq5QckUaK2qXQn7?si=9032e578e9874dda) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing minor enemies in end-game activities, particularly using solar fragments. Shapeable. Aberrant Action is the third rocket-frame sidearm - solar flavour this time, with similar stats to Indebted Kindness (if the Range reads 0, then that's just a bug). In the barrel and mag, you can prefer perks that give extra Blast Radius, Velocity or an extra shot or two (or a bit of a mix) - that's really down to personal preference. Match the lethality of the rocket sidearms with Heal Clip and Incandescent, particularly when synergising with solar aspects and fragments to boost the verb potency, and you'll be curing yourself x2 and nearby teammates x1 while wiping out add crowds with scorch and ignition. The Radiolaria Transposer origin trait is extra AoE damage that inherits the weapon's damage multiplier, so the initial explosion can be more damaging than a special ammo Chain Reaction explosion - what's not to love? Recommended MW: Velocity or Blast Radius, with a Backup Mag mod.
dimwishlist:item=2198166292&perks=106909392,1441682018,3017780555,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=2198166292&perks=106909392,3017780555,3525010810,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=2198166292&perks=1441682018,2822142346,3017780555,4293542123

// Corrasion (PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag), (Perpetual Motion, Air Trigger), Voltshot
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy written v8.0.0.8 (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): PvE pick for add-clearing minor enemies in general actives, particularly with arc fragments. Shapeable. Corrasion - the process of mechanical erosion by abrasion - is the arc member of the new meta pulse rifle - it looks good, and is easily available during Final Shape. Base stats are, as you'd expect, poor compared to the small family of peers, and equate to 36.76m ADS range before damage dropoff, 0.39s ADS speed, 0.44s ready and 0.43s stow speed, and 2.12s reload speed. It fires slowly enough for recoil not to be too much of an issue, so you can focus on Handling and Reload Speed with the barrel and mag perks. If you're looking for a Voltshot roll, then you'll need a reload perk in the first trait column - Perpetual Motion provides a passive boost or - and don't judge me too harshly for this - Air Trigger provides Outlaw-like reload speeds just for being in the air as you reload. The Radiolaria Transposer origin trait is extra AoE damage that inherits the pulse rifle's decent damage multiplier, so the initial explosion is as damaging as a special ammo Chain Reaction explosion - what's not to love? Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod.
dimwishlist:item=2126178511&perks=1428297954,1840239774,2173046394,3230963543
dimwishlist:item=2126178511&perks=106909392,1428297954,1840239774,2173046394

// Maahes HC4 (First-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag), (Rapid Hit, Enlightened Action, Perpetual Motion), Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 108 from 9 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/20WqdTYGB2K4SfWYePZWo1?si=0c706567ddea4e10) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing in general content, particularly with void fragments. Even though Maahes HC4 is named after an Egyptian solar war god, who took the form of a lion, this is a void heavy burst hand cannon. The damage output from this subfamily is good, but unfortunately the stats are poor. They are helped by the Omolon Fluid Dynamics origin trait in the top half of the magazine though, and you can flesh them out a little more with the barrel and mag perks. In the first trait perk column, Rapid Hit, Enlightened Action or Perpetual Motion are good ways of boosting the stats still further and, if you don't have easy access to the volatility verb, Destabilizing Rounds in the second column will help clear add crowds quickly and synergise with void-themed fragments. You should end up with a gun that starts out feeling good in a gunfight, and ends up feeling very good for add clearing. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.

// Ded Gramarye IV (First-choice PvE)
// (Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Full Choke), (Assault Mag, Tactical Mag), Discord, (Chain Reaction, Surrounded)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 108 from 9 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/20WqdTYGB2K4SfWYePZWo1?si=0c706567ddea4e10) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-MajorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing in general content. "Ded Gramarye" translates as "dead" and "occult learning, magic, or enchantment" from archaic English so, necromancy, at a guess. First, the Wild Card origin trait works well on a shotgun, as the little energy bolts inherit its high combatant weapon scaling. The weapon itself has quite poor stats but it boasts some great, and unique, possible trait perk pairings. You can go with any barrel perk of your preference, other than Smoothbore or Rifled Barrel. Assault Mag and then Tactical Mag are the best of the magazine perks. As a slightly off-piste choice, the trait perk pairing of Discord and Chain Reaction - which is excellent on shotguns as the explosion damage also inherits the damage scaling - or Surrounded for +47% damage when enhanced, will allow you to get a kill with your other weapon, and then go on a tear for 7s refunding every killing shot fired. For a double special loadout, this is really useful for ammo economy. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod.

dimwishlist:item=499245245&perks=106909392,1300023272,2396489472,3978468247
dimwishlist:item=499245245&perks=106909392,2396489472,3978468247,4090651448
dimwishlist:item=499245245&perks=106909392,1482024992,2396489472,3978468247

"Ded Gramarye" translates as "dead" and "occult learning, magic, or enchantment" from archaic English so, necromancy, at a guess. First, the Wild Card origin trait works well on a shotgun, as the little energy bolts inherit its high combatant weapon scaling. The weapon itself has quite poor stats but it boasts some great, and unique, possible trait perk pairings. You can go with any barrel perk of your preference, other than Smoothbore or Rifled Barrel. Assault Mag and then Tactical Mag are the best of the magazine perks. // Suspectum-4fr (First-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), Ionized Battery, Envious Assassin, (Firing Line, Precision Instrument)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 108 from 9 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/20WqdTYGB2K4SfWYePZWo1?si=0c706567ddea4e10) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways (PvE / PvE-Boss / PvE-BossSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for sustained boss damage. "Suspectum" is a Latin adjective meaning "mistrusted" and - fun fact - is also the specific name for the Gila monster (Heloderma suspectum). In Destiny 2, this is a precision frame (so you can ignore recoil stats) stasis fusion rifle. The Veist Stinger origin trait, even post-nerf - is still handy for a partial reload and and gunfeel boosts. Try to improve handling a little with the barrel perk, and then in the battery perk slot, Ionized Battery plus Backup Mag is the only way to get to the maximum of 7 shots. That means, with three reserves mods and a fully procced Envious Assassin in the first trait column you'll have 21 shots of your 23 total in your battery (and if Veist Singer procs, you'll run out before reloading). You can't get Bait and Switch, but Firing Line's +20% damage in a fireteam is perfectly respectable and doesn't need reproccing, or Precision Instrument tops out at +25% per shot once you hit six crits in a row. Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.
dimwishlist:item=3615421669&perks=1483536627,1771339417,1840239774,968510818
dimwishlist:item=3615421669&perks=1483536627,1771339417,839105230,968510818

// Suspectum-4fr (First-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), Accelerated Coils, Envious Assassin, Chill Clip
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 108 from 9 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/20WqdTYGB2K4SfWYePZWo1?si=0c706567ddea4e10) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-MajorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for Champion Control, particularly with stasis fragments. "Suspectum" is a Latin adjective meaning "mistrusted" and - fun fact - is also the specific name for the Gila monster (Heloderma suspectum). In Destiny 2, this is a precision frame (so you can ignore recoil stats) stasis fusion rifle. The Veist Stinger origin trait, even post-nerf - is still handy for a partial reload and andy gunfeel boosts. Try to improve handling a little with the barrel perk, and then in the battery perk slot, as you're looking for speed rather than raw damage, Accelerated Coils gets your shot off a little faster. Envious Assassin in the first trait perk column can overflow the battery to 18 shots, 15 of which will proc Chill Clip in the second column, so you'll be able to disrupt Overloads with a single shot or stun Unstoppables with two at a safe distance. Recommended MW: Charge Time or Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.

// Suspectum-4fr (First-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), Accelerated Coils, Headstone, Chill Clip
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 108 from 9 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/20WqdTYGB2K4SfWYePZWo1?si=0c706567ddea4e10) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-MajorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for Champion Control, particularly with stasis fragments. "Suspectum" is a Latin adjective meaning "mistrusted" and - fun fact - is also the specific name for the Gila monster (Heloderma suspectum). In Destiny 2, this is a precision frame (so you can ignore recoil stats) stasis fusion rifle. The Veist Stinger origin trait, even post-nerf - is still handy for a partial reload and andy gunfeel boosts. Try to improve handling a little with the barrel perk, and then in the battery perk slot, as you're looking for speed rather than raw damage, Accelerated Coils gets your shot off a little faster. Although not entirely serious, Suspectum is one of only two LFRs that can roll with both stasis synergy trait perks - Headstone in the first column and Chill Clip in the second. You'll still be able to disrupt Overloads with a single shot or stun Unstoppables with two at a safe distance, and to generate stasis crystals on a crit kill, to use with stasis fragments. Recommended MW: Charge Time or Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.

Other solid options include Rapid Hit for reload speed and a tighter burst at max stacks, Strategist for immediate stability on class ability usage, and getting your class ability faster. // The Call
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Arguably the best weapon in this DLC, The Call is only the second Rocket-Assisted Frame. The benefit is that The Call is craftable. If you never got your toes into Warlord's Ruin or haven't gotten a good drop, The Call allows you to mix and match. Lead from Gold or Subsistence are going to allow you to use The Call more like a primary weapon, paired with Hatchling for Strand synergy. One for All is not only the best damage perk in slot, it is incredibly easy to proc with the AoE from the rocket shots." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Axial Lacuna
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I enjoy the sights on this fusion, does that make it the best? Not really. Opt for Incandescent and instead you've got a great room clearing weapon. Incandescent Vs Reservoir Burst is a discussion for another time." Recommended MW: Charge Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Embraced Identity
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Maybe not the best sniper in the game for damage. Being craftable makes the barrier for entry into getting those great snipers easier. Reconstruction or Rewind Rounds and Fourth time's the Charm allow you to fire for what feels like forever. The Supremacy can roll something similar and it can shoot for over 50 shots. Precision Instrument gives you some great damage over your larger mag but isn't the same instant bonus like Firing Line or Vorpal Weapon. Not the worst weapon to craft even if you do have your tried and true DPS weapon." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// No Hesitation
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Rooty tooty gun go ... Healy? Our very first legendary support weapon. Subsistence and Incandescent will allow you to build up charges while still being able to clear rooms with ease. Leaning more into support you have new perks Physic and Circle of Life. One giving you better healing, while the latter giving you bonus damage after healing allies. Depending on how you expect to use No Hesitations combinations of those four perks could be very strong. Leaning more into healing your team, explosions, doing better damage, EXPLOSIONS. The choice is yours." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

Reverberation is neat but doesn't do a lot. // Chronophage
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "We got ourselves a new void trace rifle. If you missed Hollow Denial then this will be for you. I think Hollow Denial is better than Chronophage, but it's a decent alternative. Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds are great Void synergy, but for better general use Auto-Loading Holster and Target Lock will always keep you topped off and have some great damage. If you're looking for more of a main weapon then Feeding Frenzy and Desperate Measures will fit that bill." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Corrasion
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Bungie beefing up some of these less populated archetypes. Our first / second legendary heavy burst pulse rifle comes with the Echoes. Unfortunately the Corrasion has no good reload perk outside of Perpetual Motion. The other stats are nice but I'm not always in motion to take advantage of it. High-Impact Reserves in the third column is interesting to beef up some damage at the end of your magazine but it doesn't do anything to aid us in getting to the next one. Frenzy does bump up handling and reload if you opt for that and will bump up your damage on top of High-Impact Reserves. Voltshot is a great room clearing perk but without a reload perk it's less desirable." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "A caster frame sword with Cold Steel? All 3 Icefall Mantle Titan’s rejoice! // Ded Gramarye IV
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "A sleeper of a weapon this shotgun gets both Chain Reaction and Discord allowing for maximum carnage with a single weapon kill. Any weapon kill then swapping to Ded Gramarye IV will give you 8 seconds of infinite shots that explode enemies. What more could you ask for? Voltshot is another great perk as shotguns naturally load one bullet at a time so you can shoot once, reload that once and your next shot will apply all that Jolting goodness. This can be done indefinitely as long as you have ammo. I think on Arc and even neutral builds this might become one of the top picks, the issue is getting one to drop." // Shadow Price
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Shadow Price returns to us, is it better than before? Depends on what you’re looking to do. Overflow is the best option in column 3 but has no synergy with the best perk in column 4. Voltshot requires reloads to work and Overflow bypasses and does not allow you to reload when the magazine is larger than normal. Strategist works better for Voltshot but does not reload your weapon faster. Permeability works with Strategist as both use your class ability as activation points. One for All is the only good damage perk in the fourth column." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Shayura's Wrath
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "My beloved Shayura’s Wrath comes back to us this season with a slight downgrade in the magazine department losing Accurized Rounds for Ricochet Rounds or High-Caliber Rounds. Other than that we also have the same Void synergy with Destabilizing Rounds and Repulsor Brace. Cascade Point is funny to see but a bit more niche, Keep Away for the passive reload bonus and Strategist for class ability energy are both solid. Target Lock on SMGs was nerfed but in PvE still remains a solid option." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Critical Anomaly
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Critical Anomaly has one of the most interesting perks we have seen on a sniper rifle. Chill Clip  allows you to stun 2/3 champions with one weapon and this season’s Radiant Orbs brings in the third allowing you to take care of all three champions with one weapon. Outside of the champion situation you have Rewind Rounds and Reconstruction for ammo and Bait and Switch or Firing Line for damage. Another interesting combination is either Rewind Rounds or Reconstruction with Triple Tap for a harder hitting Supremacy with less shots." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Imminence with Chaos Reshaped or Firefly will be a weapon to bring to any activity. Chaos Reshaped is better for Onslaught type activities where the fighting barely stops, while Firefly will be better room to room like in a strike or story mission with downtime. Perpetual Motion and Enlightened Action both allow you to have faster reloads depending on moving or hitting things." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Non-Denouement
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "No arguments here, this is the best weapon from the Salvation’s Edge raid. Non-Denouement, while hard to spell, gives us something we haven’t seen before; Dragonfly and Voltshot together. Dragonfly allows you to get some AoE damage on the initial kill while Voltshot on a bow will make it so as long as you’re getting kills you’ll be able to jolt on the next shot. Dealing AoE damage on top of more AoE damage and jolt is just hilariously fun and gives Trinity Ghoul vibes without the cost of your exotic. You cannot hold onto the Voltshot shot like Trinity Ghoul but that alone separates this legendary from the exotic." Recommended MW: Accuracy, or Draw Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=1770490683&perks=2173046394,2801223209,2848615171,3827198035

//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "No arguments here, this is the best weapon from the Salvation’s Edge raid. Non-Denouement, while hard to spell, gives us something we haven’t seen before; Dragonfly and Voltshot together. Dragonfly allows you to get some AoE damage on the initial kill while Voltshot on a bow will make it so as long as you’re getting kills you’ll be able to jolt on the next shot. Dealing AoE damage on top of more AoE damage and jolt is just hilariously fun and gives Trinity Ghoul vibes without the cost of your exotic. You cannot hold onto the Voltshot shot like Trinity Ghoul but that alone separates this legendary from the exotic." Recommended MW: Accuracy, or Draw Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

This allows you to bypass reload entirely while still getting damage and healing. Firefly will be a great alternative if you want some explosions / better reload instead of Subsistence." // Summum Bonum
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Summum Bonum is our first legendary wave frame sword. While being unique is it good? Well Unrelenting and Chain Reaction are both solid for keeping yourself alive while also clearing rooms with ease. If you wanted better health regeneration you could opt for Unrelenting and Chaos Reshaped. Both give healing at their full potential. Bait and Switch will give you the best damage while paired with either Tireless Blade or Relentless Strikes for ammo regeneration." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Origin Story (First-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Alloy Mag, Fluted Barrel), (Demolitionist, Dynamic Sway Reducation, Threat Detector, Feeding Frenzy, Keep Away), Onslaught
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 109 from 17 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/2nTeQvaqobDnHpu43iq8eH?si=091612d7b0604589) with @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for Minor add clearing in general content. Wanna fire the same Precision AR as Zavala? Origin Story returns with a refreshed (if huge) perk pool. If you're focussing make sure you've reset your reputation a few times first. The precision frame makes recoil easier to handle but the stats are on the low side, so you can use the barrel and magazine perks to fill them out a little. You've got a choice of first column support perks to add utility, boost gunfeel stats or directly improve reload speed. In the second column, Onslaught can dramatically improve outgoing damage as you're killing adds. Either Origin Trait can work, depending on whether you want a little bit of health or slightly improved gunfeel. The perk pool is huge, so reset Vanguard rank as many times as you can before you start focusing engrams. Recommended MW: any - dealer's choice, with a Backup Mag mod.
dimwishlist:item=2826850739&perks=1840239774,2779035018,3230963543,95528736
dimwishlist:item=2826850739&perks=1482024992,2779035018,3230963543,95528736
dimwishlist:item=2826850739&perks=1840239774,3230963543,3619207468,95528736
dimwishlist:item=2826850739&perks=1482024992,3230963543,3619207468,95528736

// Origin Story (First-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Alloy Mag, Fluted Barrel), (Demolitionist, Threat Detector, Feeding Frenzy, Keep Away), Onslaught
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 109 from 17 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/2nTeQvaqobDnHpu43iq8eH?si=091612d7b0604589) with @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for Minor add clearing in general content. Wanna fire the same Precision AR as Zavala? Origin Story returns with a refreshed (if huge) perk pool. If you're focussing make sure you've reset your reputation a few times first. The precision frame makes recoil easier to handle but the stats are on the low side, so you can use the barrel and magazine perks to fill them out a little. You've got a choice of first column support perks to add utility, boost gunfeel stats or directly improve reload speed. In the second column, Kinetic Tremors needs 12 shots to hit, but is a good AoE damage effect for staggering beefier adds and controlling any nearby Minors and Majors. Either Origin Trait can work, depending on whether you want a little bit of health or slightly improved gunfeel. The perk pool is huge, so reset Vanguard rank as many times as you can before you start focusing engrams. Recommended MW: any - dealer's choice, with a Backup Mag mod.
dimwishlist:item=2826850739&perks=1840239774,2779035018,3230963543,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=2826850739&perks=1482024992,2779035018,3230963543,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=2826850739&perks=1840239774,3230963543,3619207468,3891536761
dimwishlist:item=2826850739&perks=1482024992,3230963543,3619207468,3891536761

// Scintillation (First-choice PvE)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Enhanced Battery, Accelerated Coils), Envious Assassin, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 109 from 17 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/2nTeQvaqobDnHpu43iq8eH?si=091612d7b0604589) with @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE / PvE-Boss / PvE-MajorSpec / PvE-BossSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for damage against Major and Boss enemies. Scintillation (that is, the process of being sparkly) is the first Strand adaptive burst LFR. It's got decent stats and feels good to use, and the Veist Stinger, while not the powerhouse it once more, is still the best origin trait to have on an LFR. With this being a three shot burst, you'll imp[rove control with Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk. The best battery perk is Enhanced Battery which, with a Backup Mag mod, is your first step towards the maximum 7 shots but, if you get Accelerated Coils that also works to improve DPS rate at the cost of a small drop to total damage. In the first trait column, Envious Assassin can triple your number of shots to 21 - pretty much all of your reserve ammo. In the second, Reservoir Burst is the final step to get to 7 shots in the base battery, adds +25% damage to every overflowed shot and, if you kill your target, the explosion is 4x stronger than Chain Reaction would be. Recommended MW: Handling or Charge Time, with a Backup Mag mod.
dimwishlist:item=2591257541&perks=1427256713,2680121939,839105230,968510818
dimwishlist:item=2591257541&perks=1427256713,689005463,839105230,968510818

// Scintillation (First-choice PvE)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Enhanced Battery, Accelerated Coils), (Auto-Loading Holster, Envious Assassin, Rewind Rounds, Rapid Hit), Bait and Switch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 109 from 17 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/2nTeQvaqobDnHpu43iq8eH?si=091612d7b0604589) with @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE / PvE-Boss / PvE-MajorSpec / PvE-BossSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Boss enemies. Scintillation (that is, the process of being sparkly) is the first Strand adaptive burst LFR. It's got decent stats and feels good to use, and the Veist Stinger, while not the powerhouse it once more, is still the best origin trait to have on an LFR. With this being a three shot burst, you'll imp[rove control with Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk. The best battery perk is Ionized Battery which, with a Backup Mag mod, is your only way to the maximum 7 shots but, if you get Accelerated Coils that also works to improve DPS rate at the cost of a small drop to total damage. In the first trait column, a reload or battery extending perk is a must-have for a sustained damage roll. In the second, Bait and Switch is still the perennial favourite, with +30% damage when procced, if you don't already have a well-rolled LFR that works for you. Recommended MW: Handling or Charge Time, with a Backup Mag mod.
dimwishlist:item=2591257541&perks=1483536627,3078487919,3300816228,839105230
dimwishlist:item=2591257541&perks=3078487919,3300816228,689005463,839105230

dimwishlist:item=2591257541&perks=3078487919,689005463,839105230,968510818
dimwishlist:item=2591257541&perks=1483536627,3078487919,3418782618,839105230
dimwishlist:item=2591257541&perks=3078487919,3418782618,689005463,839105230

// Scintillation (First-choice PvE)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Enhanced Battery, Accelerated Coils), (Envious Assassin, Rewind Rounds, Rapid Hit), Firing Line
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 109 from 17 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/2nTeQvaqobDnHpu43iq8eH?si=091612d7b0604589) with @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE / PvE-Boss / PvE-MajorSpec / PvE-BossSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Boss enemies. Scintillation (that is, the process of being sparkly) is the first Strand adaptive burst LFR. It's got decent stats and feels good to use, and the Veist Stinger, while not the powerhouse it once more, is still the best origin trait to have on an LFR. With this being a three shot burst, you'll imp[rove control with Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk. The best battery perk is Ionized Battery which, with a Backup Mag mod, is your only way to the maximum 7 shots but, if you get Accelerated Coils that also works to improve DPS rate at the cost of a small drop to total damage. In the first trait column, a reload or battery extending perk is a must-have for a sustained damage roll. In the second, Firing Line is a solid +20% damage bonus just for being near your fireteam, if you don't already have a well-rolled LFR that works for you. Recommended MW: Handling or Charge Time, with a Backup Mag mod.

// Better Devils (First-choice PvE)
// (Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Alloy Mag), (Rapid Hit, Enlightened Action, Perpetual Motion, Air Trigger), (One For All, Explosive Payload)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 109 from 17 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/2nTeQvaqobDnHpu43iq8eH?si=091612d7b0604589) with @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor enemies in end-game content. Better Devils returns (again) as a strand adaptive hand cannon and, as you'd expect from a playlist weapon, the stats aren't good. However, the two trait perk columns have just about every PvE option you could ever want! And, you also have the choice of two reasonable origin traits to use as well. Use the barrel and mag perks to round out gunfeel stats. For end-game use, looking at first column trait perks that don't need a kill to proc and which further fill out the gunfeel stats Rapid Hit, Enlightened Action, Perpetual Motion all work. Air Trigger might be more of a PvP perk, but provides Outlaw-like reload speeds if you're off the ground. In the second column, One For All provides a +30% damage bonus for hitting three enemies, or Explosive Payload adds a little extra damage and flinch. The perk pool is huge, so reset Crucible rank as many times as you can before you start focusing engrams. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Backup Mag mod.
dimwishlist:item=4152016199&perks=1482024992,247725512,3038247973,3230963543
dimwishlist:item=4152016199&perks=1840239774,247725512,3038247973,3230963543
dimwishlist:item=4152016199&perks=247725512,3038247973,3230963543,4090651448

// Better Devils (First-choice PvE)
// (Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Alloy Mag), (Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion), Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 109 from 17 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/2nTeQvaqobDnHpu43iq8eH?si=091612d7b0604589) with @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor enemies in end-game content. Better Devils returns (again) as a strand adaptive hand cannon and, as you'd expect from a playlist weapon, the stats aren't good. However, the two trait perk columns have just about every PvE option you could ever want! And, you also have the choice of two reasonable origin traits to use as well. Use the barrel and mag perks to round out gunfeel stats. For end-game use, looking at first column trait perks that don't need a kill to proc and which further fill out the gunfeel stats Rapid Hit, and Perpetual Motion Perpetual Motion both help add stability to pretty much max out gunfeel stats when paired with Frenzy, which also adds a useful +15% damage. The perk pool is huge, so reset Crucible rank as many times as you can before you start focusing engrams. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Backup Mag mod.

// Warden's Law (PvE)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Appended Mag), (Fourth Time's The Charm, Enlightened Action, Perpetual Motion), Vorpal Waepon
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy - information as at v8.0.0.6 (PvE / PvE-Champion / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): PvE pick for anti-Champion use in end-game content. The re-reprised Warden's Law was the first of the heavy burst subfamily, and provides good, if slightly clunky-feeling damage. The stats look like those of a 120 but with less range and, although the magazine looks generous, every trigger pull shoots two bullets so in reality, you'll only have 8 shots at base. Handling and Stability could both also do with a bump, but we can sort handling with traits, so Polygonal Rifling provides the biggest boost, followed by Smallbore, Fluted Barrel and then Corkscrew Rifling. Using Tactical Mag or Appended Mag as the magazine perk, with a Backup Mag mod, will bring the magazine to its maximum of 14. The two shot burst makes this useful for disrupting overloads - you can look for a first column trait perk that helps with gunfeel or ammo economy, to pair with Vorpal Weapon in the second for a little extra damage against majors and bosses. TYhe Stunning Recovery origin trait pairs well for this anti_champion role. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Backup Mag mod.

// Shadow Price (PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), Strategist, (One For All, Surrounded)
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy - information as at v8.0.0.6 (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): PvE pick for add-clearing Minor enemies in end-game content, for Titans using Hazardous Propulsion. The reprised Shadow Price comes back into a very competitive arc auto rifle ecosystem and, while it's not a bad option, with good stats, it doesn't really offer anything new either so only look at this if you don't have similar arc AR options already. Being a precision frame, you can ignore recoil direction, so just use the barrel and mag perks to improve the gunfeel further and boost reload speed. For Titans who need their barricade back as fast as possible to use Hazardous Propulsion with, Strategist speeds up class ability regeneration in the first trait perk column, and you can pair this with either One For All for a damage boost of +35%, or Surrounded if you're playing in CQC ranges and gain a +40% (+47% when enhanced) damage boost. The Vanguard's Vindication origin trait is useful, if not very noticeable. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Backup Mag mod.

// Hush (PvE)
// (Elastic String, Polymer String, Flexible String), (Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Straight Fletching, Helical Fletching), (Archer's Tempo, Shoot to Loot), Explosive Head
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy - information as at v8.0.0.6 (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): PvE pick for add-clearing Minor enemies in end-game content. Hush is back, but is now in a quite crowded pool of solar bows, so it doesn't really stand out. If you already have a well-rolled solar bow, you can happily pass. If you're still looking, bring down Draw Time as much as you can with your Bowstring perk, and then recover any lost accuracy with the Arrow perk. The standard endgame bow pairings of either Archer's Tempo or Shoot to Loot in the first perk column are available in the first trait perk column, with Explosive Head in the second for a little bonus damage and flinch, or Frenzy for a reliable +15% damage, and mexxed reload speed and handling. The perk pool is huge, so reset Gambit rank as many times as you can before you start focusing engrams. The Gun and Run origin trait is useful, if not very noticeable. Recommended MW: Draw Time or Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod.

//notes:Adamsdown_Boy - information as at v8.0.0.6 (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): PvE pick for add-clearing Minor enemies in general content, particularly with solar fragments. Hush is back, but is now in a quite crowded pool of solar bows, so it doesn't really stand out. If you already have a well-rolled solar bow, you can happily pass. If you're still looking, bring down Draw Time as much as you can with your Bowstring perk, and then recover any lost accuracy with the Arrow perk. Unrelenting in the first trait perk column grants health and starts regeneration as you kill groups of enemies, or Archer's Tempo speeds up draw time, and For solar fragment synergy, Incandescent spreads scorch and can trigger ignitions to help clear groups of Minor adds. The perk pool is huge, so reset Gambit rank as many times as you can before you start focusing engrams. The Gun and Run origin trait is useful, if not very noticeable. Recommended MW: Draw Time or Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod.

// The Guiding Sight (PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), (Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag), Slice, Hatchling
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy - information as at v8.0.0.6 (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): PvE pick for add-clearing Minor enemies in general content, particularly with strand fragments. The reprised The Guiding Sight has a couple of extra tricks up its sleeve that might be worth looking for. The stats are pretty much in-band, although there aren't many peers to compare against, but you'll definitely appreciate some extra handling and reload speed, so focus on improving those with the barrel and magazine perks. For strand fragment synergy you now have access to both Slice (probably easier to proc for Hunters, with the faster cooldown for Dodge) and Hatchling in the two trait perk columns. The Nadir Focus origin trait is useful to help land repeated crits, so that's the one to choose. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod.

// Claws of the Wolf (PvE)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds), Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy - information as at v8.0.0.6 (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): PvE pick for add-clearing Minor enemies in general content, particularly with void fragments. Claws of the Wolf returns in season 24 with a largely new (largely PvP-focussed) perk pool, but with stats the look a bit anaemic by comparison with its peers. The Recoil Direction needs a bit of attention, so Arrowhead Brake is the obvious barrel perk to sort that out. In the magazine perk slot, you could either look to fill out the stats a little more, or get a combat effect mag perk. If you don't already have an Elsie's Rifle with the void combination of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds in the two trait perk columns, then this roll can synergise with void fragments to boost the subclass verbs and provide a void overshield while clearing groups of adds. Unfortunately, the Skulking Wolf origin trait has no effect outside of Iron Banner. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Backup Mag mod.
dimwishlist:item=1505862304&perks=2048641572,3230963543,776531651,839105230
dimwishlist:item=1505862304&perks=1968497646,2048641572,776531651,839105230

// Veiled Threat (First-choice PvE)
// (Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Alloy Mag, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), Shoot to Loot, (Desperate Measures, Collective Action)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 106 from 3 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/7jGtQ3pw94PV7XpXREQ094?si=ddb5fb64813048e1) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add clearing in end-game content. Shapeable. Veiled Threat looks lovely (like Vex Mytholast had a baby!) but unfortunately drops with poor base stats compared to its peers, so if you have a Krait you're happy with you can probably pass on by. If you're shooting adds at the outer reach of its range (22.6m at base), you might appreciate a little extra stability on controller, otherwise maybe a bit of extra range or stability with the barrel perk. In the mag slot, Alloy Mag can double down on the intrinsic frame perk to reduce reload time from 1.83s to 1.24s when empty, or Tactical Mag (1.68s) or Flared Magwell (1.61s) work at any point in the magazine if you can't wait. There's an interesting interaction between Shoot to Loot in the first trait perk column and the Radiolaria Transposer origin trait when procced - any ammo caught in the pool will be picked up. In the second, to boost damage, Desperate Measures adds up to +30% or Collective Action adds a flat +20%, and both are easy to proc with Transcendence. The Radiolaria Transposer origin trait is nice to have - the AoE damage isn't huge, but it is additional to weapon damage so what's not to like? Recommended MW: any - your preference, with a Backup Mag mod.

dimwishlist:item=3685470415&perks=106909392,2109543898,3700496672,4090651448
dimwishlist:item=3685470415&perks=1840239774,2109543898,3230963543,3700496672
dimwishlist:item=3685470415&perks=2109543898,3230963543,3700496672,4090651448

// Veiled Threat (First-choice PvE)
// (Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Alloy Mag, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), Shoot to Loot, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 106 from 3 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/7jGtQ3pw94PV7XpXREQ094?si=ddb5fb64813048e1) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add clearing in end-game content, particularly using Stasis fragments. Shapeable. Veiled Threat looks lovely (like Vex Mytholast had a baby!) but unfortunately drops with poor base stats compared to its peers, so if you have a Krait you're happy with you can probably pass on by. If you're shooting adds at the outer reach of its range (22.6m at base), you might appreciate a little extra stability on controller, otherwise maybe a bit of extra range or stability with the barrel perk. In the mag slot, Alloy Mag can double down on the intrinsic frame perk to reduce reload time from 1.83s to 1.24s when empty, or Tactical Mag (1.34s) or Flared Magwell (1.29s) work at any point in the magazine. There's an interesting interaction between Shoot to Loot in the first trait perk column and the Radiolaria Transposer origin trait when procced - any ammo caught in the pool will be picked up. In the second, Headstone is there to generate stasis crystals to use with stasis fragments and mods. The Radiolaria Transposer origin trait is nice to have - the AoE damage isn't huge, but it is additional to weapon damage so what's not to like? Recommended MW: any - your preference, with a Backup Mag mod.

If you're shooting adds at the outer reach of its range (22.6m at base), you might appreciate a little extra stability on controller, otherwise maybe a bit of extra range or stability with the barrel perk. // Lost Signal (First-choice PvE)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), High-Velocity Rounds, (Auto-Loading Holster, Stats for All), One for All
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 106 from 3 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/7jGtQ3pw94PV7XpXREQ094?si=ddb5fb64813048e1) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add clearing in end-game content. Shapeable. Lost Signal is the first of a new special grenade launcher "area denial" subfamily which, from this example, has promise. You can think of this as a baby Witherhoard or a stasis flamethrower, firing five projectiles per shot that form flame pools where they hit something (even in the air). Use the barrel perk to boost handling and velocity - Quick Launch is best with Smart Drift Control as a second choice, and High-Velocity Rounds is the best of the two magazine perks. In the first trait column, Auto-Loading Holster bypasses the need to worry about reload speed, or Stats for All can boost Handling and Reload Stats to 100. In the second, as the raw AoE damage isn't huge, One for All can easily boost damage by a hefty +35% and all the damage ticks are great for recovering darkness Transcendence energy. The Radiolaria Transposer origin trait is nice to have - the AoE damage isn't huge, but it is additional to weapon damage so what's not to like? Recommended MW: Handling or Velocity, with a Quick Access Sling mod.
