dimwishlist:item=1197771438&perks=2822142346,3300816228,3798852852,4049631843
dimwishlist:item=1197771438&perks=1583705720,2822142346,3525010810,4049631843
dimwishlist:item=1197771438&perks=1583705720,2822142346,3798852852,4049631843

// Sightline Survey (First-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag), (Enlightened Action, Triple Tap), Desperate Measures
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 106 from 3 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/7jGtQ3pw94PV7XpXREQ094?si=ddb5fb64813048e1) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects (PvE / PvE-MinorSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for add clearing in end-game content, particularly when using arc fragments. Shapeable. Sightline Survey is essentially how non-Raiding Guardians can craft an arc hand cannon. But, if you already have a Posterity, you can move along! The stats are towards the bottom of comparators although on the plus side, with the frame intrinsic, at least you don't have to worry about recoil direction. Handling could definitely do with a boost from the barrel perk - Fluted Barrel is best, with maybe Corkscrew Rifling instead if that's all the drops. you can boost Reload Speed, which is a poor 2.54s at base, with the magazine perk - Flared Magwell (2.29s), or Tactical Mag (2.37s). In the first trait perk column, Enlightened Action. You get three stacks per hit, so four hits will grant +50 Handling and Reload Speed for 2s, reducing reload time to 1.83s, or Triple Tap will extend your magazine size. Finally, in the second trait slot, Desperate Measures can bost damage by up to +30%, and is easy to proc with Transcendence. The Radiolaria Transposer origin trait is nice to have - the AoE damage isn't huge, but it is additional to weapon damage so what's not to like? Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.

// Ill Omen (first-choice PvE)
// (Enduring Blade, Hungry Edge, Tempered Edge), Swordmaster's Guard, (Unrelenting, Relentless Strikes, Tireless Blade)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies episode 106 from 3 July 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/7jGtQ3pw94PV7XpXREQ094?si=ddb5fb64813048e1) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects (PvE / PvE-Boss / PvE-Champion / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): First-choice PvE pick for stunning Overload Champions. Shapeable. Ill Omen is the first Stasis Caster from sword that can drop Cold Steel - which is potentially exciting for being able to disrupt Overload champions from a distance... except at the point of reviewing this weapon, in practice it's very inconsistent. To keep or craft one in the hope this bug gets fixed, you'll want to maximise ammo rather than damage with the Blade perk. For the guard perk, Swordmaster's Guard adds a little bit to everything and then, although there's not much that pairs with Cold Steel projectile attacks in the first trait perk column, Unrelenting, Relentless Strikes or Tireless Blade might be occasionally useful. The Radiolaria Transposer origin trait is nice to have - the AoE damage isn't huge, but it is additional to weapon damage so what's not to like? Recommended MW: Impact, with a Backup Mag mod.

// Ill Omen (PvE)
//notes:Adamsdown_Boy (PvE / PvE-Boss / PvE-MajorSpec / PvE-BossSpec / PvE-EndGame / PvE-God / M+KB / Controller): PvE pick for add-clearing Minor enemies. Shapeable. Ill Omen is the first Stasis Caster from sword so potentially provides both CQC and occasional distance damage with a sword. For add-clearing, you'll want to maximise ammo rather than damage with the Blade perk. For the guard perk, Swordmaster's Guard adds a little bit to everything and then for boss damage, Relentless Strikes aand  Whirlwind Blade is the best trait perk pairing for sustained boss damage (although this isn't necessarily the frame I'd choose to do boss damage with..!). // No Hesitation (First-choice PvE)
// (Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), Physic, Circle of Life
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies and fireteam support in end-game content, particularly with solar/prismatic fragments that boost healing. Shapeable. A new Support frame auto-rifle subtype that builds healing charges on enemy hits (there's a semi-circle below the reticule that fills up) which you can then hip fire at allies to heal them. Hitting six hipfire shots on an ally heals 12 health per hit, and starts x1 Restoration for 4s after 6 rapid hits. This also grants both Guardians a +10% "Support Frame boost" to damage for 5s, which stacks with every other damage buff source. No Hesitation is probably the strongest solar primary currently in the game, if you're in a fireteam. It's a bit weird to fire as it's not hitscan - but if you can get used to Osteo Striga's tracking shots, you'll do fine. First off, controller players might benefit from a bit of extra stability from the barrel and mag perks. The first and second trait column perks can double down on the frame intrinsic perks through Physic which grants x1 Restoration (x2 when enhanced) for 5s to both you and allies when procced, and Circle of Life which boosts damage on healing by an additional +25% for 10s (+37.5% total for the first 5s with the Support Frame Boost) for both you and the healed Guardian. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have (who doesn't love more super energy?) - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Stability, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-Utility, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies and fireteam support in end-game content, particularly with complementary solar/prismatic fragments. Shapeable. Hitting six hipfire shots on an ally heals 12 health per hit, and starts x1 Restoration for 4s after 6 rapid hits. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have (who doesn't love more super energy?) - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! // Bold Endings (First-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), Rapid Hit, Desperate Measures
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Shapeable. There aren't many comparators for Bold Endings - the good news is that the base stats are great, but the bad news is that they're still not very good, with stability, handling and reload speed all low so, although it's hard-hitting, it feels a bit clunky. Use the barrel and magazine perks to fill in the gaps. To help further, you can quickly get to the maximum stacks of Rapid Hit as the first trait perk, and you have ways of getting to three stacks of Desperate Measures using Transcendent melee and grenade for up to +30% damage. // Embraced Identity (First-choice PvE)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against major and bosses in end-game content. Shapeable. If you already have a good backup DPS sniper then you can safely pass on Embraced Identity. Decent base stats so, as ever, handling is the stat to boost with the barrel perk. Tactical Mag plus a Backup Mag mod gets you to 6 shots, or Appended Mag + Backup Mag gets you to 7. In the first trait column, Rewind Rounds or Reconstruction are both excellent. In the second column, Precision Instrument or High Ground both boost damage via different proc mechanisms, depending on whether you have a big crit spot to aim for, or can get your feet at least one metre higher than the feet of what you're shooting at (so, weirdly, you can have it procced and still be shooting up at a taller enemy's head). The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have (who doesn't love more super energy?) - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// The Call (First-choice PvE)
// (Quick Launch, Volatile Launch, Linear Compensator), (Tactical Mag, High-Velocity Rounds, High-Explosive Ordnance), (Subsistence, Lead from Gold), One for All
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for Minor and Major add clearing in end-game content. Shapeable. The Call is the best weapon to come from the Pale Heart weapon set. There's only one other rocket-assisted frame, so there's not much to compare against, but the stats don't honestly matter. You'd normally look for velocity in a non-hitscan weapon, but there's an argument to be made for blast radius too so the barrel and mag perk choices depend on your preference (although be aware that High-Explosive Ordnance will reduce the base mag size to 9). This is going to one-hit kill red bars in most content, so Subsistence is a good choice to bypass reloading entirely, or Lead from Gold will help with the already good ammo economy in the first trait perk column. In the second, One for All can proc from AoE damage ticks - which is why you might want to focus on blast radius - for +35% bonus damage for 10s. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have (who doesn't love more super energy?) - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Velocity or Blast Radius, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Someday (First-choice PvE)
// (Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore), (Assault Mag, TacticalMag), (Threat Detector, Lead from Gold, Threat Remover), Recombination
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for burst DPS against Majors and Champions in end-game content. Shapeable. Someday has in-band stats and is the only kinetic precision frame shotgun currently available. As per usual, Look for handling, or a touch of extra range (without any penalties) in the barrel perk, and Assault Mag (or maybe Tactical Mag) in the magazine slot. As the support perk in the first trait column, Threat Detector and Lead for Gold are viable options, or the new Threat Remover looks interesting. Then in the second column, this is the only non-Raid shotgun, and the first pellet shotgun, that can roll with Recombination, which adds up to +100% damage to the next shot, ideal for tanky enemies. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have (who doesn't love more super energy?) - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Handling, with a Backup Mag or Quick Access Sling mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Axial Lacuna (First-choice PvE)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore), (Accelerated Coils, Enhanced Battery), Reconstruction, Controlled Burst
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for backup DPS against Majors and Bosses in end-game content. Shapeable. If you don't already have a fusion rifle for backup DPS, Axial Lacuna is available and shapeable. If you're interested, a lacuna is a gap or blank space, so the name refers to something missing in the direction of an axis. Improve your handling with your barrel perk, and then with your battery, Accelerated Coils is probably the top choice, but there's also something to be said for the extra shots you'll get from Enhanced Battery. there's nothing better than Reconstruction in the first trait perk slot, doubling your battery's capacity for a damage phase. In the second trait slot, Controlled Burst is the go-to trait for bonus damage, both adding +20% damage and reducing charge time for just landing all your bolts. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have (who doesn't love more super energy?) - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Pro Memoria (First-choice PvE)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore), (Extended mag, Appended Mag, Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds), (Envious Assassin, Reconstruction), (Target Lock, Bait and Switch)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for sustained DPS against Bosses in end-game content. Shapeable. Pro Memoria - which means "for memory" in Latin, and is also the name for a formal note embodying the written record of a diplomatic discussion - is the first in a new aggressive frame LMG subtype. It's described as "high damage", so should be good in a few different roles but with high recoil, look to the barrel perk to provide help with control and a little extra handling. As the magazine perk, for sustained boss damage, you'll want a perk that increases mag size or possibly helps a little more with recoil control. For sustained damage, in the first trait perk column, choose between Reconstruction for an effortless overflowed mag or Envious Assassin for a potentially bigger overflowed mag that needs add kills. In the second column, Target Lock or Bait and Switch (although the swap speed isn't great) make the most of your bullets in a sustained boss DPS phase. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have (who doesn't love more super energy?) - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Pro Memoria (First-choice PvE)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore), (Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds), (Envious Assassin, Reconstruction, Demolitionist), (Desperate Measures, Collective Action, Frenzy)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing in end-game content. Shapeable. Pro Memoria - which means "for memory" in Latin, and is also the name for a formal note embodying the written record of a diplomatic discussion - is the first in a new aggressive frame LMG subtype. It's described as "high damage", so should be good in a few different roles but with high recoil, look to the 	 to provide help with control and a little extra handling. As the magazine perk, Ricichet Rounds helps a little more with recoil control, or you can use High-Caliber or Armor-Piercing Rounds for additional combat effects. As a "heavy scout rifle" for add clearing, it never hurts to have a bigger mag, so you can use Reconstruction or Envious Assassin in the first trait slot, and then Desperate Measures is easy to proc with Transcendent for up to +30% damage, you should be creating plenty of strand tangles to proc Collective Action's +20% damage, or Frenzy is a reliable +15% plus maxxed handling and reload speed. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have (who doesn't love more super energy?) - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Pro Memoria (First-choice PvE)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore), (Ricochet Rounds, High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds), Hatchling, (Desperate Measures, Collective Action, Frenzy)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing in end-game content, particularly with Strand fragments. Shapeable. Pro Memoria - which means "for memory" in Latin, and is also the name for a formal note embodying the written record of a diplomatic discussion - is the first in a new aggressive frame LMG subtype. It's described as "high damage", so should be good in a few different roles but with high recoil, look to the barrel perk to provide help with control and a little extra handling. As the magazine perk, for sustained boss damage, you'll want a perk that increases mag size or possibly helps a little more with recoil control. As a "heavy scout rifle" to use with Strand fragments, you should be getting easy headshot add kills to spawn threadlings with the Hatchling trait perk in the first column. Then Desperate Measures is easy to proc with Transcendent for up to +30% damage, you should be creating plenty of strand tangles to proc Collective Action's +20% damage, or Frenzy is a reliable +15% plus maxxed handling and reload speed. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have (who doesn't love more super energy?) - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3605603507&perks=1968497646,4104185692,831391274,839105230

// False Idols (First-choice PvE)
// (Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge), Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, (Bait and Switch, Surrounded)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for sustained Boss damage in end-game content. Shapeable. False Idols is the latest vortex frame sword, and as all swords have pretty much the same stats, this is definitely in-band. Like all vortex frames, it's not currently good for boss damage with the cost/benefit of the spin-to-win heavy attack but if you want to save one for a possible future buff, start with a blade perk that boosts damage. In the guard perk slot, Swordmaster's Guard just buffs a little bit of everything. Then, in the first trait perk slot, Relentless Strikes passively returns ammo on hits while, in the second, Bait and Switch adds +30% damage when procced, or in the right circumstances, Surrounded adds +35% damage (+41.75% when enhanced). The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have (who doesn't love more super energy?) - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Impact, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=4207120603&perks=1749209109,269888150,3078487919,3666208348
dimwishlist:item=4207120603&perks=1749209109,269888150,2827049491,3078487919
dimwishlist:item=4207120603&perks=1749209109,269888150,3078487919,938542991

// False Idols (First-choice PvE)
// (Enduring Blade, Hungry Edge, Tempered Edge), Swordmaster's Guard, Incandescent, (Chain Reaction, One for All)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing in end-game content, particularly with solar fragments. False Idols is the latest vortex frame sword, and as all swords have pretty much the same stats, this is definitely in-band. Shapeable. Like all vortex frames, it's not currently good for boss damage with the cost/benefit of the spin-to-win heavy attack but if you want to save one for a possible future buff, start with a blade perk that boosts ammo count. In the guard perk slot, Swordmaster's Guard just buffs a little bit of everything. Then, in the first trait perk slot, Incandescent is very good a clearing crowds, particularly with solar fragments that use scorch or ignite, and then Chain Reaction, while not great for damage with the poor sword damage multiplier, can spread scorch and soften up add-dense crowds, or One for All can boost damage by +35% for dealing with a smaller number of beefier enemies. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have (who doesn't love more super energy?) - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! Recommended MW: Impact, with a Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// False Idols (First-choice PvE)
// (Enduring Blade, Hungry Edge, Tempered Edge), Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless, (Chain Reaction, One for All)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 106 from 18 June 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0GYlriUxhFqNHGLqb84C1G?si=bb5a2c9b339d4c35) with @ImpetusAlways, @CourtProjects and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing in end-game content, particularly with solar fragments. False Idols is the latest vortex frame sword, and as all swords have pretty much the same stats, this is definitely in-band. Shapeable. Like all vortex frames, it's not currently good for boss damage with the cost/benefit of the spin-to-win heavy attack but if you want to save one for a possible future buff, start with a blade perk that boosts ammo count. In the guard perk slot, Swordmaster's Guard just buffs a little bit of everything. In the first trait perk slot Relentless, particularly with solar fragments that bolster restoration, can keep you alive in CQC fight. Then, in the second slot, Chain Reaction, while not great for damage with the poor sword damage multiplier, can soften up add-dense crowds, or One for All can boost damage by +35% for dealing with a smaller number of beefier enemies. The Dealer's Choice origin trait is nice to have (who doesn't love more super energy?) - with two or three Pale Heart weapons, you'll notice the difference! // Midnight Coup (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds), Explosive Payload, (Kinetic Tremors, One for All, Frenzy, Desperate Measures)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Midnight Coup's stats are a bit of a mixed bag in what's a very competitive subfamily. The recoil pulls a little to the right so you can sort that with Arrowhead Brake, or boost the stability with the barrel perk. It's not often you get access to two damage boost traits that don't need a weapon kill to proc, so take advantage of Explosive Payload in the first column, and then Kinetic Tremors (which is strong on hand cannons against majors and minors), One for All, Frenzy or Desperate Measures to help tear through adds. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2499720827&perks=106909392,1482024992,3038247973,3891536761

// Midnight Coup (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds), Shoot to Loot, Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Midnight Coup's stats are a bit of a mixed bag in what's a very competitive subfamily. The recoil pulls a little to the right so you can sort that with Arrowhead Brake, or boost the stability with the barrel perk. For end-game content, where running out to pick up ammo could be a death sentence, Shoot to Loot can be a godsend, particularly when paired with Kinetic Tremors, which will pick up blocks and orbs in its AoE radius when procced, and is strong on hand cannons against majors and minors anyway. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Blast Furnace (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake), (Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag), Kinetic Tremors, (Frenzy, One For All, Desperate Measures)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Blast Furnace reappears with great stats as a well-rounded example of what is a pretty rare subfamily of Aggressive Burst frame pulse rifles, with a choice of barrels rather than the original's sights. The Rasmussen sight is decent (although you don't get any of the stat bonuses). The recoil is 65 at base, so vertical if a bit ragged - Handling is probably where to invest barrel park stats through Fluted Barrel or Arrowhead Brake. In the mag perk slot, Flared Magwell and Tactical Mag are both solid. It's not often you get the option of two damage traits - Kinetic Tremors takes 11 hits to proc - one less when enhanced - for AoE damage in the first column. In the second, you can't really go wrong with Frenzy, One For All or Desperate Measures for a more direct passive damage boost, that doesn't need a weapon kill. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2533990645&perks=2109543898,3230963543,3891536761,839105230
dimwishlist:item=2533990645&perks=106909392,2109543898,3891536761,839105230

// Blast Furnace (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake), (Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag), Kinetic Tremors, Dragonfly
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Blast Furnace reappears with great stats as a well-rounded example of what is a pretty rare subfamily of Aggressive Burst frame pulse rifles, with a choice of barrels rather than the original's sights. The Rasmussen sight is decent (although you don't get any of the stat bonuses). The recoil is 65 at base, so vertical if a bit ragged - Handling is probably where to invest barrel park stats through Fluted Barrel or Arrowhead Brake. In the mag perk slot, Flared Magwell and Tactical Mag are both solid. It's not often you get the option of two AoE damage traits - Kinetic Tremors takes 11 hits to proc - one less when enhanced - and Dragonfly adds to the fun with a solar explosion and a reload boost on a crit kill. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Blast Furnace (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds), Shoot to Loot, (Frenzy, One For All, Desperate Measures)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Blast Furnace reappears with great stats as a well-rounded example of what is a pretty rare subfamily of Aggressive Burst frame pulse rifles, with a choice of barrels rather than the original's sights. The Rasmussen sight is decent (although you don't get any of the stat bonuses). The recoil is 65 at base, so vertical if a bit ragged - Handling is probably where to invest barrel park stats through Fluted Barrel or Arrowhead Brake. In the mag perk slot, Flared Magwell and Tactical Mag are both solid. For end-game content, Shoot to Loot can be very useful to collect ammo and orbs without putting yourself at risk. Pair that with Frenzy, One For All or Desperate Measures for a passive damage boost that doesn't need a weapon kill to proc, and you've got a solid pulse rifle option. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Luna's Howl (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore), (Flared Magwell, Light Mag), Heal Clip, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a solar subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Luna's Howl was changed from a Precision to an Adaptive back in the day, so the stats do look weird in comparison to its peers - it's stable and easy to use, but might feel strange if you're used to traditional 140 HCs. Take a barrel perk that gives you a little bit of everything to round things out - Corkscrew, Smallbore or Fluted. For the mag perk, you want the reload as snappy as possible - Flared Magwell has the biggest boost, with Light Mag a close second. There's really only one trait perk combination to search for - Heal Clip (hence the need for reload speed) and Incandescent. Great anyway, but even better when synergising with solar fragments. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

dimwishlist:item=3757612024&perks=3017780555,3230963543,4090651448,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=3757612024&perks=1482024992,3017780555,3230963543,4293542123

If you already have a shaped Forbearance from Vow of the Disciple, you can move along. If not, it's the current best-in-subfamily for stats. The most popular roll of a barrel perk that boosts handling and velocity, with High-Velocity Rounds in the magazine paired with Ambitious Assassin and Chain Reaction has been the add-clearing wave-frame of choice for the last few seasons, and should still be good even after the planned CR nerf. // Forbearance (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)

//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with an arc subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Forbearance is the current best-in-subfamily for stats, and has a few new tricks with the revised trait perks. As with most wave-frames, you're looking for a barrel perk that boosts handling and velocity, with High-Velocity Rounds in the magazine. For CQC survivability, For the traits, Demolitionist and Wellspring together with the Indomitability origin trait all work together to generate grenade energy, but particularly with an arc subclass, so you can Jolt targets with a grenade, start collecting Ionic Traces to become amplified and then blind crowds, using a combination of Sparks of Shock, Ions/Discharge and Beacons. // The Mountaintop (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// Hard Launch, (Implosion Rounds, Spike Grenades), Auto-Loading Holster, (Recombination, Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained Boss Spec damage as part of a Bait and Switch weapon rotation in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Mountaintop has great stats and, even though it's now a "Micro-missile" frame, still retains the +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed bonuses of a lightweight. To maximise damage, you need to minimise the Blast Radius - there's only one barrel perk that does that, so Hard Launch is the only god-roll option. In the magazine park slot, Implosion Rounds gives the highest damage but Spike Grenades is so close as to make little practical difference. For the trait perks, Auto-Loading Holster just works - reloading in your pocket while you're doing dame with your heavy. To boost damage, Recombination provides a huge 100% bonus damage on your first shot when fully procced, but if you're firing eight or more shots over the course of a longer damage phase, you'll get more bonus damage from Frenzy or Vorpal Weapon, which also needs no setting up. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling (if you get Blast Radius DO NOT MASTERWORK!), with a damage boosting (Boss or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// The Mountaintop (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// Hard Launch, (Implosion Rounds, Spike Grenades), (Overflow, Ambitious Assassin), (Recombination, Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst Boss or Major Spec damage in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Mountaintop has great stats and, even though it's now a "Micro-missile" frame, still retains the +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed bonuses of a lightweight. To maximise damage, you need to minimise the Blast Radius - there's only one barrel perk that does that, so Hard Launch is the only god-roll option. In the magazine park slot, Implosion Rounds gives the highest damage but Spike Grenades is so close as to make little practical difference. For the trait perks, Overflow puts two in the mag just for running over an ammo brick, or Ambitious Assassin does the same after a kill. To boost damage, Recombination provides a huge 100% bonus damage on your first shot when fully procced, but Frenzy or Vorpal Weapon provide a reliable +15%, with Frenzy also boosting your reload speed and handling. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. // Hammerhead (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), (Appended Mag, Extended Mag), Rewind Rounds, (Killing Tally, Surrounded)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 103 from 7 May 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4QnASNlI9E2wArvSynJjVp?si=eb7298468d714686) with @CourtProjects, @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained Boss damage in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Hammerhead has lots of competition in the void Adaptive-frame LMG subfamily. It mostly has decent stats except for it's inventory size - at base you'll have 315 shots as opposed to Commemoration's 351. With three reserve mods, you'll have 427 compared to 453. You're best choice of barrel perk is something that helps with the low handling and, as a bigger magazine means more ammo from bricks, Appended or Extended are the mag perks for choice. As trait perks, Rewind Rounds delays your need to reload, so keeping you in a fight for longer while Killing Tally's persistent +30% damage for as long as you don't swap or reload is the standout damage perk. Or, alternatively, Surrounded will add +47% damage when enhanced after Last Shape. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade or melee energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting (Boss or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Hung Jury SR4 (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Appended Mag), Kinetic Tremors, (Explosive Payload, One For All)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. This is the fourth iteration of Hung Jury SR4 (Shiny), and it's as much of a stat monster as ever. Being a precision frame, you don't really need to worry about recoil direction, and as a scout rifle you don't need to think about range either - use the barrel and mag perks to boost handling or stability, and maybe a little reload speed instead. The BRAVE Hung Jury offers Kinetic Tremors in the first trait perk column, which you can pair with another damage perk in the second - Explosive Payload just works all the time, or One For All is +35% damage when procced. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Elsie's Rifle (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator), (High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Repulsor Brace, (Frenzy, Desperate Measures)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly for void subclasses. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. A D1 blast from the past, Elsie's Rifle has great stats and the frame adds accuracy for firing when stationery or not moving much. A little extra recoil direction with the barrel perk will help controlling shots, and any of the combat effect rounds or Flared Magwell for reload speed and a touch of stability are the mag perk top choices. Probably more for void Gyrfalcon Hunters, with easy access to volatile rounds, Repulsor Brace gives you a high uptime on void overshields, while Frenzy or Desperate Measures are great damage boosting options. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Elsie's Rifle (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator), (High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly for void subclasses. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. A D1 blast from the past, Elsie's Rifle has great stats and the frame adds accuracy for firing when stationery or not moving much. A little extra recoil direction with the barrel perk will help controlling shots, and any of the combat effect rounds or Flared Magwell for reload speed and a touch of stability are the mag perk top choices. If you're running a void subclass and not a Gyrfalcon Hunter, or if you're not running void and want access to some of the void verbs, Repulsor Brace gives you access to a void overshield for defeating targets made volatile by Destabilizing Rounds. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Elsie's Rifle (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator), (High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Rewind Rounds, (Frenzy, Desperate Measures)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. A D1 blast from the past, Elsie's Rifle has great stats and the frame adds accuracy for firing when stationery or not moving much. A little extra recoil direction with the barrel perk will help controlling shots, and any of the combat effect rounds or Flared Magwell for reload speed and a touch of stability are the mag perk top choices. Rewind Rounds extends your magazine in the first trait column to pair with the 15% damage boost from Frenzy (plus 100 Handling and Reload Speed) or up to +30% damage from Desperate Measures. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// The Recluse (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Chambered Compensator, Corkscrew Rifling), (High-Caliber Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), (Threat Detector, Enlightened Action, Feeding Frenzy), (Surrounded, Desperate Measures)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Recluse is back and with even better range than the original. As a lightweight frame, you'll get the +20 mobility and +6.25% speed bonus to start. Add in a little extra stability in the barrel perk for easier control, and your preference of combat effect mag perk. Use the first trait perk to help with reloads, like Threat Detector, Enlightened Action or Feeding Frenzy, and then look for second column damage perks such as Surrounded (which will be enhanceable in Final Shape for +47% damage), or Desperate Measures for up to +30% damage. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. // Edge Transit (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Hard Launch, Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), Spike Grenades, Envious Assassin, Bait and Switch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The meme-machine is back and, although the stats are average, it's a beast for boss damage. Reducing the blast radium with Hard Launch does boost impact damage a little, otherwise go for a barrel perk that boosts Velocity and Handling, and Spike Grenades adds a little extra impact damage too. As the first trait perk, Envious Assassin can overfill the magazine to 18, which you can use with Bait and Switch's +30% damage bonus for some serious boss damage. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling, with a damage boosting (Boss or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Falling Guillotine (Shiny) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge), Swordmaster's Guard, (Frenzy, Vorpal Weapon, Relentless Strikes), (Surrounded, Bait and Switch, Whirlwind Blade)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 102 from 23 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5kuhrmYKBDwvLtzZJQmxiK?si=7f73118bec6743ac) with @Saint_Kabr, @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Falling Guillotine is a decent, legendary choice for boss damage, particularly now that the BRAVE version can roll with two damage perks. As usual, look for a blade perk that boosts impact, and then Swordmaster's Guard as the guard perk for a bit of everything useful. In the first trait column, Frenzy provides the largest passive damage bonus of +15%, but Vorpal Weapon is still +10% or the old classic Relentless Strikes will extend sword ammo. In the second trait column, Surrounded provides +35% damage (+42% when enhanced) but only when in a crowd, or both Bait and Switch and Whirlwind Blade provide +30% when procced. The Indomitability origin trait seems built for the Prismatic subclass, generating grenade of melle energy according to your subclass type. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting (Boss, Major or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Retraced Path (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Battery, Light Battery. Enhanced Battery), Shoot To Loot, (One For All, Golden Tricorn)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Retraced Path was our first legendary Trace Rifle, and has some very useful combinations. Use the barrel and battery to improve range, stability, reload speed or battery capacity. Shoot to Loot is really useful in raids and end-game content, particularly if you're a Warlock running Cenotaph Mask to mark targets. You have a range of second-column trait perk options - One For All is an easily triggered 35% damage boost, or Golden Tricorn provides a useful 15% with one stack or 50% with two (easily achieved with the solar toolkit!). The Hot Swap origin trait is always useful for a snappier gunfeel when you swap weapons. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

dimwishlist:item=548958835&perks=2610012052,3250034553,3700496672,732557052

// Retraced Path (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Battery, Light Battery. Enhanced Battery), Shoot To Loot, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a solar subclass. Retraced Path was our first legendary Trace Rifle, and has some very useful combinations. Use the barrel and battery to improve range, stability, reload speed or battery capacity. Shoot to Loot is really useful in raids and end-game content, particularly if you're a Warlock running Cenotaph Mask to mark targets. Incandescent is great for dealing with groups of enemy adds, particularly with a solar subclass fragments and access to enhanced scorch and ignition. The Hot Swap origin trait is always useful for a snappier gunfeel when you swap weapons. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=548958835&perks=1840239774,2749775325,3700496672,4293542123

// Retraced Path (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Corkscrew Rifling), (Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery, Tactical Battery, Light Battery), Shoot To Loot, (One For All, Golden Tricorn)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Retraced Path was our first legendary Trace Rifle, and has some very useful combinations. Use the barrel and battery to improve range, stability, reload speed or battery capacity. Shoot to Loot is really useful in raids and end-game content, particularly if you're a Warlock running Cenotaph Mask to mark targets. For an all-purpose damage boost, Frenzy adds 15% damage just for being in combat, and boosts reload and handling to 100. You probably won't feel the Hot Swap origin trait with Frenzy, but it's always useful for a snappier gunfeel when you first swap weapons. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// The Other Half (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge), Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, Surrounded
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Major and Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. The Other Half returns with a few new perks, so if you haven't got one yet Dares of Eternity awaits! Boost the damage with the blade perk, and then Swordmaster's Guard adds a little bit of everything useful. While Eager Edge was the unique Dares perk back in the day, it's appeared elsewhere since so Relentless Strikes is probably the more sensible first column trait perk to combine with Surrounded in the second for 35% (41.8% when enhanced) bonus damage when in a crowd. The Hot Swap origin trait is always useful for boosting charge time and guarding stats when you first swap to it. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// The Slammer (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge), Swordmaster's Guard, Chain Reaction, Cold Steel
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a Stasis subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Slammer is our first vortex frame Stasis sword, with the same stats as its peers. Boost the damage with the blade perk, and then Swordmaster's Guard adds a little bit of everything useful. For add clearing, the trait perk combination, that's unique to The Slammer, of Chain Reaction and Cold Steel spreads slow stacks (which you can improve with Stasis subclass fragments) with the add kill explosions and, when enhanced, Cold Steel also adds a useful 10 to the inventory stat for additional ammo reserves. You'll probably find more use for the Vanguard's Vindication origin trait, unless there's a champion mod around for swords that works with Stunning Recovery. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

Boost the damage with the blade perk, and then Swordmaster's Guard adds a little bit of everything useful. For add clearing, the trait perk combination, that's unique to The Slammer, of Chain Reaction and Cold Steel spreads slow stacks (which you can improve with Stasis subclass fragments) with the add kill explosions and, when enhanced, Cold Steel also adds a useful 10 to the inventory stat for additional ammo reserves. // The Prophet (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Chambered Compensator, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds), (Rapid Hit, Demolitionist, Keep Away), (Explosive Payload, Precision Instrument)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clearing in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Prophet is the first stasis aggressive frame scout rifle and while it has good stats it's not a very competitive subtype for PvE unfortunately. It's got a bit of a kick so, even on M+KB you might benefit from boosted stability with the barrel and mag perks. The trait perks are a bit underwhelming too - Rapid Hit is probably best in the first column, with Demolitionist and possibly Keep Away also useful for the reload boost. In the second column, Explosive Payload is, again, probably best or Precision Instrument can be okay if you're hitting your headshots. Of the origin traits, Alacrity is best if you're running solo, in endgame activities to help clutch when everyone else is dead, or One Quiet Moment can be useful when in cover. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// The Prophet (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Chambered Compensator, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds), (Rapid Hit, Demolitionist, Keep Away), Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for Minor Spec add clearing in end-game content, particularly with a Stasis subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Prophet is the first stasis aggressive frame scout rifle and while it has good stats it's not a very competitive subtype for PvE unfortunately. It's got a bit of a kick so, even on M+KB you might benefit from boosted stability with the barrel and mag perks. The trait perks are a bit underwhelming too - Rapid Hit is probably best in the first column, with Demolitionist and possibly Keep Away also useful for the reload boost. In the second column, you should be able to create Stasis crystals easily enough, to synergise with the subclass fragments, but they'll be a long way away! Of the origin traits, Alacrity is best if you're running solo, in endgame activities to help clutch when everyone else is dead, or One Quiet Moment can be useful when in cover. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// The Summoner (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Chambered Compensator, Arrohead Brake, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore. Corkscrew Rifling), (Hammer-Forged Rifling, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Heal Clip, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly with a Solar subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Summoner returns with great stats and an interesting PvE perk pool. The recoil could do with a little taming, so you can use barrel and mag perks to help, or go with the combat effect magansine of your choice. For the trait perks, Heal Clip and Incandescent can both be improved by solar subclass fragments, but even without them will cure 120 health for you and 60 for Guardians around you for reloading after a kill, and Incandescent spreads scorch and ignites enemies. Of the origin traits, Alacrity is best if you're running solo, in endgame activities to help clutch when everyone else is dead but honestly, Wild Card is much more fun. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// The Summoner (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Chambered Compensator, Arrohead Brake, Polyconal Rifling, Smallbore. Corkscrew Rifling), (Hammer-Forged Rifling, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Heal Clip, Onslaught
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly with a Solar subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Summoner returns with great stats and an interesting PvE perk pool. The recoil could do with a little taming, so you can use barrel and mag perks to help, or go with the combat effect magansine of your choice. For the trait perks, Heal Clip can be improved by solar subclass fragments, but even without them will cure 120 health for you and 60 for Guardians around you for reloading after a kill. Then Onslaught is loads of fun - but you'll need as much stability as you can to control things at three stacks. Of the origin traits, Alacrity is best if you're running solo, in endgame activities to help clutch when everyone else is dead but honestly, Wild Card is much more fun. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Summoner returns with great stats and an interesting PvE perk pool. The recoil could do with a little taming, so you can use barrel and mag perks to help, or go with the combat effect magansine of your choice. For the trait perks, Perpetual Motion is just a useful all-around boost to gunfeel to pair with a second column damage perk like Onslaught (the extra stability is hand to control the recoil at three stacks), Golden Tricorn or Target Lock. Of the origin traits, Alacrity is best if you're running solo, in endgame activities to help clutch when everyone else is dead but honestly, Wild Card is much more fun. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Chambered Compensator, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Steady Rounds), Attrition Orbs, Under Over), (Frenzy, Kinetic Tremors)

First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. MultiMach CCX has the lightweight frame's +20 Mobility and +6.25% speed bonus, and the stats are great - it's just a shame there's nothing here to get excited about for PvE. If you must (really?), look for stability to help with keeping shots on target and then - are you absolutely insisting still? - Attrition Orbs or Under Over in the first trait perk column, and Frenzy with Kinetic Tremors in a distant second. Of the origin traits, Field Tested provides solid escalating gunfeel boosts for landing hits, as long as you don't die. // Tusk of the Boar (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quickl Launch, Smart Drift Hard Launch, Linear Compensator), High-Velocity Rounds, (Slideways, Grave Robber, Enlighted Action), Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Tusk of the Boar is the first wave frame grenade launcher, with decent stats in comparison to its energy-slot peers. Generally, you'll want to increase velocity and add a bit of handling if you can with the barrel and mag perks. Use the first trait perk to bypass or improve the reload - Slideways is best, but Grave Robber or Enlightened Action can work too. Chain Reaction is the go-to second trait perk for additional explosive AoE damage on kills, to speed add clearing. Of the origin traits, Field Tested provides solid escalating gunfeel boosts for landing hits, as long as you don't die. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

dimwishlist:item=1218113510&perks=1441682018,1631667848,2396489472,2822142346

// Tusk of the Boar (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Hard Launch, Linear Compensator), High-Velocity Rounds, Slice, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 101 from 17 April 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/1CJQuqM89I7hWA9KYvjCop?si=arncPmZ1SseRp6Atuf1ilw) with @ImpetusAlways and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with Hunters on Strand subclasses. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Tusk of the Boar is the first wave frame grenade launcher, with decent stats in comparison to its energy-slot peers. Generally, you'll want to increase velocity and add a bit of handling if you can with the barrel and mag perks. In the first trait column Slice is very useful against harder-hitting enemies to sever them and reduce their damage output - it's easiest to proc with the Hunter dodge and can be improved with Thread of Continuity. Chain Reaction is the go-to second trait perk for additional explosive AoE damage on kills, to speed add clearing and spread sever over a wider area. Of the origin traits, Field Tested provides solid escalating gunfeel boosts for landing hits, as long as you don't die. Recommended MW: Velocity or Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

If you are like me and don't have Forbearance, you're just gonna grab the already tried and true roll of Ambitious Assassin and Chain Reaction. Unrelenting in column 3 is arguably better than Ambitious Assassin as it only takes 3 kills to activate and should work with Chain Reaction. If you're using the new Forbearance on a grenade heavy build this version could be better with the origin trait giving 5% grenade charge back." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// The Mountaintop
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "We can still make Mountaintop into a formidable weapon and certainly one to chase. Ambitious Assassin allows up to two shots per magazine after a kill, if you were to pair that with Frenzy for 100 reload you could use this for back to back firing against a boss. The added 15% damage boost won't hurt either. Vorpal weapon is another flat 15% damage boost. The best bang for your shot is Recombination. This gives you a 100% damage increase for any 10 elemental weapon kills. If you ever wanted Izanagi’s Burden in the form of a grenade launcher, Recombination paired with Auto-Loading Holster will be the roll to grab." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Edge Transit
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Oh how the meme’s be meme’ing. Edge Transit used to drop as often as glimmer. We used to be swimming in them, with how often they used to drop. Now we are asking for more drops of Edge Transit. The hottest DPS weapon outside of Cataphract GL3 (Adept). For the moment we can stack extra rounds into the magazine with Augmented Drum and Envious Assassin, and then hot swap over to Spike Grenades and Cascade Point on some Holo-foil rolls. Pair that with either Explosive Light or Bait and Switch for incredible damage. Bait and Switch will last the whole extended magazine, but (soon to be) enhanced Explosive Light will last 7 shots. If you nail just one roll out of all the Edge Transits I would look for Cascade Point and Explosive Light to be able to nuke most majors, champions, and bosses with ease." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// The Recluse
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Recluse has not only been power crept from its former self with things like Funnelweb, IKELOS_SMG_v1.0.3, CALUS Mini-Tool, and even The Title from the recent Guardian Games. Did we know The Recluse was coming back to take its throne? Not at the time. But we can say for certain it's here to stay. Subsistence, Enlightened Action, or Feeding Frenzy are all great perks to maximize the reload or bypass having to reload one way or another. Repulsor Brace is incredible with Void subclasses, but you don't need to be on Void to take advantage of this SMG. Desperate Measures can work on any subclass and has great synergy with any of the reload perks. Obviously a damage + reload combo will be good but having something that doesn't necessarily lean into any of the subclass verbs can make it easier to translate across builds and activities. Would you be better with a more subclass focused roll? Highly depends on your build." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Falling Guillotine
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Falling Guillotine and its predecessor Dark-Drinker are some of my favorite swords. I still have my Guillotine and if it wasn't for the titan swords being so silly to run around with I'd still probably be using my Guillotine to this day. If you never got one from Arrivals or didn't get the roll you wanted, this is your time. Double damage perks in the third and fourth columns propell Falling Guillotine to the best sword in the game. Frenzy being a nice 15% damage buff with an additional 40% damage buff via surrounded on top gives Falling Guillotine the highest damage potential in the game. If you don't want to have to think about Surrounded being up and accidentally spinning too hard and deleting a few enemies from existence, you could go for a safer pick in Bait and Switch. You lose 5% in damage but make up for it in reliability. Another fun option which seems to be trending with the Brave Arsenal is the combination of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Elsie's Rifle
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Elsie's Rifle is a throwback to D1, and another good weapon Bungie could have brought back was Murmur, the element switching fusion *from the Moon.* Jokes aside, Elsie's Rifle is incredible. Rewind Rounds or Feeding Frenzy paired with Desperate Measures or Desperado, any combination of the above will be more than lethal. Arrowhead Brake is a must have regardless of what activity you bring this rifle into, I don't know if there's a small bug within the timelines of this rifle but having Arrowhead Brake fixes a large majority of issues." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// The Mountaintop (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "We can still make Mountaintop into a formidable weapon and certainly one to chase. Ambitious Assassin allows up to two shots per magazine after a kill, if you were to pair that with Frenzy for 100 reload you could use this for back to back firing against a boss. The added 15% damage boost won't hurt either. Vorpal weapon is another flat 15% damage boost. The best bang for your shot is Recombination. This gives you a 100% damage increase for any 10 elemental weapon kills. // Edge Transit (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Oh how the meme’s be meme’ing. Edge Transit used to drop as often as glimmer. We used to be swimming in them, with how often they used to drop. Now we are asking for more drops of Edge Transit. The hottest DPS weapon outside of Cataphract GL3 (Adept). For the moment we can stack extra rounds into the magazine with Augmented Drum and Envious Assassin, and then hot swap over to Spike Grenades and Cascade Point on some Holo-foil rolls. Pair that with either Explosive Light or Bait and Switch for incredible damage. Bait and Switch will last the whole extended magazine, but (soon to be) enhanced Explosive Light will last 7 shots. If you nail just one roll out of all the Edge Transits I would look for Cascade Point and Explosive Light to be able to nuke most majors, champions, and bosses with ease." // The Recluse (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Recluse has not only been power crept from its former self with things like Funnelweb, IKELOS_SMG_v1.0.3, CALUS Mini-Tool, and even The Title from the recent Guardian Games. Did we know The Recluse was coming back to take its throne? Not at the time. But we can say for certain it's here to stay. Subsistence, Enlightened Action, or Feeding Frenzy are all great perks to maximize the reload or bypass having to reload one way or another. Repulsor Brace is incredible with Void subclasses, but you don't need to be on Void to take advantage of this SMG. Desperate Measures can work on any subclass and has great synergy with any of the reload perks. Obviously a damage + reload combo will be good but having something that doesn't necessarily lean into any of the subclass verbs can make it easier to translate across builds and activities. Would you be better with a more subclass focused roll? Highly depends on your build." Recommended MW: Stability.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Falling Guillotine (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Falling Guillotine and its predecessor Dark-Drinker are some of my favorite swords. If you never got one from Arrivals or didn't get the roll you wanted, this is your time. Double damage perks in the third and fourth columns propell Falling Guillotine to the best sword in the game. Frenzy being a nice 15% damage buff with an additional 40% damage buff via surrounded on top gives Falling Guillotine the highest damage potential in the game. If you don't want to have to think about Surrounded being up and accidentally spinning too hard and deleting a few enemies from existence, you could go for a safer pick in Bait and Switch. You lose 5% in damage but make up for it in reliability. Another fun option which seems to be trending with the Brave Arsenal is the combination of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds." // Hammerhead (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "There has never been a more iconic legendary machine gun in Destiny 2 outside of Hammerhead. My old Feeding Frenzy and Rampage has been collecting dust but nothing else feels as good. The Brave version of Hammerhead can roll Rewind (WeeWoo) Rounds and Fourth Time's the Charm which will both refund ammo back into your magazine. Envious Assassin will allow you to overflow the magazine to over 200 if you also slot in a backup mag mod. Pair any of those perks will work wonderfully with your “damage” perk of choice. Onslaught will ramp up the RPM to 714, giving you incredible DPS. Killing Tally is one of the best damage perks for machine guns (and trace rifles). It doesn't go away until you reload which is where magazine extending perks like Rewind Rounds or Fourth Time's the Charm work well. Desperate Measures is the best of both worlds combining Adrenaline Junkie / Swashbuckler and Golden Tricorn." Recommended MW: Range, Stability, Handling, Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Midnight Coup (Holofoil)
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Midnight Coup is still my most used weapon of all time in PvE. I float around too much to stick with one weapon. I almost dethroned the King with Austringer back in Season of Opulence, but the King still stands tall. The newest version seeks the throne from the prototype and I'm looking to get a nice Holo-foil roll with double perks to really get the best of all worlds. Firefly is arguably the best perk in the third column as it provides AoE damage, and a reload speed bump. This way you won't have to spec into reload at all as the base 56 gets brought up to 100 with Firefly. Explosive Payload is also a flat damage increase in PvE and helps with stunning champions when Hand Cannon mods are up. Finally we have Shoot to Loot, this coupled with the next perk in column 4 can pick up orbs and ammo from across the map. That specific perk is Kinetic Tremors. Kinetic Tremors will activate after 6 shots, which will most likely happen against bosses, champions, or majors. If you wanted a more “on demand” perk, you could choose One for All which has the potential to ramp up after just one well timed and placed crit, knock out 3 enemies and you've got a 35% damage increase. The final perk you should at least try is Desperate Measures, it works with any ability build and allows you to flex between Swashbuckler / Adrenaline Junkie and Golden Tricorn; it isn't as build specific as the former two, and it is refreshable unlike the latter." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Darkest Before
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Darkest Before is now changed up and swapped to solar. With this change it synergizes better with solar subclass verbs. Heal Clip and Incandescent are fantastic together and allow you to push out your engagement ranges a bit further because it’s a pulse rifle. The issue I have with this is that Darkest Before is a rapid-fire frame, meaning it does really low damage per shot. Sometimes needing two or even three bursts for a red bar. Almost any other frame would be incredible. What a shame." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Relentless
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Relentless could overthrow Messenger for being the best legendary high-impact pulse in the game. Is it definitively better? Frenzy and Keep Away are both neutral perks that could do well with just about any combination of alternate perks." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Adjudicator
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Precision frame submachine guns are not good in PvE content, their low handling, reload speed, and stability are all important factors when mowing down waves of enemies. Subsistence and Feeding Frenzy both improve one of those limitations but I wouldn’t invest into those to make up for it. Onslaught will make Adjudicator feel more like other archetypes but won’t replace them." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
