// The Summoner
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "The Summoner in PvE has a few different options. You can opt for a Heal Clip roll to keep yourself alive, a Target Lock roll to take down champions and larger health enemies, or even an Onslaught roll to tear into waves of adds with the damage of an auto but the speed of an SMG. Take your pick. If you’re going Heal Clip I would recommend Incandescent. Target Lock will work best with Overflow and Onslaught with Subsistence. You can mix and match to your heart’s content, but those are my recommendations." Recommended MW: Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Prosecutor

Dragonfly doesn’t extend the Voltshot radius, but extra boom and zap does clear a room faster than one or the other. // A Sudden Death
//notes: pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "A Sudden Death is not a great shotgun for PvE, while you do have Envious Assassin and One-Two Punch which together allow you to never worry about reloading, I find rapid-fire frames at the opposite end of the shotgun spectrum better for One-Two Punch. Trench Barrel and Grave Robber are great combinations for “maining” this shotgun but an even better combination would be Destabilizing Rounds and Repulsor Brace, the issue with this combo is that it’s a shotgun and not a primary ammo weapon." Recommended MW: Range, Stability, Handling, or Reload Speed.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Adjudicator (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Alloy Mag, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), (Feeding Frenzy, Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion, Subsistence), Onslaught
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. Adjudicator has decent stats and, with a precision frame, you don't need to worry too much about the published Recoil Direction. A little extra stability helps keep bullets on target, and a little extra range is nice, so Smallbore or Corkscrew Rifling can help out, or Chambered Compensator can take Recoil Direction to 100 as well as adding stability, You'll be emptying the mag a lot, so reload speed is the magazine perk choice - Alloy Mag, Tactical Mag and Flared Magwell all help. In the first trait column as the support park, Feeding Frenzy, Threat Detector, Perpetual Motion and Subsistence all speed up reload as well as bumping up other useful stats, or delay the need to reload, for you to keep uptime for Onslaught, in the second trait column, to boost RPM for additional damage to mow down adds. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom - Subsistence kills keeps feeding ammo into the bottom half of the mag to extend the time the extra damage is procced. Recommended MW: Stability or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Adjudicator has decent stats and, with a precision frame, you don't need to worry too much about the published Recoil Direction. With Frenzy procced in the second perk column, you'll have a 15% damage boost, snappy handling and lightning fast reloads. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom - Subsistence kills keeps feeding ammo into the bottom half of the mag to extend the time the extra damage is procced. // Prosecutor (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore), (High Caliber Rounds, Armor Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Keep Away, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. Prosecutor has decent stats by comparison to its peers and as it's a precision frame, you should find it fairly easy to control despite the 69 recoil direction. With that being the case, you can push out the range with the barrel perk, and any of the combat effect rounds as a mag perk will add a little more - High-Cal rounds in particular will help stun your minor adds. If you're looking at Voltshot in the second trait column. you're going to need s snappy reload, so Flared Magwell can work well too. Keep Away is the only perk in the first trait column to add to reload, although to benefit, you'll need to keep your engagement solidly in the mid-range. Voltshot is fun, but remember that the perk inherits the weapon's combatant damage scaling, so it won't be as effective at clearing add crowds as a Voltshot hand cannon. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3483591058&perks=1482024992,1968497646,2173046394,3619207468
dimwishlist:item=3483591058&perks=1482024992,2173046394,3230963543,3619207468

// Prosecutor (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore), (Flared Magwell, High Caliber Rounds, Armor Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds), Dragonfly, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content. Prosecutor has decent stats by comparison to its peers and as it's a precision frame, you should find it fairly easy to control despite the 69 recoil direction. With that being the case, you can push out the range with the barrel perk, and any of the combat effect rounds as a mag perk will add a little more - High-Cal rounds in particular will help stun your minor adds. But, if you're looking at Voltshot in the second trait column. you're going to need s snappy reload, so Flared Magwell is worth a serious look. If you're looking for all the explosions, Dragonfly and Voltshot is fun, but remember that both perks inherit the weapon's combatant damage scaling, so it won't be as effective at clearing add crowds as a Dragonfly/ Voltshot hand cannon. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Recommended MW: SReload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Prosecutor (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Extended Barrel), (High Caliber Rounds, Armor Piercing Rounds, Ricochet Rounds), Rewind Rounds, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Prosecutor has decent stats by comparison to its peers and as it's a precision frame, you should find it fairly easy to control despite the 69 recoil direction. With that being the case, you can push out the range with the barrel perk, and any of the combat effect rounds as a mag perk will add a little more - High-Cal rounds in particular will help stun your minor adds. Rewind Rounds is a cunning plan to take advantage of the origin trait's bottom of the mag damage boost by continually refreshing the bottom half of the mag, while Golden Tricorn's second damage stack is easy to proc with the Arc 3.0 toolkit, for a very hefty 50% damage boost. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Judgment (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fastdraw HCS, Steadyhand HCS, Truesight HCS), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell, Alloy Mag), Headstone, (Timed Payload, Adrenaline Junkie)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a Stasis subclass. Judgment is back in a new Stasis form, although the stats are showing its age. On the plus side, you do still have Sight perks rather than barrels to choose from - Fastdraw, Steadyhand and Truesight all help to round out stats nicely. You can help reload speed with the mag perk - Tactical Mag is the top pick, but Flared Magwell or even Alloy Mag can work too. It's very unusual to see Headstone in the first trait perk slot, creating crystals to synergise with the Stasis fragments. Timed Payload looks interesting, although splitting impact and explosive damage might not play well with Headstone. Alternatively Adrenaline Junkie, when procced, will mean any Headstone crystals you create will share the same damage buffs when shattered. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Relentless (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Hammer-Forged Rifling), (Armor Piercing Rounds, High Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Light Mag, Flared Magwell), Slice, Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly with a Strand subclass. Relentless returns as a Strand pulse rifle with below average stats that reveal its Season 1 origin. The recoil direction of 65 is vertical, if a little loose, so you either look to improve it further or, if you can handle the recoil, push out the range with your barrel perk. Any of the combat effect mag perks add further range in addition to the bullet behaviour, or Light Mag and Flared Magwell improve reload speed. You don't need to run a strand subclass but if you do then Slice and Hatchling can sever enemies to reduce their damage output (very useful in a boss fight to help your fireteam), and generate Threadlings for additional damage to synergise with your fragments. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=435821041&perks=1482024992,3230963543,831391274,923806249
dimwishlist:item=435821041&perks=3230963543,4090651448,831391274,923806249

// Darkest Before (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Armor Piercing Rounds, High Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell, Light Mag), Heal Clip Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly with a Solar subclass. Darkest Before is back in a solar, rather than arc configuration, with the same strong stat package as before. The recoil direction of 64 is pretty controllable, but if you want to make it even more reliable, Arrowhead Brake will take it to 94. If you're happy with the recoil, there's no harm in pushing out the range with your barrel perk instead. Any of the combat effect mag perks add further range in addition to the bullet behaviour, or Light Mag and Flared Magwell improve reload speed. You can find the Heal Clip/ Incandescent trait perk combination on other pulse rifles but it is very nice to help keep your fireteam's health topped up, while you're incinerating crowds of minor spec adds while synergising with your solar subcalss fragments. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Recommended MW: Range or Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=435821040&perks=1968497646,3017780555,4293542123,839105230
dimwishlist:item=435821040&perks=1561002382,3017780555,4293542123,839105230
dimwishlist:item=435821040&perks=1482024992,1561002382,3017780555,4293542123
dimwishlist:item=435821040&perks=1885400500,3017780555,4293542123,839105230

dimwishlist:item=435821040&perks=3017780555,3230963543,4293542123,839105230

// A Sudden Death (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling), (Assault Mag, Tactical Mag), (Threat Detector, Envious Assassin), Trench Barrel
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Minor and Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. A Sudden Death returns as void, rather than arc shotgun with the rather poor stats you'd expect from a Year 1 gun. If you already have a burst damage void shotgun then feel free to pass as it's likely a fair bit better. If you are making do, then Barrel Shroud or Corkscrew Rifling pad out the Handling stats a little as the barrel perk, and Assault Mag speeds up shots, or Tactical Mag adds one to the mag as the magazine perk. You could take your choice of either Threat Detector's Handling and Reload buffs or Envious Assassin for an overflowed magazine to start an engagement with. Trench Barrel bumps up damage by 50% for three shots when procced - although you'll obviously need to be right up close to take advantage! The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=4097972038&perks=1300023272,2360754333,791862061,968510818
dimwishlist:item=4097972038&perks=2360754333,4090651448,791862061,968510818
dimwishlist:item=4097972038&perks=106909392,1300023272,2360754333,968510818
dimwishlist:item=4097972038&perks=106909392,2360754333,4090651448,968510818

// A Sudden Death (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Barrel Shroud, Corkscrew Rifling, Full Choke), (Assault Mag, Tactical Mag), (Threat Detector, Envious Assassin), One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 97 from 13 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/4Uy7pfo5Thjtt2MF4vZitv?si=8e3adcb68d234006) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Minor and Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. A Sudden Death returns as void, rather than arc shotgun with the rather poor stats you'd expect from a Year 1 gun. If you already have a burst damage void shotgun then feel free to pass as it's likely a fair bit better. If you are making do, then Barrel Shroud or Corkscrew Rifling pad out the Handling stats a little, or Full Choke tightens the pellet spread as the barrel perk, and Assault Mag speeds up shots, or Tactical Mag adds one to the mag as the magazine perk. You could take your choice of either Threat Detector's Handling and Reload buffs or Envious Assassin for an overflowed magazine to start an engagement with. One-Two Punch doubles melee damage when procced for fast burst damage against majors and champions. The Crossing Over origin trait is useful all around for PvE, with bumps to range and handling in the top half of a magazine, and a small 3% damage boost at the bottom. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

dimwishlist:item=4097972038&perks=106909392,1300023272,2679249093,968510818

// Taraxippos (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended May, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell), Fourth Time's The Charm, Explosive Payload
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 98 from 19 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0cxvW6vTZVWtwmXkqr7g1f?si=66932432408046d2) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Still the only Lightweight Strand scout rifle with pretty solid stats. For min-maxxers, the +20 Mobility from the intrinsic perk and +6.25% movement speed can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to control the recoil, as well as flesh out the stats with the barrel perk. For the magazine perk, you're looking to reduce reload speed, or boost magazine size (or a bit of everything with Tactical Mag). Fourth Time's The Charm in the first trait column as your support perk is always welcome to extend your mag size, while Explosive Payload in the second column as the signature perk passively boosts PvE damage. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3007479950&perks=106909392,1354429876,1840239774,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=3007479950&perks=1087426260,1354429876,1840239774,3038247973
dimwishlist:item=3007479950&perks=1354429876,1840239774,3038247973,3230963543

// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended May, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell), (Fourth Time's The Charm, Enlighened Action, Keep Away), Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 98 from 19 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0cxvW6vTZVWtwmXkqr7g1f?si=66932432408046d2) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a Strand subclass. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Named after a ghost that frightened horses at a particular spot on the Olympia race course during ancient games there. Still the only Lightweight Strand scout rifle with pretty solid stats. For min-maxxers, the +20 Mobility from the intrinsic perk and +6.25% movement speed can help to flesh out builds. Taraxippos is fast-firing, so you will need to control the recoil, as well as flesh out the stats with the barrel perk. For the magazine perk, you're looking to reduce reload speed, or boost magazine size (or a bit of everything with Tactical Mag). In the first trait column as your support perk, you can choose Fourth Time's The Charm is always welcome to extend your mag size Enlightened Action to boost reload speed and handling, or Keep Away for easier crit hits, while Hatchling can boost damage with spawned Threadlings in the second column as the second column signature perk, particularly when using the Rebirth fragment. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Or, Omolon Fluid Dynamics adds stability and reload speed to the top half of your mag. // The Title (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Fluid Barrel Polygonal Rifling), (High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell), (Pugilist, Grave Robber), Swashbuckler
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 98 from 19 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0cxvW6vTZVWtwmXkqr7g1f?si=66932432408046d2) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly for melee builds. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Title has decent stats in a crowded and competitive subfamily, including vertical recoil of 85 and 15 zoom, where 14 is the norm. Use the barrel perk to boost handling and/or stability, and the the combat effect magazine perks all have a place, or just look to boost reload speed with Alloy Mag or Flared Magwell. If you're building around a melee gamestyle, in the first trait column you should be looking at Pugilist or Grave Robber to pair with Swashbuckler in the second. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Hakke Breach Armaments adds damage to vehicles and constructs, but that's probably not as useful here. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// The Title (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore, Fluid Barrel Polygonal Rifling), (High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell), Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 98 from 19 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0cxvW6vTZVWtwmXkqr7g1f?si=66932432408046d2) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly for void subclasses. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. The Title has decent stats in a crowded and competitive subfamily, including vertical recoil of 85 and 15 zoom, where 14 is the norm. Use the barrel perk to boost handling and/or stability, and the the combat effect magazine perks all have a place, or just look to boost reload speed with Alloy Mag or Flared Magwell. You can find the combination of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds on a few different weapons - you could argue that it's better on auto-rifles like Ros Arago or Age-Old Bond - but the combination of an overshield and volatile enemies in CQC is definitely a fun one, especially when paired with void fragments like Echo of Persistence. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Hakke Breach Armaments adds damage to vehicles and constructs, but that's probably not as useful here. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Hullabaloo (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), High-Velocity Rounds, Voltshot, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 98 from 19 March 2024 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0cxvW6vTZVWtwmXkqr7g1f?si=66932432408046d2) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with arc subclasses. If you find a roll you like, keep for the ability to enhance perks when Final Shape arrives. Only the second heavy wave-frame GL, so there's not a big pool to compare against, but it's noticeable that Hullabaloo has lower inventory stat than Dimensional Hypotrochoid, so you can't carry a many reserves and don't get as many shots per heavy brick - you'll likely need to run some ammo reserve mods. There's not much to tinker with stats-wise with the barrel and mag perks - we're looking for reload speed, velocity, and handling. For a little arc synergy, but mostly for the extra jolt lethality, Voltshot is a very fun option for the first trait column, working with Sparks of Ions and Discharge from the arc kit. Chain Reaction in the second column makes this your heavy Forbearance for crowd control - with the two traits in combination, you should be able to wipe out add-dense areas or spawns of even beefy enemies in end-game activities. The Classy Contender Origin Perk is useful - who would say no to extra class ability energy? Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=657927352&perks=2173046394,2396489472,2822142346,3525010810

// Ros Arago IV (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore), (Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), (Rewind Rounds, Subsistence), Onslaught
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 934 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0M24D3moUjRCXj0AtIsCCx?si=208c6d31bdb7453e) with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in general content. There aren't that many void auto-rifles obtainable in S23 and, while Ros Arago IV stats aren't great, there are still a couple of fun rolls worth looking out for. The Recoil Direction could probably do with some taming - Arrowhead Brake takes it to a much better looking 77. Otherwise, if you can control the shots, Smallbore adds a decent bump to range and stability as the barrel perk. In the magazine per slot, you could make an argument for Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell or Accurized Rounds to round out the stats a little further. Looking at Onslaught in the second trait column, the obvious pairings to keep the magazine topped off in the first column are Rewind Rounds or Subsistence. Finally, the submunitions generated by the Wild Card origin trait are great for helping soften up crowds. Recommended MW: Handling, Stability or Range, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Marcato-45 (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling, Extended Barrel, Polygonal Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Alloy Mag), (Threat Detector, Triple Tap, Demolitionist), Onslaught
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 934 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0M24D3moUjRCXj0AtIsCCx?si=208c6d31bdb7453e) with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content. Marcato-45 stars off with decent stats in comparison to its peers - although it has a small magazine, it compensates by having fairly hefty reserves. You'll need to keep the reticule on target, so choose a barrel perk that improves recoil direction or stability. Reload speed and mag size will also be important, so this is what to look for with the magazine perk choice. In the first trait column, Threat Detector, Triple Tap and Demolitionist are all good for either speeding up reloads or extending your magazine, while Onslaught will mow through minor adds, and be good for occasional burst damage against majors too. Recommended MW: Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=4233375372&perks=106909392,3400784728,839105230,95528736

dimwishlist:item=4233375372&perks=1087426260,1482024992,3400784728,95528736

// Crux Termination IV (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Hard Launch, Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), Impact Casing, (Envious Assassin, Reconstruction, Clown Cartridge), Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 934 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0M24D3moUjRCXj0AtIsCCx?si=208c6d31bdb7453e) with @Saint_Kabr and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major or Boss spec enemies in end-game content. As an aggressive RL, Crux Termination IV is in the highest damage category of rocket launchers, along with adaptive-frames, and has the highest velocity in its peer group to boot. You can look on the low blast radius as an advantage for boss fights, as you can get a bit closer without being killing yourself in the explosion. There's no Field Prep option, so you start off with 1 in the mag and 7 reserves, with one more rocket for each chest ammo reserve mod. Go for the highest velocity you can with the barrel perk and then, for boss damage, Impact Casing is always the best option. In the first trait column, you could look at Envious Assassin - up to three in the tube after 11 kills with other weapons. Alternatively Reconstruction passively provides 2 in the tube over the course of 8s, or Clown Cartridge does the same on a manual reload. For major or boss damage, Explosive Light provides up to 6 shots with +25% damage. Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1719687748&perks=3194351027,3525010810,3796465595,968510818
dimwishlist:item=1719687748&perks=3194351027,3796465595,3798852852,968510818
dimwishlist:item=1719687748&perks=1523832109,3194351027,3525010810,3796465595
dimwishlist:item=1719687748&perks=1523832109,3194351027,3796465595,3798852852
dimwishlist:item=1719687748&perks=2284787283,3194351027,3525010810,3796465595
dimwishlist:item=1719687748&perks=2284787283,3194351027,3796465595,3798852852

// Undercurrent (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Hard Launch, Linear Compensator), High-Velocity Rounds, Ambitious Assassin, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ) with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with an arc subclass. Undercurrent is a decent choice for an arc wave-frame grenade launcher if you don't have access to a Forbearance (or maybe even in addition to). The stats are worse - but it's not an end-game weapon so that's to be expected. Blast Radius has no meaningful effect, so maximise velocity, and try to help handling with the barrel perk. High-Velocity Rounds as the mag perk also usefully helps reload speed a bit too. For the first trait perk, Ambitious Assassin sets you up with two in the chamber (physics be damned) after a kill. With Voltshot as the second trait perk, you can alternate between an add-clearing shot to proc it, and then applying Jolt for crowd control or DoT against a beefier target. It requires the kill to set up, but Voltshot has a wider range of effect than Chain Reaction, so is probably worth a try, especially if you're running an arc subclass and add Sparks of Beacons, Ions and Discharge into the mix. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Velocity, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=1151688091&perks=2010801679,2173046394,2822142346,3525010810
dimwishlist:item=1151688091&perks=2010801679,2173046394,2822142346,3798852852
dimwishlist:item=1151688091&perks=1441682018,2010801679,2173046394,2822142346

// Undercurrent (Adept) (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control, Hard Launch, Linear Compensator), High-Velocity Rounds, Ambitious Assassin, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ) with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with an arc subclass. Undercurrent is a decent choice for an arc wave-frame grenade launcher if you don't have access to a Forbearance (or maybe even in addition to). The stats are worse - but it's not a Raid or Trials weapon so that's to be expected. Blast Radius has no meaningful effect, so maximise velocity, and try to help handling with the barrel perk. High-Velocity Rounds as the mag perk also usefully helps reload speed a bit too. For the first trait perk, Ambitious Assassin sets you up with two in the chamber (physics be damned) after a kill. With Voltshot as the second trait perk, you can alternate between an add-clearing shot to proc it, and then applying Jolt for crowd control or DoT against a beefier target. It requires the kill to set up, but Voltshot has a wider range of effect than Chain Reaction, so is probably worth a try, especially if you're running an arc subclass and add Sparks of Beacons, Ions and Discharge into the mix. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Velocity, with a damage boosting (Minor, Adept Big Ones or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=672957262&perks=2010801679,2173046394,2822142346,3525010810
dimwishlist:item=672957262&perks=2010801679,2173046394,2822142346,3798852852
dimwishlist:item=672957262&perks=1441682018,2010801679,2173046394,2822142346

// Uzume RR4 (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Polygonal Rifling, Fluted Barrel, Smallbore), (Appended Mag, Alloy Mag, Flared Magwell), (Fourth Time's The Charm, Clown Cartridge), Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ) with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec enemies in end-game content. Uzume RR4 has very nice stats in it's subfamily, but the 50 zoom is either a blessing or a curse, depending on your viewpoint. Either way this is only worth keeping if you don't have a decent solar sniper, or it's better than the one you're replacing. The recoil direction of 75 is vertical, but if you're firing repeatedly at a crit spot it's still a good idea to control it with a boost to recoil direction or additional stability from your barrel perk. Handling is always nice to have too. Appended Mag gets you an extra shot - you can also use Alloy Mag or Flared Magwell to boost reload speed as your mag perk instead. In the first trait column as the support park, Fourth Time's The Charm or Clown Cartridge are pretty much tied - if you can reliably hit crits, FttC might get you an extra shot more reliably before reloading. In the second as the signature perk, Vorpal Weapon is the best of the bunch for a permanently-on +15% against Major Spec and Boss Spec enemies. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting (Major or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Double-Edged Answer (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge), Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, (Whirlwind Blade, Surrounded)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ) with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage against Boss spec enemies in end-game content. Double-Edged Answer has awful base stats and a huge perk pool so, if you are looking for a roll, reset your Vanguard reputation a few times first. This shouldn't be your chase weapon but, if you need a waepon for boss damage, then Jagged Edge provides the most damage as a Blade perk, but decimates your ammo, so Honed Edge and Tempered Edge might be attractive alternatives, and Swordmaster's Guard provides a little bit of everything as the guard perk. For reliable boss damage, if you haven't got anything better, Relentless Strikes in the first trait column as the support perk refunds ammo after three hits, while either Whirlwind Blade provides an escalating 3% damage per hit topping off at +30% or, if you know there are other minor adds about, Surrounded boosts damage by a hefty 40%. Nadir Focus could be an interesting mini-Eager Edge - each light attack increases lunge distance, if you want some fun. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting (Major or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Retrofuturist (PvE first-choice roll)

First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major spec enemies in end-game content. Unfortunately, Retrofuturist is distinctly meh, so it's only worth hanging onto a roll if it fills a hole in your vault, and even then you'll have to reset your Crucible rank a few times to stand a decent chance of the roll you're after. As a Lightweight shotgun, you do get the +20 mobility and +6.25% movement speed and, for some reason, it has a base mags size of 7, but that's where the praise ends. If you're hanging onto one, try a barrel perk that adds Handling, although a bit of range and stability doesn't hurt either. Assault Mag and Tactical Mag are the best mag perk choices, but Appended Mag or Light Mag aren't bad. For burst damage against majors, the trait combination of Auto-Loading Holster and Trench Barrel is decent enough. // Incisor (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), (Ionized Battery, Enhanced Battery), Subsistence, Killing Tally
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ) with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing beefier Minor spec enemies in general content. Incisor may be the chase playlist activity weapon for S23, being the first legendary strand trace rifle - possibly worth the pain of Trials for! Excellent stats plus the Alacrity origin trait for solo play start us off. Recoil Direction is 94, so you don't need to worry too much. Handling and stability are both useful in a barrel perk. For the battery perk, we want as many charges as we can, so watch for Ionized or Enhanced Battery. For an add clearing weapon, pair Subsistence in the first trait column as the support perk and Killing Tally ini the second as the signature perk. You'll get an untimed +30% damage bonus after three kills, with those kills partially refilling the magazine. This works well for a Warlock running Cenotaph Mask to drop heavy ammo for a fireteam. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Belisarius-D (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Flared Magwell, Light Mag, Alloy Mag), (Slice, Rapid Hit, Keep Away), Hatchling
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ) with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content, particularly for Strand subclasses. Belisarius-D (Belisarius isn't a dinosaur, but rather a 5th Century Byzantine general) has strong stats but, like all Aggressive Burst pulse rifles, suffers poor handling and reload speed. Arrowhead Brake adds handling and corrects the recoil direction to 100 or Fluted Barrel gives the highest handling bump as the barrel perk. Flared Magwell, or as an alternative, Light Mag or Alloy Mag help out with reload in the magazine slot. The traits are mostly PvP flavoured but Slice and Hatchling in the first and second trait columns work together as a weapon to synergise with Strand subclass fragments - this could make it a good option as part of a Bait and Switch rotation with Slice reducing outgong damage from a major boss by 40% when procced - or alternatively, Rapid Hit and Keep Away, again in the first column bump up gunfeel stats. Short Action Stock is the stock of choice, for another +15 to handling. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage boosting (Boss Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Lethal Abundance (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Flared Magwell, Light Mag, Alloy Mag), (Slice, Enlightened Action), Onslaught

First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in general content, particularly for Strand subclasses. Lethal Abundance has decent stats, but as a High-Impact frame auto rifle this isn't going to be on too many people's wish list. as a subfamily, they generally have poor handling and reload speed, so that's what to boost in the barrel and mag perk slots. In the first trait column, Slice is useful when facing tankier enemies, applying 40% reduction in damage output from affected targets when procced after using your class ability, which also makes this a good swap weapon in a Bait and Switch rotation. Alternatively, Enlightened Action boosts both handling and reload speed just for hitting a target. // Breakneck (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling, Polygonal Rifling), (Extended Mag, Appended Mag), Subsistence, Onslaught
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 93 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/0uYGSQqlyX1faCyATCDuno?si=IMSCRgTRQr-_THJdjxFMIQ) with @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in general content. Breakneck is back, and has very solid stats, although it looks like we're never going to see the OG (and OP) Rampage/ Onslaught version again. As a precision frame AR, you don't need to worry about recoil direction, so if you want a variation on the curated version, you might prefer Smallbore or Corkscrew Rifling as your barrel park, but Extended Magazine or Appended Magazine are definitely the top two options for the magazine. For your general content add-clearing, the combination of Subsistence and Onslaught in the first and second trait columns should minimise your need to reloads while you're working your way through crowds of adds. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Breakneck (PvE first-choice roll)

First-choice PvE pick for add-clearing Minor spec enemies in end-game content. Breakneck is back, and has very solid stats, although it looks like we're never going to see the OG (and OP) Rampage/ Onslaught version again, As a precision frame AR, you don't need to worry about recoil direction, so if you're considering an alternative roll bumps to any combination of the stats should feel good in choosing barrel perk options. Any of the combat effect magazines add utility and then, in the first trait column, you can choose between Subsistence to keep your magazine topped off and Enlightened Action for better handling and reload speed. In the second column, Kinetic Tremors helps with crowd control around a target. // Appetence (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Chambered Compensator, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling), Enhanced Battery, Demolitionist, Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA) with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add clearing Minor spec enemies in general content, particularly with a Stasis subclass. Shapeable. Appetence (which means "a natural craving, desire or affinity", seeing as you're asking) is the first legendary Stasis trace rifle. It has decent stats, and some interesting trait combinations. Take your pick of handling and/or stability and maybe a touch of recoil direction, if you need it to be a perfect 100, for the barrel perk. Enhanced Battery increases the magazine without a reload penalty and, while Demolitionist on a trace rifle only returns the same grenade energy as a primary weapon, you should be getting enough kills to make the payoff worth it. Headstone generates Stasis crystals on crit kills, so lets you build into Stasis verbs and fragments - Whisper of Shards will further improve grenade recharge rates. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=4153087276&perks=124408337,1840239774,2680121939,3523296417
dimwishlist:item=4153087276&perks=124408337,2680121939,3523296417,4090651448

// Scatter Signal (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel), Enhanced Battery, Overflow, Controlled Burst
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA) with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major spec enemies, or fallback damage against Boss spec in end-game content. Shapeable. Scatter Signal is perhaps one of the best weapons for burst damage as at v7.3.0.5 - great all-round stats as well as offering excellent trait combinations. Controlling recoil, with nine bolts, is important, as is snappiness - Arrowhead Brake helps tidy up recoil direction, but you might consider Fluted Barrel for the combination of handling and stability instead. Enhanced Battery gives the same number of charges (8) as Ionized so, with one eye on Overflow, maximises the battery size. Enhanced Overflow will take your battery to 18 charges - you'll have one left in reserve. Adding two Reserve mods takes this to three reserve shots, and with Overflow topping up the battery, for just picking up an ammo brick, you might never need to reload. Controlled Burst reduces charge time to 414 and boosts damage by 20% for hitting all your bolts. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2558925366&perks=2594592626,2680121939,3643424744,839105230

// Supercluster (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore), (Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Appended Mag), (Fourth Time's the Charm, Reconstruction, Thread Detector, Lead From Gold), (Surrounded, Vorpal Weapon)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA) with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for fallback damage against Boss spec in end-game content. Shapeable. Supercluster is the first Strand pinpoint slug shotgun, and the good news is it has very competitive stats. The bad news is that they're not as great as they were a few years ago for boss DPS, but you might want to keep one just in case, if you don't have a slug shotty already. Use the barrel perk to boost range and the mag perk to improve its utility - your preference between Assault Mag or Tactical Mag, or Appended Mag. If you're looking for a backup DPS weapon, then a reloading perk in the first trait column - Fourth Time's The Charm, Reconstruction, Threat Detector, or Lead From Gold for you ammo economy are all possible. For a damage boosting perk in the second trait slot, choose between Surrounded, if you're likely to be in CQC with extra adds, or Vorpal Weapon for a reliable 15% boost to damage against Majors and Bosses. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Range, with a damage boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Lethophobia (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Elastic String, Flexible String, Polymer String), Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Straight Fletching), Successful Warm-Up, Explosive Head
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA) with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for Minor spec add clearing in general content. Shapeable. Lethophobia (or "fear of forgetting", seeing as you're asking) offers +20 Mobility and +6.25% movement speed as the Lightweight Frame bonus but, honestly the stats are poor and it's difficult to recommend for PvE. If you do want to try it out, the tactic with Bowstrong and Arrow perks is to reduce the draw time and improve accuracy. As the support perk in the first trait column, Successful Warm up improves draw time further, although you don't have to get a kill first, Explosive Head in the second as the signature perk is the reliable boost to damage and flinch that it always is. The Dragon's Vengeance origin trait can be useful, although it only procs once your health bar turns red or an ally dies. You'll get a reload and 11s of a boost to range and either charge rate or handling. Recommended MW: Draw Time, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Doomed Petitioner (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Chambered Compensator, Arrowhead Brake), Ionized Battery, Envious Assassin, (Precision Instrument, Surrounded)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 92 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/2qpoxXfXzBXohHBrdQnHbd?si=aH9jqq3kRwOtwQoh2YhHDA) with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained Boss spec damage in end-game content. Shapeable. Although Doomed Petitioner's stats are on the low side, if you don't already have a LFR for sustained boss damage, this will do nicely. A touch of stability and recoil direction from Chambered Compensator or Arrowhead Brake, and a maximised battery size of 6 with Ionized Battery sets you up nicely for Envious Assassin in the first trait column. Enhanced Envious Assassin will load 18 shots into the battery, leaving you 1 in reserve (2 with one Reserve mod, or 4 with two or three mods). You can choose between Enhanced Precision Instrument for 30% bonus damage after 6 crit hits or Enhanced Surrounded (useful against Ir Yut) for +47% damage when you're in a crowd. // Tigerspite (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Full Bore, Extended Barrel, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds), Subsistence, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec) with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Tigerspite has fairly middle-of-the-road stats and a more PvP-oriented trait pool but, if you like the subtype then there are a few interesting rolls. As with all precision weapon subtypes, you can start by not worrying too much about recoil direction, so you might as well push out the range with your barrel perk option. Any of the combat effect rounds in the mag perk slot (Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber or Ricochet Rounds) will add a tiny bit more range and utility in a firefight. In the first trait slot as the support perk, Subsistence really is the best (maybe only) trait that works for PvE while Frenzy is easy to proc and adds +15% damage, and 100 Handling and Reload, once it's procced. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Waking Vigil (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Smallbore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Extended Barrel, Full Bore), (Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds), Subsistence, (Kinetic Tremors, Attrition Orbs), (Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion), Dragonfly

First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in general content. As a former Lightweight HC that's been crowbarred into the Adaptive subfamily, the stats look very weird, with low range and stability but high handling and reload speed. If you haven't already got a decent arc hand cannon, then you could push out the range a bit, even at the cost of a little Handling, and add a little Stability. Any of the combat effect rounds in the mag perk slot (Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber or Ricochet Rounds) will add a tiny bit more range and utility in a firefight. Rapid Hit is the best support perk choice in the first column traits, although Perpetual Motion isn't bad either. Dragonfly in the second trait column as the signature perk is great for thinning out add crowds when you're hitting crits. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. // Vouchsafe (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Steady Rounds, Appeneded Mag), Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec) with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly with a void subclass. The reprised Vouchsafe has returned with a plethora of PvE possibilities. You get the +20 Mobility from the Lightweight Frame, which is always great but on the downside you also have low Stability and Handling (not such a problem with the origin trait) and abysmal Recoil Direction. You can handle the wonky recoil with a combination of recoil and/or stability perks in the barrel and mag slots. You don't need a void subclass to make use of the trait combination of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds - they'll work perfectly well without - but you can improve the effect with void fragments. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Vouchsafe (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Smallbore, Polygonal Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Steady Rounds, Appeneded Mag), Rapid Hit, (Explosive Payload, Dragonfly, Collective Action)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec) with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in general content, particularly with a void subclass. The reprised Vouchsafe has returned with a plethora of PvE possibilities. You get the +20 Mobility from the Lightweight Frame, which is always great but on the downside you also have low Stability and Handling (not such a problem with the origin trait) and abysmal Recoil Direction. You can handle the wonky recoil with a combination of recoil and/or stability perks in the barrel and mag slots. Slot in Rapid Hit for the first trait column's support perk and then in the second you can improve on the curated roll's Explosive Payload, add a little crowd clearance with Dragonfly, or use elemental pickups to proc Collective Action (although you might need to travel a fair way to collect them if you're engaging at typical scout rifle distances). The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=355922321&perks=106909392,247725512,3038247973,839105230
dimwishlist:item=355922321&perks=247725512,3038247973,3177308360,839105230
dimwishlist:item=355922321&perks=247725512,3038247973,3177308360,3661387068

// Retold Tale (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Barrel Shroud, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Assault Mag, Tactical Mag, Light Mag, Appended Mag), Repulsor Brace, Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec) with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly with a void subclass. Retold Tale has okay stats compared to other precision frame shotguns and the trait pool is weighted towards PvP, but there's still some nice combinations here. First, for the barrel perk, Barrel Shroud, Smallbore or Corkscrew Rifling all add useful stats and for the mag slot while Assault Mag or Tactical Mag are the top two choices, Light Mag or Appended Mag aren't bad alternatives. For your trait combination, this is the first pellet shotgun that offers the the trait combination of Repulsor Brace and Destabilizing Rounds for aggressive CQC add clearing. You don't need a void subclass to make use of them - they'll work perfectly well without - but you can improve the effect with void fragments. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling (or +20 charge rate with swords), for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Retold Tale (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Full Choke, Barrel Shroud, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Tactical Mag, Assault Mag, Light Mag, Appended Mag), (Lead from Gold, Slideshot), One-Two Punch
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec) with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage to Major Spec enemies in end-game content, particularly for melee builds. Retold Tale has okay stats compared to other precision frame shotguns and the trait pool is weighted towards PvP, but there's still some nice combinations here. First, for the barrel perk, Full Choke keeps the pellet spread tighter, or Barrel Shroud, Smallbore or Corkscrew Rifling all add useful stats and for the mag slot while Tactical Mag or Assault Mag are the top two choices, Light Mag or Appended Mag aren't bad alternatives. If you don't already have a One-Two Punch Shotgun, then this can work - Lead From Gold to keep your ammo topped off, or Slideshot for instant slide reloads in the first trait column to support One-Two Punch in the second to pair with an aggressive melee-focussed build for burst damage against Majors, including stunned Champions. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage boosting (Major or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Twilight Oath (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Chambered Compensator, Arrowhead Brake), (Tactical Mag, Appended Mag, Extended Mag), Envious Assassin, (Precision Instrument, Vorpal Weapon)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec) with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage to Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. Twilight Oath starts in last place for stats amongst its peers, but it has one trick up its sleeve to make it useful for boss damage, if you don't already have a well-rolled special weapon for when you run out of heavy ammo. You'll need to start out by taming the wonky recoil with a Recoil Direction or Stability barrel perk. Tactical Mag, Appended Mag and Extended Mag all get you to the maximum of 7 shots - Tactical Mag adds some useful additional Stability too. You can use this with the trait combination of Envious Assassin, which can get 18 shots after 14 primary/heavy kills (and up to 21 if you reproc), together with Precision Instrument, which provides a scaling damage bonus of up to +25% damage on the sixth and every subsequent crit hit. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +30 Handling for additional ready and ADS speed, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting (Boss or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Abide the Return (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Jagged Edge, Honed Edge, Tempered Edge), (Swordmaster's Guard, Balanced Guard), Relentless Strikes, Whirlwind Blade
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec) with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for sustained damage to Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. If you already have a solar boss damage sword, you can pass. If you want to use Abide the Return, then get a blade perk that increases damage and, for a guard perk, Swordmaster's Guard speeds up your heavy attack regeneration or Balanced Guard gives you a little bit of everything to help survive in CQC with a boss. The usual trait combination of Relentless Strikes, returning one ammo for everyth three light hits, and Whirlwind Blade for an escalating +3% bump to damage topping off at +30% for landing light hits makes for a decent, if not top-tier option for boss DPS phases. The Advanced Reflexes origin trait is quite useful in PvE - when activated by an enemy hit, it adds +20 charge rate for faster heavy attacks, together with a handy +20 Mobility, for 7.5s. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage boosting (Boss or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller

// Waking Vigil
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvP / M+KB / Controller): "Let’s talk about power creep. When Waking Vigil released it was a phenomenal arc hand cannon. Outclassed by Nation of Beasts for the best arc hand cannon. With its midlife refresh Waking Vigil was blessed with a reload perk and an AoE perk through Dragonfly. However it was still overshadowed by Nation of Beasts and by then Ancient Gospel. When the hand cannon merger happened, Waking Vigil lost its only claim to fame being a Lightweight hand cannon versus the aforementioned adaptives. // Imperative
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Most of us already have. Workhorse PvE scout. If this is your first season playing destiny either as a new light or a returning player, Imperative has one great redeeming factor; damage. Imperative belongs to the high-impact archetype of scouts giving it the slowest firing rate but the highest damage. Pairing that with more damage through Adrenaline Junkie, some AoE damage through Kinetic Tremors or Explosive Payload. All of these will be happily paired with Rapid Hit for the bonuses to the low stability and reload speed. Subsistence and Keep Away both mitigate the low reload speed by bypassing reload entirely or speeding it up, respectively. I’d still recommend Rapid Hit over both as missing a shot is extremely unforgiving with the slower rate of fire. Precision hits are going to be the goal, why not make follow up shot easier while we’re at it." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Scatter Signal
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Oh hey, a new strand fusion rifle. Will Scatter Signal be better than Pressurized Precision? Well neither are great as Strand fusion rifles. But for a “Kinetic” fusion rifle I think Scatter Signal rivals and possibly beats out Riptide for best in slot fusion. Overflow and Controlled Burst for added damage throughout the magazine. You’ll only need one magazine booster to hit the fusion cap of 8 shots or you can opt for an even faster firing fusion with Accelerated Coils. Overflow will double your magazine capacity giving you 16 shots, 15 of which will have an extra 20% damage increase. If you opt for Extended Battery for the 16 total shots you can slot in Major or Boss spec for an additional 7.77% damage to every shot." Recommended MW: Charge Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Lethophobia
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Lethophobia is defined as an abnormal anxiety of forgetting. Let’s hope you don’t forget the god rolls of this bow then. As with most PvE bows you’re looking for a good combination of draw time and accuracy. Successful Warm-Up gives you a better draw time post-defeat, but has a bit less utility against higher health enemies. Explosive Head can stagger those arrow sponges a bit easier but having Rapid Hit or Archer’s Tempo there would have been preferred. Disruption break will work best in conjunction with a high damage kinetic weapon like this season's Supercluster slug shotgun. Golden Tricorn will feel great on a combination of subclasses this season with Permeability changing this weapons damage type from void to your selected subclass. You can run a full void or full strand or stasis loadout without much thought. Just remember that the damage change goes away when you stow this weapon." Recommended MW: Draw Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=3710082365&perks=2652708987,3365897133,3429800428,852209214

// Scalar Potential
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I hope that Scalar Potential lives up to its name. An arc rapid-fire frame Feels. Very. Familiar. Huh, I can’t place my thumb on it. Well, since we’ve never seen one of these before you’re going to want Overflow to double your magazine capacity, and Golden Tricorn to really pump up that damage. Arrowhead Brake is almost required for the low 53 recoil direction. With our new deterministic recoil you might be able to learn the recoil pattern and not need Arrowhead Brake, but I don’t like to fight with my weapons." // Doomed Petitioner
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "We have ourselves the second craftable non-raid aggressive frame linear fusion rifle. Holy traveler. Say that sentence 5 times fast. I think Doomed Petitioner will be slightly more used over Fire and Forget due to a reload bypassing perk in Reconstruction. Pair that with either Golden Tricorn on void or Precision Instrument to really crank up those stacks within two shots. Envious Assassin works well if you’re slaying enemies before your damage phase while Reconstruction works well passively." Recommended MW: Charge Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Breakneck
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Breakneck returns to us in all its glory. Onslaught paired with Subsistence gives you the best of both worlds. A faster shot and Actium War Rig-lite. Feeding Frenzy is a nice second but you don’t want to stop firing to lose the damage buff. Onslaught itself also gives you a nice bonus to reload on its own. The obvious choice then is to bump up the magazine and recoil direction to make shooting last longer and be a little easier at those maximum stacks." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Parabellum
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / Controller / M+KB): "Parabellum is the Exit Strategy I wish I had. Enlightened Action will buff the weapon feel before Frenzy kicks in or against before targets. Rewind Rounds are fantastic for mowing down wave after wave of enemies. I’d say that Parabellum is a workhorse weapon but it’s just not as strong as the CALUS-Mini Tool for being a solar submachine gun, and the competition for being a submachine gun in PvE gets stronger and stronger each season." // Marcato-45
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / Controller / M+KB): "I’m happy to see more adaptive frame machine guns. None will ever replace our lord and savior Hammerhead. But we can think they’re still strong in our heart of hearts. Onslaught paired with Triple Tap could be really good for about 3 seconds. You will have to ramp up the kills with some smaller enemies, hoping not to waste too much ammo, and then unload into a major or boss with the added damage with the remainder of your magazine. In practice I don’t know how well it will be. Golden Tricorn can activate, reload, and then you can ramp up to the second level with a full magazine." // Belisarius-D
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Belisarius-D is already making waves as one of the strongest pulse rifles with a ton of combinations. It might not be as good as pre-nerf No Time to Explain, but it certainly holds its own in our current Meta. Arrowhead isn’t necessary with our deterministic recoil, but I found the bursts a bit tighter and easier to control. I like that Vorpal Weapon can be paired with Kill Clip for extra damage against majors and champions. // Chivalric Fire
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / Controller / M+KB): "Our full ritual playlist weapon is an interesting one. Caster frame swords have not been strong since their introduction. So Bungie is either testing us to see if they should buff caster frames or trying to get more hands on feedback. I feel like caster frames are a tough one to balance. Give them too much damage and they become an extremely safe pick in everyday play. Lower the ammo requirements and you will inadvertently buff their DPS as you’ll have more opportunities to use the heavy attack. Lower their charge time to counterbalance either of those changes and we’re back to square one. Chivalric Fire is a great neutral sword that works best on Void subclasses, but you can utilize either orb generation or volatility to great success without committing to Void." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,controller,mkb
dimwishlist:item=3438139008&perks=1749209109,2048641572,52780822,938542991
dimwishlist:item=3438139008&perks=2048641572,52780822,776531651,938542991

There are not a lot of compelling reasons to go for this sword unless you have yet to find the Repulsor Brace / Destabilizing Rounds Nasreddin in the wild." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Lethal Abundance
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / Controller / M+KB): "Lethal Abundance has one thing going for it, being a Strand high-impact frame auto rifle. Slice and Hatchling both give this weapon extra Strand utility, but on other subclasses this weapon feels like any generic high-impact auto rifle. Enlightened Action and Keep Away both bump up your reload speed, either organically or passively, respectively. Target Lock works best on beefier targets, but can also help on rank and file enemies. Hatchling works best when paired with Strand. Onslaught might be the best neutral perk, but if you want a faster firing auto rifle, just use any of the other Strand auto." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,controller,mkb

// Undercurrent
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Forbearance, Salvager’s Salvo, or Undercurrent. Which is going to reign supreme? Probably Forbearance. But Undercurrent is a decent attempt. Voltshot isn’t as significant as Chain Reaction and only works on the first hit of subsequent shots. Bait and Switch is interesting for keeping up damage but not having a reliable magazine overflow perk hurts a bit more. Ambitious Assassin is great, but Envious is better. Overall I’d say it’s a neat addition but you wouldn’t be too hurt not having it if you already have Forbearance or Salvo." Recommended MW: Velocity.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Incisor
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Incisor is an exotic trace rifle in legendary form. Envious Assassin or Subsistence to keep the magazine topped up to keep fueling Killing Tally will open up your loadouts for a ton of other weapons. Kill Clip is a bit easier to keep track of, but it isn’t nearly as strong. The only other competition Incisor has is Appetence which even then they aren’t perfectly comparable as one is Strand and the other is Stasis, so you might not even use them for the same purposes or with the same loadouts. Definitely pick this up this season." Recommended MW: Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Vengeful Whisper
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I’m happy for more variants of weapons. Vengeful Whisper being a strand bow opens up some loadout flexibility and covers your strand subclass verbs. It’s less useful without Match Game but it can still be useful for taking out shields faster. Archer’s Tempo is fantastic on bows for lowering successive draw times, and Precision Instrument fits nicely as you’ll want to hit those crits, the draw time allowing you a bit of forgiveness lining up those crit shots. You could even switch it up and go with Explosive Payload and Successful Warm-Up if you’re using this in lower and PvE where you can one shot everything to keep Successful Warm-Up going." Recommended MW: Draw Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Dragoncult Sickle
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Dragoncult Sickle is our last dungeon weapon. Being a strand caster frame might actually benefit the toolkit a bit more. Being able to spread Sever through Slice and Chain Reaction or spawn Threadlings from a distance makes this weapon an incredibly strong addition to an all Strand loadout. It might not be the best for boss damage or the best for add clear, but I think it will find a nice home in some Strand loadouts." Recommended MW: Impact.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Cold Front (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore), (Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag, Steady Rounds), (Perprtual Motion, Unrelenting), Frenzy
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec) with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for add-clear of Minor Spec enemies in end-game content. Like most world-drop weapons, Cold Front has pretty poor stats - including a stability of just 7, although (excluding Immortal, which is a stat monster), they're average for the frame subtype. Use the barrel and mag perks to help out with this. As the first trait column support perk, Perpetual Motion adds further stat bonuses just for moving, or Unrelenting's bonus health is useful in CQC, while in the second column as the signature perk, Frenzy boosts the handling and reload speed up to 100 and adds 15% bonus damage when procced. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants energy 10% to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=3206190066&perks=1392496348,3108830275,3177308360,4104185692

// Glacioclasm (PvE first-choice roll)
(Full Bore, Hammer-Forged Rifling, Full Bore, Smallbore, Corkscrew Rifling), (Ionized Battery, Extended Battery), Controlled Burst
//notes: Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 91 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/50NPk7xF3Tt6X3DVucE9jU?si=44d2b7d44a5a4aec) with @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE pick for burst damage against Major Spec or Boss Spec enemies in end-game content. Grab Glacioclasm while you can - unusually, for a world-drop weapon it has great stats as a High-Impact fusion rifle. Only firing five bolts, it's a bit more controllable than faster-firing subtypes, so spec into range with the barrel perk. In the battery perk slot, you're aiming to get as many shots as possible, with Ionized or Extended Battery. For the first trait perk, there's really only one to consider, and that's Overflow to instantly double your battery size for picking up ammo. Combine that with Controlled Burst in the second trait slot for DPS that'll hold up as a burst damage weapon against Majors or a backup weapon for boss damage phases. The Dawning Surprise origin trait is very useful in PvE - when the behind the scenes counter hits 100, the surprise is spawned on the ground for 10s and grants 10% energy to all abilities, grants 20HP and starts shield/health regeneration. Recommended MW: Shield Diraction, with a damage boosting (Major or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, M+KB, Controller
dimwishlist:item=2728851518&perks=1483536627,2594592626,3250034553,3643424744
