// Briar's Contempt (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator), Enhanced Battery, (Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction), Focused Fury 
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for sustained DPS against bosses in end-game content. The first solar aggressive frame LFR - there's no Veist Stinger origin trait like Fire and Forget has, but Harmonic Resonance can boost damage by 10%, and damage against Tormentors and Lucent Hive by 25%, so it's still going to be decent for damage. You'll want to be able to control the recoil, so look for stability or recoil direction in a barrel, and Enhanced Battery adds a useful extra shot. For boss damage, both Rewind Rounds and Reconstruction, as your first trait column support perk, overfill or refill the magazine to keep get as many shots with Focused Fury's damage boost as possible, as your second trait column signature perk. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Stability - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Briar's Contempt (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling, Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator), Enhanced Battery, (Rewind Rounds, Reconstruction, Demolitionist), Frenzy 
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 57 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3LOWj7jLe0eiacDYwEbK22) with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr. First-choice PvE roll for sustained DPS against bosses in end-game content. The first solar aggressive frame LFR - there's no Veist Stinger origin trait like Fire and Forget has, but Harmonic Resonance can boost damage by up to 10%, and damage against Tormentors and Lucent Hive by 25%, so it's still going to be decent for damage. You'll want to be able to control the recoil, so look for stability or recoil direction in a barrel, and Enhanced Battery adds a useful extra shot. For boss damage, both Rewind Rounds and Reconstruction, as your first trait column support perk, overfill or refill the magazine, or alternatively Demolitionist provides an instant reload to keep damage uptime for Frenzy's 15% damage boost as your second trait column signature perk. The additional 50 Reload Speed from Frenzy is handy, once you do need to reload, too. The Harmonic Resonance origin trait can boost damage still further by a stacking 3.33% with one other RoN Raid weapon or 10% with two. Recommended MW: Stability - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Battle Scar (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Tactical Mag, Accurized Rounds), Shoot to Loot, Kinetic Tremors
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for Minor add-clear in end-game content. Not a lot of current competition for lightweight pulse rifles (as at v7.0.0.7, anyway) but they add a very useful +20 mobility (useful when buildcrafting) and +6.25% movement speed. Unfortunately, the stats on the reprised Battle Scar are low across the board - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers (five stacks would take 1001 hits to achieve!). You'd really be looking for Arrowhead Brake in the barrel ideally, to help clean up the low recoil direction and, if you prefer stability and reload speed go for Tactical Mag, or for range go for Accurized Rounds. Battle Scar is one of the first kinetic weapons that can roll with Kinetic Tremors as your signature perk in the second trait column - for end-game activities this pairs nicely with Shoot to Loot as, as well as the passive damage boost just for repeated hits you will also pick up ammo from anywhere in the shockwave area and reload all of your guns too. Recommended MW: TBH anything will work - just go with your preference, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Taken Spec) mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=2099894368&perks=106909392,3700496672,3891536761,839105230

// Harsh Language (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), High-Velocity Rounds, Envious Assassin, (Destabilizing Rounds, Repulsor Brace)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for void synergy and Minor add clear in end-game content. The reprised Harsh Language is only the second void wave-frame grenade launcher. Lower stats that Deafening Whisper (although the range of stats is pretty compressed) - the New Devrim Kay VIII Foundry Field Tested origin perk should help, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers. You start out with 100 blast radius - not that it makes any difference as it's the dump stat for wave frame GLs - so you can use the barrel and mag perks for velocity and handling. Quick Launch is ideal, and Smart Drift Control works as a good alternate, and out of the two choices, High-Velocity Rounds is the mag perk to choose. the standout support perk in the first trait column is Envious Assassin - you can get up to three shots in the barrel for killing adds with your primary or power weapon. You have a choice of two signature perks in the second trait column to help with add clear - Destabilising Rounds is the more offensive option for add clear or Repulsor Brace for tanking damage in a crowd. Recommended MW: Handling or Velocity, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=1606497639&perks=2048641572,2822142346,3525010810,968510818
dimwishlist:item=1606497639&perks=2048641572,2822142346,3798852852,968510818
dimwishlist:item=1606497639&perks=2822142346,3525010810,776531651,968510818
dimwishlist:item=1606497639&perks=2822142346,3798852852,776531651,968510818

// Nasreddin (PvE first-choice roll)
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, Relentless Strikes, 
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for damage to Bosses in end-game content. First thing to say about the reprised Nasreddin (named for a legendary trickster figure in Muslin folklore) is that if you already have a decent arc sword, you can give this a miss, as there's nothing that really makes it stand out except, maybe, for a slightly higher base Impact stat, and the new Devrim Kay VIII Foundry origin trait which should make the heavy attack rechage rate a little faster, but it takes a long time to proc the higher tiers. For newer Guardians, the usual recommendations of Jagged Edge as the blade perk for additinal damage, Swordmaster's Guard for the guard perk to get the heavy attack up as fast as possible. Then Relentless Strikes as your support perk in the first trait column, which works well to return ammo against all enemies, and either Whirlwind Blade or Surrounded, to boost damage, for your signature perk in the second. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) mod|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=1456017061&perks=1749209109,269888150,3666208348,3913600130
dimwishlist:item=1456017061&perks=1749209109,269888150,3666208348,3708227201

// Irukandji (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Polygonal Rifling), (Steady Rounds, Tactical Mag, Flared Magwell), (Envious Assassing, Fourth Time's The Charm, Rapid Hit), (Firing Line, Focused Fury)
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for Major and Boss damage in a fireteam in end-game content. The Season 20 Veist weapon is a rapid-fire sniper rifle with as-expected lowish stats, as a World drop weapon. Irukandji (a small, rare, highly venomous jellyfish from Australia, because of course it would be) does benefit from the Veist Stinger origin trait which is occasionally useful even in its nerfed state. Remember that as at Season 20, this will do less base damage than an equivalent kinetic weapon so, to be competitive, you'll need the parks to fall your way. The main issue you'll find is with keeping the reticule on a boss's crit spot - you'll need to boost Recoil Direction and Stability to make this easier, so Arrowhead Brake or Polygonal Rifling are your barrel perk choices, and Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag or even Steady Rounds (you're not likely to be outside of the damage falloff distance, even with the range penalty) should be your mag perk options. As your first trait column support perk, Envious Assassin overflows your magazine passively with primary and power weapon kills, Fourth Time's The Charm works extends the magazine if you hit crits consistently, or Rapid Hit improves stability (and reload speed) as you fire to keep your reticule steadier. In the signature perk, second column trait, Firing Line is more forgiving of an occasional missed shot when you're in a fireteam but, if you're flying solo, Focused Fury will boost damage in the bottom half of your magazine if you can hit your crits consistently. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-PvE-MajorSpec, BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=2673925403&perks=106909392,1354429876,1771339417,839105230
dimwishlist:item=2673925403&perks=1354429876,1771339417,3230963543,839105230
dimwishlist:item=2673925403&perks=106909392,1354429876,2896038713,839105230
dimwishlist:item=2673925403&perks=1354429876,2896038713,3230963543,839105230

// Marsilion-C (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), Augmented Drum, Field Prep, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. First-choice PvE roll for Major and Boss damage in end-game content. Shapeable. The Hakke foundry for Season 20 is Marsilion-C (named after the King of Muslim Spain in the late 700s CE, if you're asking), a rapid-fire, solar power grenade launcher with decent stats and which is very usable if you don't already have existing options. For major or boss damage, if you look build into Explosive Light as your signature perk in the second trait column then, as your blast radius is already set to 100, you can concentrate on Velocity in your Barrel - Quick Launch or Smart Drift Control. With 100 Blast Radius, Spike Grenades will be much less effective, so Augmented Drum is the better mag perk, as this synergises with Field Prep as your support perk in the first trait column, for more ammo reserves and faster reloads. The Enhanced Explosive Light perk grants an extra stack of damage over the standard version, so you'll have a magazine capable of using all seven stacks before reloading! Recommended MW: Velocity, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-PvE-MajorSpec, BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

First-choice PvE roll for Major and Boss damage in end-game content. Shapeable. The Hakke foundry for Season 20 is Marsilion-C (named after the King of Muslim Spain in the late 700s CE, if you're asking), a rapid-fire, solar power grenade launcher with decent stats and which is very usable if you don't already have existing options. For major or boss damage, if you look build into Explosive Light as your signature perk in the second trait column then, as your blast radius is already set to 100, you can concentrate on Velocity in your Barrel - Quick Launch or Smart Drift Control and, even with 100 Blast Radius, Spike Grenades will still provide some extra impact damage as your mag perk. // Coronach-22 (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (Flared Magwell, Light Mag), Feeding Frenzy, Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 56 (https://open.spotify.com/episode/6hjWp0NaachsNymnN22FDL) with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects. (??? ???): First-choice PvE roll for solar synergy and Minor add-clear in general content. The Suros weapon for season 20 is the Coronach (named after a funeral dirge sung, or played on the bagpipes, in Scotland and Ireland), a solar Adaptive auto rifle with the lowish stats you'd expect from a World drop. The Suros origin trait can help fill in a little Handling and flinch resistance after a reload although it's more commonly thought of as being more PvP-focussed. If you didn't pick up an Ammit with Incandescent from Witch Queen, this gives you access to a similar (if unenhanced) set of perks. Arrowhead Brake as your barrel perk takes Recoil Direction to 100 and adds Handling for snappiness. To fill in the other gunfeel stats, Flared Magwell boosts Stability and Reload Speed, or Light Mag boosts Range and Reload Speed in the mag. As the support perk, in the first trait column, Feeding Frenzy boosts reload speed further after kills - your solar ignition kills from Incandescent will add to the stacks, particularly when paired with Ember of Ashes. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Perpetualis (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Extended Barrel, Smallbore), Tactical Mag, (Keep Away, Zen Moment), Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for add clear in end-game activities. Shapeable. This is the easier to get Strand adaptive auto-rifle for Season of Defiance, if you're unable to get into the Root of Nightmares Raid. The stats are decent, although both stability and handling are a little below par, and the recoil direction could maybe do with a little help, although the Noble Deeds origin perk can help out with the handling (and boost reload speed too). Extended Barrel or Smallbore are your best barrel choices, and Tactical Mag is the best of the mag perks. In the first trait column, there aren't many support perks that help in PvE - Keep Away is the pick of a limited budget, or possibly the reworked Zen Moment. For your second trait column signature perk, Golden Tricorn is unique (as at v7.0.0.6, anyway) on a Strand auto rifle and the second stack isn't too difficult to proc by either using a grapple melee or shooting a Tangle, for a massive 50% damage boost for 10s. Recommended MW: Range or Stability, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Royal Executioner (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Accelerated Coils, Envious Assassin, Reservoir Burst
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for burst damage in end-game activities. Shapeable. Season 20's solar adaptive fusion rifle has okayish stats, with the Noble Deeds origin perk helping with a boost to handling and reload speed when procced. Arrowhead Brake as the barrel perk makes the recoil much easier to control, taking the Recoil Direction from 58 to 88. Particle Repeater is an option to control the bolts, but Accelerated Coils is the better play - you'll be killing red bars even with the slight reduction in damage and you'll appreciate the faster charge time. The Noble Deeds origin trait helps with Handling, for more snappiness (and Reload Speed), so fits in really well. Envious Assassin is the stand out support perk in the first trait column - overflow the magazine with primary and power weapon kills, and this is the only non-Raid fusion rifle that you can do that with. Every overflowed shot will then do 25% bonus damage with Reservoir Burst as your second trait column, signature perk, as well as making enemies explode, making this great for both add-clearing groups of minors and burst damage against majors. Recommended MW: Charge Time, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

Particle Repeater is an option, but Accelerated Coils is the better play - you'll be killing red bars even with the slight reduction in damage and you'll appreciate the faster charge time. The Noble Deeds origin trait helps with Handling, for more snappiness (and Reload Speed), so fits in really well. Envious Assassin is a stand out support perk in the first trait column, overflowing the magazine as you get primary and power weapon kills, but Threat Detector and Lead From Gold are right up there too. // Prodigal Return (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), Disorienting Grenades, Envious Assassin, Disruption Break
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for add suppression in end-game activities. Shapeable. This drops into a very competitive field of arc lightweight grenade launchers, although it does have decent stats except for handling. The usual play is to look for velocity, to get the grenade to its target as fast as possible, and handling, for speedy swaps, and it'll be no different this time. Fortunately, the Noble Deeds origin trait helps with Handling (and Reload Speed), so fits in really well. Quick Launch is the best barrel, but Smart Drift Control isn't far behind. For add control, Disorienting Grenades give you breathing space in a firefight. Pair that with Envious Assassin, which can give you up to three in the barrel(!) as your support perk in the first trait column, and Disruption Break, for 50% bonus kinetic damage to burst down chunkier red bar Minors and the occasional Major while they stumble around as the signature perk, and you probably have the perfect add control breach-loading GL. Recommended MW: Velocity, with a Quick Access Sling (for faster swaps) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Regnant (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Quick Launch, Smart Drift Control), Spike Grenades, Auto-Loading Holster, Explosive Light
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for sustained boss DPS in end-game activities. Shapeable. Essentially a void Wendigo with poorer stats, but with access to enhanced traits. As is usual for grenade launchers, look to increase velocity to get the grenade on target as fast as possible, and handling, for general snappiness. Quick Launch is the best barrel, but Smart Drift Control isn't far behind. The Noble Deeds origin trait helps with handling, and reload speed too, so works well. In the magazine, Spike Grenade adds direct impact damage to a target. In the first trait column as your pick of the support perks, Auto-Loading Holster lets you empty the magazine and reload while you're swapped to your DPS special weapon to rinse and repeat, while Explosive Light is by far the best damage boost for your signature perk in the second - and the enhanced version adds an extra stack on top. Recommended MW: Handling, with a damage-boosting (Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Caretaker (PvE first-choice roll)
// Jagged Edge, Swordmaster's Guard, (Tireless Blade, Relentless Strikes), Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast vs Enemies episode 55 (https://open.spotify.com/show/36OTFinErCUBrCzu6BaYbo) with @Saint_Kabr, @CourtProjects and @ImpetusAlways. First-choice PvE roll for solar synergy and minor add clearing in end-game content. Shapeable. This is maybe our first non-Raid sword with significantly different stats - the Charge Rate is 60, by comparison with every other adaptive sword's 20 (except DSC's Bequest), and the Noble Deeds origin perk boosts the charge rate further for buffing Guardians around you. As with most swords, go for as much impact damage as possible, so Jagged Edge as your blade plus the inevitable Impact Masterwork. Swordmaster's Guard is a reliable guard perk to have your heavy attack available quickly. For your support perk in the first trait column, both Tireless Blade and Relentless Strikes work but, once you get Incandescent working (and Ember of Ashes helps) as your signature perk in the second trait column, the ignite kills among adds count towards Tireless Blade kills, so that will be the more efficient way to regain ammo. Recommended MW: Impact, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

First-choice PvE roll for Majors and Bosses in end-game content. Shapeable. This is maybe our first non-Raid sword with significantly different stats - the Charge Rate is 60, by comparison with every other adaptive sword's 20 (except DSC's Bequest), and the Noble Deeds origin perk boosts the charge rate further for buffing Guardians around you. As with most swords, go for as much impact damage as possible, so Jagged Edge as your blade plus the inevitable Impact Masterwork. Swordmaster's Guard is a reliable guard perk to have your heavy attack available quickly. For your support park in the first trait column, Relentless Strikes don't require a kill to return ammo, so is best for chunkier adds and Majors, although Flash Counter's weaken effect is also worth considering. Majors are usually accompanied by minors, so Surrounded (especially when enhanced) or One for All as signature perks in the second trait column can both work well when you need to do damage up close. // Phyllotactic Spiral (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore), (Flared Magwell, Light Mag), Compulsive Reloader, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3). First-choice PvE roll for general content. Shapeable. In-band stats for a high-impact pulse rifle - there's already plenty of range so use your barrel to fill out your preferred gunfeel stats (you can never go wrong with additional handling and stability). With one eye to Voltshot in the final column, you want reload speed as high as possible so Flared Magwell or Light Mag, and Compulsive Reloader or Keep Away with a Reload Speed Masterwork should get Voltshot procced and ready to use as quickly as possible after a kill. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE. // Basso Ostinato (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Barrel Shround, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore), Tactical Mag, (Envious Assassin, Lead from Gold, Perpetual Motion), Destabilizing Rounds
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3). First-choice PvE roll for void synergy. We've seen rapid-fire shotguns a lot - maybe not the play for end-game activities where you're probably in trouble if you're close enough to use it, but useful for bursting down a major or champion once stunned. The ranges on shotguns are compressed, to look for a handling or stability barrel, and Tactical Mag is easily the best of the mag perks. Envious Assassin should provide an easy route to an overfilled magazine but as alternatives, Lead from Gold and Perpetual Motion are decent too. In the last column, Destabilizing Rounds spreads volatility to surrounding adds on a kill to synergise with Void subclass verbs. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Basso Ostinato (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Barrel Shround, Corkscrew Rifling, Smallbore), Tactical Mag, (Envious Assassin, Lead from Gold, Perpetual Motion), Trench Barrel
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3). First-choice PvE roll for burst damage. We've seen rapid-fire shotguns a lot - you'll need to be careful to to be in a vulnerable position when using one, but they're useful for bursting down a major or champion once stunned. The ranges on shotguns are compressed, to look for a handling or stability barrel, and Tactical Mag is easily the best of the mag perks. Envious Assassin should provide an easy route to an overfilled magazine but as alternatives, Lead from Gold and Perpetual Motion are decent too. In the last column, Trench Barrel is reliable for fast burst damage in CQC and works well on a rapid-fire frame. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them - really fun for PvE although you'll probably not be seeing them often on a Boss-damaging weapon. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=2573900604&perks=106909392,2360754333,4090651448,968510818
dimwishlist:item=2573900604&perks=106909392,1300023272,2360754333,968510818
dimwishlist:item=2573900604&perks=106909392,1482024992,2360754333,968510818

// Iterative Loop (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Fluted Barrel, Polygonal Rifling), (Particle Repeater, Accelerated Coils), Compulsive Reloader, Voltshot
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3). First-choice PvE roll for Arc synergy and burst damage. Seeing as fusion rifles apply the highest Jolt tick damage of any special weapon, it would be rude not to pick or shape a roll. Rapid fire fusions need a fair bit of control with nine bolts being fired, so Arrowhead Break takes the recoil direction to 77, or up the stability through Fluted Barrel or Polygonal Rifling. In the battery, there's nothing to help speed up reloading, so Particle Repeater adds more stability, or Accelerated Coils speeds up charge time. Compulsive Reloader and a Reload Speed Masterwork boosts reload to 100 at the top half of the mag, so your reloads after a kill to proc Voltshot should be as snappy as it's possible to get. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them with rapid kills - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Reload Speed or Stability, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-BossSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=1289796511&perks=2173046394,671806388,689005463,839105230

// Dimensional Hypotrochoid (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Hard Launch, Quick Launch, Linear Compensator, Smart Drift Control), High-Velocity Rounds, Envious Assassin, Chain Reaction
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 54 with @CourtProjects, @ImpetusAlways and @Saint_Kabr (https://open.spotify.com/episode/3obSAgsEW0RBeSjYXOVcgN?si=95ac723a75f749c3). First-choice PvE roll for add clear in end-game activities. Shapeable. The first Compressed Wave Frame power-slot grenade launcher, so there's not really anything to compare against for the stats (so we can say with absolute certainty that the stats are best in class, average and worst in class all at the same time). Blast Radius only affects the initial impact, not the width of the wave so use the barrel to boost velocity and handling. Out of the two options for the mag, High Velocity Rounds is always the better one, improving Reload Speed too. There's an abundance of options for PvE in the first trait column, but the best option is Envious Assassin, passively overflowing the magazine as you get primary and special weapon kills, and then in the second, as this is primarily for add clear, Chain Reaction turns every kill into a stasis explosion, extending the damage radius and adding chunk damage against beefier enemies nearby. On top, the Nanotech Tracer Rockets add both damage and flinch when you proc them with multiple hits - really fun for PvE. Recommended MW: Handling or Velocity, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=1311684613&perks=2396489472,2822142346,3525010810,968510818
dimwishlist:item=1311684613&perks=2396489472,2822142346,3798852852,968510818
dimwishlist:item=1311684613&perks=1441682018,2396489472,2822142346,968510818

// Fioritura-59 (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Pugilist, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2). First-choice PvE roll for void subclasses in endgame content. Decent stats by comparison with its peers but, at the end of the day, this is still a sidearm looking for an in-game role. Spec into stability with your barrel, and High-Cal Rounds for extra flinch, or Armor-Piercing Rounds (you're likely to be in a crowd in CQC, so APR can be useful to damage more than one enemy at a time), or Ricochet Rounds or Flared Magwell will add additional stability to help control the recoil. Pugilist can help recharge your melee for Golden Tricorn - you get a solid 15% extra damage for one stack after a kill or a hefty 50% bonus with an ability kill while the first stack is procced. Recommended MW: Stability or Handling, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Fioritura-59 (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Pugilist, Swashbuckler

First-choice PvE roll for void subclasses in general content. Decent stats by comparison with its peers but, at the end of the day, this is still a sidearm looking for an in-game role. Spec into stability with your barrel, and High-Cal Rounds for extra flinch, or Armor-Piercing Rounds (you're likely to be in a crowd in CQC, so APR can be useful to damage more than one enemy at a time), or Ricochet Rounds or Flared Magwell will add additional stability to help control the recoil. Pugilist and Swashbuckler form a natural pairing - get your melee kill to proc 33% bonus damage, and then recover your melee energy with the easy kills that result. // Fioritura-59 (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel, Corkscrew Rifling), (Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Flared Magwell), Threat Detector, Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2). First-choice PvE roll for Void subclasses and end-game content. Decent stats by comparison with its peers but, at the end of the day, this is still a sidearm looking for an in-game role. Spec into stability with your barrel, and High-Cal Rounds for extra flinch, or Armor-Piercing Rounds (you're likely to be in a crowd in CQC, so APR can be useful to damage more than one enemy at a time), or Ricochet Rounds or Flared Magwell will add additional stability to help control the recoil. As you're likely to be in CQC, Threat Detector should be proccing to provide extra gunfeel stats. // Jararaca-3sr (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, (High-Caliber Rounds, Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds), (Rapid Hit, Perpetual Motion), Headstone
//notes:Inspired by @PodvsEnemies Podcast Versus Enemies episode 51 with @ImpetusAlways, @Saint_Kabr and @CourtProjects (https://open.spotify.com/episode/5BpRdHN5pWyyKNLGsLB1Qh?si=4b9f4a74bf194ff2). First-choice PvE roll for stasis subclasses in end-game content. Even nerfed, the Veist Stinger origin trait will still be useful occasionally. Jararaca has poor stats, unfortunately, by comparison with other rapid-fire and Veist rapid-fire scout rifles, but it does offer Stasis synergy. First, ou'll need Arrowhead Brake to sort out the recoil direction. Any of the combat effect rounds will help - if you keep firing until the end of the magazine, the frame perk will help reloads, so you can live without a reload speed-boosting magazine perk, especially with Rapid Hit or Perpetual Motion in the first trait column. Finally, for Stasis synergy, in the second trait column Headstone's crystals work with your aspects and fragments. Recommended MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Lodbrok-C
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "High-impact frame autos feel weird. They shoot too slow for my liking but their damage is incredible. They can chew through rank-and-file enemies with ease, but their low magazine size handicaps them. The best thing to do is try and work around the low magazine by bumping it up or bypassing it entirely. Doing both with appended mag and demolitionist might give you the best bang for your buck. Add on adrenaline junkie for the damage boost and you have a pretty solid weapon. Osmosis will help with elemental wells and general subclass synergy. Cascade point and target lock are interesting. I think on a high-damage primary like Lodbrok-C either could work really well. Cascade point will increase your RPM and target lock will increase your damage. Either way you’re doing more damage to majors and chunky enemies." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Lodbrok-C
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "High-impact frame autos feel weird. They shoot too slow for my liking but their damage is incredible. They can chew through rank-and-file enemies with ease, but their low magazine size handicaps them. The best thing to do is try and work around the low magazine by bumping it up or bypassing it entirely. Doing both with appended mag and demolitionist might give you the best bang for your buck. Add on adrenaline junkie for the damage boost and you have a pretty solid weapon. Osmosis will help with elemental wells and general subclass synergy. Cascade point and target lock are interesting. I think on a high-damage primary like Lodbrok-C either could work really well. Cascade point will increase your RPM and target lock will increase your damage. Either way you’re doing more damage to majors and chunky enemies." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Wilderflight
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Wilderflight is an incredibly unique weapon. Similar to Warden’s Law it fires two grenades at once. This does mean that the grenades can split off and you’d only be doing half damage. The double grenades do have two impact damages which does put them ahead of regular grenade launchers. Auto-loading holster is still the best for fire-and-forget. Disruption break is always going to be a strong pick, especially on impacts for demolishing shields. Frenzy and vorpal can work if you’re primarily going to be using Wilderflight as your main source of damage instead of setting up yourself or your team for kinetic damage." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Wilderflight
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Wilderflight is an incredibly unique weapon. Similar to Warden’s Law it fires two grenades at once. This does mean that the grenades can split off and you’d only be doing half damage. The double grenades do have two impact damages which does put them ahead of regular grenade launchers. Auto-loading holster is still the best for fire-and-forget. Disruption break is always going to be a strong pick, especially on impacts for demolishing shields. Frenzy and vorpal can work if you’re primarily going to be using Wilderflight as your main source of damage instead of setting up yourself or your team for kinetic damage." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Terminus Horizon
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Terminus Horizon will be an interesting weapon to use. Being a slow firing weapon it can probably take advantage of target lock better than the other archetypes purely because the weapon takes longer to empty its magazine comparatively. Having 73 bullets at maximum capacity and laying into a boss with triple tap, demolitionist for instant reloads or rapid hit for the bonuses to stability and reload. There are few times I will fully recommend a high-impact machine gun, but Terminus Horizon is definitely one of them.." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Disparity
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Disparity is probably the best weapon to come out of the season. A craftable aggressive burst pulse rifle that looks good, feels good, has a fantastic sight [...]. There are so many great perks to go for but the base will all be the same. Arrowhead to have near-perfect recoil direction. Flared magwell or tactical mag for a bump in reload / stability with the latter having a slight bump in magazine. Rapid hit is my preferred third column option but outlaw is easier and immediate. No need to build up stacks, just headshot and done. Frenzy is the immediate choice for a “no thoughts, head empty” workhorse weapon. Headstone and desperado are both fantastic for their respective builds. The former gives you slow, cover, and stasis synergy, while the latter gives you that Rambo effect turning your pulse into a mini machine gun." Recommended MW - Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Fire and Forget
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Other than Disparity, this is probably the best weapon to grind for this season. [...] Fire and Forget also being stasis allows you to go big damage with Silence and Squall and font of might. The aggressive burst linear fusions are definitely best in slot. Fire and Forget is an incredible gift from the Bungie gods. I would highly recommend bringing the recoil direction up to 100 with arrowhead brake. That way you can solely focus on fighting flinch. You can go a couple different routes with magazine and masterwork, but I prefer mag dumping and better burst dps with accelerated coils and charge time MW. Field prep is best for pure damage, but headstone and vorpal are probably what I will be going for. That way I can have some decent damage and crowd control. Chill clip is interesting and certainly viable, but I don’t know how useful it will really be in practice." Recommended MW - Charge Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Retrofit Escapade
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I dislike 900 rpm machine guns. They don’t feel very strong for how fast they fire. If I had some good Rambo moments where I could shred hordes of low-tier adds without having to recoil control that much I would love it. But having the lowest base stats across the machine gun archetypes and the fastest rpm makes them unwieldy. Arrowhead brake will bring up the terribly low recoil direction and having more in the magazine means you can be off target for 0.001s and not waste half your ammo. Feeding frenzy and field prep are both ways to bump up the decent reload speed. Golden tricorn will get you the best bang for your glimmer when paired with a void subclass. All void subclasses are viable in end game content so that’s not an issue. Frenzy is best when not on a void subclass and vorpal will allow you to do increased but not substantial damage in and out of combat." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// IKELOS_HC_v1.0.3
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "This is probably the best timeline the Ikelos hand cannon has seen but it is still underwhelming. Precision frame hand cannons do not do enough damage in PvE to warrant use outside out bounties or low-level PvE. They just simply don’t scale well enough for my tastes. Frenzy and subsistence will help a ton but even with all the benefits they still underperform. Golden tricorn will give you the maximum benefits with a void subclass. Good luck with this gun." //notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "[...] it still probably won’t make much of a splash this season either. In PvE the best shotguns are pin-point frames for damage, and dealer’s choice for general use. I do like rapid-fire frames with one-two punch builds as you don’t need a lot to hit max magazine and grave robber for “free” reloads. The synergy is there and it makes for a really fun game play cycle. Subsistence and trench barrel are good options together, as are pugilist and swashbuckler. I just don’t think with all the rapid-fire frame shotguns and PvE centered shotguns the Ikelos will really shine." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Disparity
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Disparity is probably the best weapon to come out of the season. A craftable aggressive burst pulse rifle that looks good, feels good, has a fantastic sight [...]. There are so many great perks to go for but the base will all be the same. Arrowhead to have near-perfect recoil direction. Flared magwell or tactical mag for a bump in reload / stability with the latter having a slight bump in magazine. Rapid hit is my preferred third column option but outlaw is easier and immediate. No need to build up stacks, just headshot and done. Frenzy is the immediate choice for a “no thoughts, head empty” workhorse weapon. Headstone and desperado are both fantastic for their respective builds. The former gives you slow, cover, and stasis synergy, while the latter gives you that Rambo effect turning your pulse into a mini machine gun." Recommended MW - Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Fire and Forget
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Other than Disparity, this is probably the best weapon to grind for this season. [...] Fire and Forget also being stasis allows you to go big damage with Silence and Squall and font of might. The aggressive burst linear fusions are definitely best in slot. Fire and Forget is an incredible gift from the Bungie gods. I would highly recommend bringing the recoil direction up to 100 with arrowhead brake. That way you can solely focus on fighting flinch. You can go a couple different routes with magazine and masterwork, but I prefer mag dumping and better burst dps with accelerated coils and charge time MW. Field prep is best for pure damage, but headstone and vorpal are probably what I will be going for. That way I can have some decent damage and crowd control. Chill clip is interesting and certainly viable, but I don’t know how useful it will really be in practice." Recommended MW - Charge Time.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Retrofit Escapade
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I dislike 900 rpm machine guns. They don’t feel very strong for how fast they fire. If I had some good Rambo moments where I could shred hordes of low-tier adds without having to recoil control that much I would love it. But having the lowest base stats across the machine gun archetypes and the fastest rpm makes them unwieldy. Arrowhead brake will bring up the terribly low recoil direction and having more in the magazine means you can be off target for 0.001s and not waste half your ammo. Feeding frenzy and field prep are both ways to bump up the decent reload speed. Golden tricorn will get you the best bang for your glimmer when paired with a void subclass. All void subclasses are viable in end game content so that’s not an issue. Frenzy is best when not on a void subclass and vorpal will allow you to do increased but not substantial damage in and out of combat." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// IKELOS_SG_v1.0.3
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "[...] it still probably won’t make much of a splash this season either. In PvE the best shotguns are pin-point frames for damage, and dealer’s choice for general use. I do like rapid-fire frames with one-two punch builds as you don’t need a lot to hit max magazine and grave robber for “free” reloads. The synergy is there and it makes for a really fun game play cycle. Subsistence and trench barrel are good options together, as are pugilist and swashbuckler. I just don’t think with all the rapid-fire frame shotguns and PvE centered shotguns the Ikelos will really shine." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Veles-X
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Veles-X is an aggressive burst pulse rifle that doesn’t need a raid to acquire. [...] If you happen to use void, however, getting golden tricorn 2x should be a cakewalk. The synergy is there to take this gun with echo of instability. Get a kill with Veles-X first, throw a grenade and get volatile rounds. You have golden tricorn 2x, this can stack with font of might for insane damage output. You have volatile rounds for add clear and if you get the kill you’ll have a small overshield to use. This is incredible for almost all activities. Unless you can’t get the grenade kill easily I would keep this in your inventory." Recommended MW - Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Albruna-D
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "For any PvE activity I will always try and prioritize recoil direction. Especially on special weapons or your main DPS weapon to make follow up shots easier. Any mag boosting perk will make the overall roll better. The usual suspects of triple tap, clown cartridge and field prep all make their appearance. Alongside our usual damage perks; firing line, frenzy and vorpal weapon. All of these damage perks are phenomenal, but use case specific. Firing line only works when in a full fireteam or raid, and you’d have to be within range for it to work. Frenzy only really works as long as you’re continuously taking damage or dealing it. Vorpal is the easiest to work with but also has the lowest damage output of all three." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Prolonged Engagement
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "This submachine gun is incredible. Decent base stats, good base recoil direction, a million and a half perks. What could be better? Despite not having perfect recoil I would still try and hit 100 with arrowhead brake. Flared magwell or appended is dealer’s choice. I find with reload gauntlets or the plethora of ways to bypass reload are more than enough for me. Subsistence is one such way. Being able to ignore a whole stat on your weapon means you can invest those stat points into any other stat. You will still need to reload eventually and having a good reload stat will make that feel less like a slow molasses river. Finally there’s your damage perks. Frenzy is tried and true, and headstone is just a wonderful add clear perk. Multikill clip is best used with a dedicated reload perk like feeding frenzy or outlaw." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Wendigo GL3
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Is the current meta open enough to allow Wendigo to flex its tired muscles? I think so. GLs aren’t oppressive in PvP but they offer better in between than a rocket or a machine gun. It can clear rooms quickly and do decent single target damage. With a linear fusion rifle nerf incoming we might see a rise in grenade launcher usage. With Wendigo being at the top of the list. Spike will give you damage, but better utility might be blinding. If you want to go all into damage, spike grenades, golden tricorn, adept big ones, and font of might will give you some incredible damage output. It’s a lot harder to upkeep on a grenade launcher, and especially when you’re dealing with a boss with limited fodder you might not be able to sustain golden tricorn 2x. Even with that set up you will have some great burst damage." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Wendigo GL3 (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Is the current meta open enough to allow Wendigo to flex its tired muscles? I think so. GLs aren’t oppressive in PvP but they offer better in between than a rocket or a machine gun. It can clear rooms quickly and do decent single target damage. With a linear fusion rifle nerf incoming we might see a rise in grenade launcher usage. With Wendigo being at the top of the list. Spike will give you damage, but better utility might be blinding. If you want to go all into damage, spike grenades, golden tricorn, adept big ones, and font of might will give you some incredible damage output. It’s a lot harder to upkeep on a grenade launcher, and especially when you’re dealing with a boss with limited fodder you might not be able to sustain golden tricorn 2x. Even with that set up you will have some great burst damage." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Blowout
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Blowout will be an alright addition to your arsenal. There isn’t much that this rocket does that others don’t besides dropping more frequently and having more perks with resets. The same “get damage perk, get reload perk” applies to Blowout. Frenzy, lasting impression, or chain reaction for add clear are all fantastic options. Field prep for near instant reloads, demolitionist for instant reloads, and ambitious assassin for bigger magazine are all the best in their slot." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Unwavering Duty
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Unwavering Duty is the Hammerhead of year 5. The only major differences are that Hammerhead has +2 range, but -4 reload speed, +5 bullets in the magazine and +18 aim assist. They will still feel very comparable. The difference in stats will feel negligible, and the loss in bullets can be made up for via subsistence or ambitious assassin. Incandescent and killing tally are both S tier perks. Focused fury will be useful if this becomes your main dps weapon or machine guns get a sizeable PvE damage buff." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Veles-X
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Veles-X is an aggressive burst pulse rifle that doesn’t need a raid to acquire. [...] If you happen to use void, however, getting golden tricorn 2x should be a cakewalk. The synergy is there to take this gun with echo of instability. Get a kill with Veles-X first, throw a grenade and get volatile rounds. You have golden tricorn 2x, this can stack with font of might for insane damage output. You have volatile rounds for add clear and if you get the kill you’ll have a small overshield to use. This is incredible for almost all activities. Unless you can’t get the grenade kill easily I would keep this in your inventory." Recommended MW - Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=2276328320&perks=2610012052,3230963543,3661387068,776531651

// Albruna-D
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "For any PvE activity I will always try and prioritize recoil direction. Especially on special weapons or your main DPS weapon to make follow up shots easier. Any mag boosting perk will make the overall roll better. The usual suspects of triple tap, clown cartridge and field prep all make their appearance. Alongside our usual damage perks; firing line, frenzy and vorpal weapon. All of these damage perks are phenomenal, but use case specific. Firing line only works when in a full fireteam or raid, and you’d have to be within range for it to work. Frenzy only really works as long as you’re continuously taking damage or dealing it. Vorpal is the easiest to work with but also has the lowest damage output of all three." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Prolonged Engagement
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "This submachine gun is incredible. Decent base stats, good base recoil direction, a million and a half perks. What could be better? Despite not having perfect recoil I would still try and hit 100 with arrowhead brake. Flared magwell or appended is dealer’s choice. I find with reload gauntlets or the plethora of ways to bypass reload are more than enough for me. Subsistence is one such way. Being able to ignore a whole stat on your weapon means you can invest those stat points into any other stat. You will still need to reload eventually and having a good reload stat will make that feel less like a slow molasses river. Finally there’s your damage perks. Frenzy is tried and true, and headstone is just a wonderful add clear perk. Multikill clip is best used with a dedicated reload perk like feeding frenzy or outlaw." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Wendigo GL3
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Is the current meta open enough to allow Wendigo to flex its tired muscles? I think so. GLs aren’t oppressive in PvP but they offer better in between than a rocket or a machine gun. It can clear rooms quickly and do decent single target damage. With a linear fusion rifle nerf incoming we might see a rise in grenade launcher usage. With Wendigo being at the top of the list. Spike will give you damage, but better utility might be blinding. If you want to go all into damage, spike grenades, golden tricorn, adept big ones, and font of might will give you some incredible damage output. It’s a lot harder to upkeep on a grenade launcher, and especially when you’re dealing with a boss with limited fodder you might not be able to sustain golden tricorn 2x. Even with that set up you will have some great burst damage." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Wendigo GL3 (Adept)
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Is the current meta open enough to allow Wendigo to flex its tired muscles? I think so. GLs aren’t oppressive in PvP but they offer better in between than a rocket or a machine gun. It can clear rooms quickly and do decent single target damage. With a linear fusion rifle nerf incoming we might see a rise in grenade launcher usage. With Wendigo being at the top of the list. Spike will give you damage, but better utility might be blinding. If you want to go all into damage, spike grenades, golden tricorn, adept big ones, and font of might will give you some incredible damage output. It’s a lot harder to upkeep on a grenade launcher, and especially when you’re dealing with a boss with limited fodder you might not be able to sustain golden tricorn 2x. Even with that set up you will have some great burst damage." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Blowout
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Blowout will be an alright addition to your arsenal. There isn’t much that this rocket does that others don’t besides dropping more frequently and having more perks with resets. The same “get damage perk, get reload perk” applies to Blowout. Frenzy, lasting impression, or chain reaction for add clear are all fantastic options. Field prep for near instant reloads, demolitionist for instant reloads, and ambitious assassin for bigger magazine are all the best in their slot." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Unwavering Duty
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Unwavering Duty is the Hammerhead of year 5. The only major differences are that Hammerhead has +2 range, but -4 reload speed, +5 bullets in the magazine and +18 aim assist. They will still feel very comparable. The difference in stats will feel negligible, and the loss in bullets can be made up for via subsistence or ambitious assassin. Incandescent and killing tally are both S tier perks. Focused fury will be useful if this becomes your main dps weapon or machine guns get a sizeable PvE damage buff." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller

// Cold Front
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "[...] just has poor stats across the board. With the lowest stability in its class, the lowest reload and aim assist. Cold Front is tied for the lowest magazine with Blood Feud. Cold Front needs a lot to make it feel and shoot well. In PvE I would recommend corkscrew rifling to give a flat buff to all its stats. Flared magwell offers the best of both reload and stability (two stats this gun desperately needs). Frenzy and Subsistence are my final choices. Frenzy is the best for bringing up even more of Cold Front’s poor stats. Subsistence has received multiple buffs and it feels incredible on your primary add clear weapon." Recommended MW - Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=2814093983&perks=1820235745,3230963543,4090651448,4104185692

// Stay Frosty
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Its base stats aren’t anything to write home about. [...] Where Stay Frosty takes the lead is in its perks. Arrowhead is a must regardless of what activity you’re in. Having a base recoil of 55 means you can slap on a CB mod and be at 100. Thresh is an incredible tool for building your supers now that your intellect stat doesn’t matter as much compared to whatever tier you’re in. Headstone is just fun add clear. [...] Short shout-out to Golden tricorn. Golden tricorn is the best for ability cycling and weapon cycling. Being able to have such a huge refreshable buff that stacks with things like elemental wells, high-energy fire, and radiance is too good to pass up. Stasis isn’t the strongest on its own for abilities, but it might get a buff. Who knows." Recommended MW - Reload.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=2812100428&perks=124408337,1968497646,2726471870,839105230

// Glacioclasm
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "Subsistence will continue to keep reservoir burst up, but newer fusions can roll reservoir burst and keep it for more than one shot. Glacioclasm is a product of power creep, but that’s okay. Not needing to think about how many shots of reservoir burst you have left and instead going 1:1 makes things easier. Easy is good. I will also give a special shoutout to Golden tricorn. SImilar to Stay Frosty, having the ability cycling and one of the highest damage outputs you can imagine for this weapon type is incredible. Void also gives you more ways of uptime and refresh-ability. Definitely keep an eye out for that." Recommended MW - Handling.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=3573686365&perks=1427256713,1820235745,689005463,839105230

// Avalanche
//notes:pandapaxxy (PvE / M+KB / Controller): "I am always both happy and sad when this weapon rolls around. Avalanche is just a relic of year 3. It’s a weird SUROS machine gun that fires from both barrels. The saving grace is being a 450 RPM machine gun. I went slightly different with my recommendations compared to my peers. With a recoil direction of 70 you really want to bump this up to max. Arrowhead brake is the first suggestion I have. With auto-loading holster you won’t have to worry about reload speed and you’ll get all the benefits of a bigger magazine with appended mag. Finally there’s target lock. This season’s newest perk. Target lock will increase your damage the longer you stay on target. With backup mag and appended mag you cap out your magazine at 75. With these many bullets you should definitely be the coolest person in your fireteam when you hit the cap on damage and be able to show off that sweet, sweet DEEPS." Recommended MW - Stability.|tags:pve,mkb,controller
dimwishlist:item=495940989&perks=1087426260,3300816228,365154968,839105230

// Disparity (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake), (Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag), (Rapid Hit, Outlaw), Headstone
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. Shapeable. First-choice PvE roll for synergy with Stasis subclasses. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts, but Hakke Breach Armaments, with the additional damage against stasis crystals is the choice to break crystals for a dragonfly-like burst of damage. This is the only current(as at v6.3.0.2) me aggressive frame pulse rifle in the kinetic slot, so it's worth hanging on a good roll. Correct the wonky recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake, or Fluted Barrel makes it feel snappier and more stable. In the mag, Flared Magwell or Tactical Mag are the best options, adding more stability and reload speed. To match up with Headstone, Rapid Hit and Outlaw both proc on the same condition to reward consistent crits. Recommended MW: Handling or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Major or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=1751893422&perks=124408337,247725512,3230963543,839105230

dimwishlist:item=1751893422&perks=106909392,1168162263,124408337,839105230

// Disparity (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Fluted Barrel, Arrowhead Brake), (Flared Magwell, Tactical Mag), (Rapid Hit, Outlaw), (Frenzy, One For All, Swashbuckler, Desperado)
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. Shapeable. First-choice PvE roll for endgame content. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts, or use Hakke Breach Armaments if you're going to face vehicles, turrets or constructs. This is the only current(as at v6.3.0.2) me aggressive frame pulse rifle in the kinetic slot, so it's worth hanging on a good roll.  Correct the wonky recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake, or Fluted Barrel makes it feel snappier and more stable. In the mag, Flared Magwell or Tactical Mag are the best options, adding more stability and reload speed. Rapid Hit and Outlaw both proc on the on crits, and then match this with your choice of the range of damage output-increasing traits. // Tripwire Canary (PvE first-choice roll)
// Elastic String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Archer's Tempo, Explosive Head
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for general content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts or the Veist Stinger will provide the occasional fast reload and draw. The Lightweight frame provides +20 mobility and 6.25% boost to movement, which is always useful. As with all bows, get the draw time as low as possible with Elastic String, and then recover the lost accuracy with Fiberglass Arrow Shaft. For end-game content, in the first trait column, Archer's Tempo rewards crit hits with even faster draw time. Explosive Head not only adds bonus damage passively, but also disrupts overload Champions in fewer hits, when the mod is around. MW: Draw Time or Accuracy, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Major or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-Champion, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB
dimwishlist:item=3849444474&perks=201365942,2801223209,3365897133,3429800428

//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for general content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts or the Veist Stinger will provide the occasional fast reload and draw. The Lightweight frame provides +20 mobility and 6.25% boost to movement, which is always useful. As with all bows, get the draw time as low as possible with Elastic String, and then recover the lost accuracy with Fiberglass Arrow Shaft. For end-game content, in the first trait column, Archer's Tempo rewards crit hits with even faster draw time. In the second column, damage boosts from Frenzy, just for being in combat, or Swashbuckler with your choice of 3.0 melee options both improve utility. MW: Draw Time or Accuracy, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Major or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

// Tripwire Canary (PvE first-choice roll)
// Elastic String, Fiberglass Arrow Shaft, Dragonfly, (Explosive Head, Frenzy, Swashbuckler, Successful Warm-up)
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for general content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts or the Veist Stinger will provide the occasional fast reload and draw. The Lightweight frame provides +20 mobility and 6.25% boost to movement, which is always useful. As with all bows, get the draw time as low as possible with Elastic String, and then recover the lost accuracy with Fiberglass Arrow Shaft. and then recover lost accuracy with your arrow. For general content, Dragonfly is a great choice, spreading damage on crit kills in the first trait column. In the second, take your choice of damage-improving traits to help with clearing adds. // Path of Least Resistance (PvE first-choice roll)
(Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore, Fluted Barrel), (Particle Repeater, Tactical Battery, Light Battery, Enhanced Battery), Adaptive Munitions, Focused Fury
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts or Omolon Fluid Dynamics' extra stability and reload speed is always welcome. An arc legendary trace rifle to complete the energy set. Stats are a bit of a mixed bag, but there are a few interesting rolls, and at least now you can collect them all! Perhaps worth tucking away for the day that we get an anti-Barrier mod. Keep the beam on target with a stability barrel, , together with a battery that provides some extra stability, reload speed, range or charge. With Trace Rifle's fire rate, this should rip through non-matching shields in match game, and Focused Fury can then help take the Champion down once stunned. MW: Stability, with a damage-boosting Minor, Major or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-MajorSpec. PvE-Champion, PvE-EndGame, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

An arc legendary trace rifle to complete the energy set. Stats are a bit of a mixed bag, but there are a few interesting rolls, and at least now you can collect them all! // Judgment of Kelgorath (PvE first-choice roll)
// Auxilliary Reserves, Appended Mag, (Overflow, Demolitionist), Incandescent
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for solar subclass synergy in end-game content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts but will be more use for a glaive than Hakke Breach Armaments. JoK is a new subtype for Season 19 - a slower, but harder hitting slashy shooty stick than we're used to. You're going to be in CQC, where projectile speed (governed by range) isn't quite as important, so the shield can be quite useful to survive in a crowd. Use your haft to improve charge time and shield duration, and take the extra shot from Appended Mag (Extended Mag gives you no more shots so isn't worth it). In the first trait column, Overflow on a Special or Power weapon is just so good - more than double your magazine size and it bypasses the low reload speed just for picking up a brick, or Demolitionist reloads just for using your grenade and the kills regain 20% energy! Then, have solar subclass fun proccing Incandescent's scorch and ignite effects to help clear crowds of adds even faster. MW: Range, with a damage-boosting (Minor, Major or Taken Spec) mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, Controller, M+KB

// Retrofit Escapade (PvE first-choice roll)
// Arrowhead Brake, Tactical Mag, (Stats for All, Field Prep, Fourth Time's the Charm, Feeding Frenzy), Golden Tricorn
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game content. Shapeable. The Ambush origin trait is probably more for PvP than PvE, with the extra range, handling and 10% boost to damage for a few moments after combat starts, although Suros Synergy's flinch reduction in reload is useful in a firefight too so take your pick. This is better in every stat than the only other rapid fire LMG - Shattered Cypher - and there are a few ways you can go with a weapon build. You'll need to control your fire with short bursts - so, to make it easier, tighten up the recoil direction with Arrowhead Brake. Tactical Mag adds a few extra shots, plus stability and reload speed. To lean into the Void 3.0 sandbox, give yourself as much ammo and uptime in the first trait column with Stats for All, Field Prep, Fourth Time's the Charm or Feeding Frenzy to take advantage of Golden Tricorn's 50% bonus damage with two stacks, using your choice of void grenade or melee. Recommended  MW: Stability or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting (Major, Boss or Taken Spec) or Backup Mag mod.|tags: PvE, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-God, PvE-EndGame, Controller, M+KB

//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. First-choice PvE roll for end-game add clear. Shapeable. The Rasputin's Arsenal origin trait reloads on a shield break, which should save on a few reloads. Precisions aren't the strongest choice for PvE as at Season 19 v6.3.0.2, and the Ikelos HC's stats are pretty bad across the board, but there are a few combinations that are still interesting. Fill in some of the stat gaps in Handling and Range with your barrel, and then with the combined goodness of Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber and Ricochet Rounds, Seraph Rounds is a clear first choice in the mag. Stability is the play for controller, to help keep your barrel pointed at what you're shooting at, and then with the combined goodness of Armor-Piercing, High-Caliber and Ricochet Rounds, Seraph Rounds is a clear first choice in the mag. To pair with Voltshot, forget Feeding Frenzy as it doesn't pair well so, instead, Threat Detector will speed up your reloads and boost your stability while you're in CQC or Perpetual Motion will do the same just for moving about a bit. // Zephyr (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Jagged Edge, Tempered Edge), Swordmaster's Guard, Unrelenting, (Chain Reaction, Surrounded, Whirlwind Blade)
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 44. PvE first-choice roll for Minor add clear. No second origin trait, but Dawning Surprise helps you gain ability energy and restart healing by collecting a small box after killing a half-dozen enemies or so - ideal in keeping you alive in CQC. In the blade slot, Jagged Edge to maximises damage or Tempered Edge balances a bit of extra damage and ammo, for all-round utility. Swordmaster's Guard is the usual recommendation in the guard slot, to get your heavy attack up as quickly as possible. // Cold Front
//notes:WarlockMaggie (PvE / M+KB / Controller): Abysmal stability means this thing will kick like a mule and being under the 20 stability threshold means you’ll be taking extra flinch. So the priority with this weapon is to improve stability (and any other stats) as soon as possible. Enter the community-named “musketeer” build (Stats and One for All). With a quick pass over 3 targets, you’ll gain stats boosts and damage. Tac Mag may not be the most stat heavy option, but the extra bullet may help in securing that initial activation. Other stat raising perks can work, but don’t keep any rolls without ‘em. Remember, if you are a naughty Guardian, Xur will leave a Slickdraw / Gutshot Straight Cold Front in your stocking. |tags:pve,mkb,controller

Excellent, pretty much best-in-class stats, and the precision frame means you don't really have to worry about Recoil Direction, so boost your gunfeel stats with barrel and mag. // BrayTech Werewolf (PvE first-choice roll)
// Fluted Barrel, Armor-Piercing Rounds, Pugilist, Vorpal Weapon
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE first-choice roll for Barrier Champions, when the mod's around. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Excellent, pretty much best-in-class stats, and the precision frame means you don't really have to worry about Recoil Direction, so boost your gunfeel stats with your barrel. Armor-Piercing Rounds adds 5% damage against shields and barriers, and Vorpal Weapon in the second trait column boosts damage against Majors (including Champions), Bosses and vehicles by 20%. There's noting much that helps in the first trait column, so just take Pugilist to turn this into a Legendary mini-Monte Carlo. Recommended MW: Handling, Stability or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-God, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-Champion, Controller, MKB|tags: PvE, PvE-Boss, PvE-God, PvE-MajorSpec, PvE-Champion, Controller, MKB
dimwishlist:item=2869466318&perks=1546637391,1840239774,1968497646,691659142

// BrayTech Werewolf (PvE first-choice roll)
// Fluted Barrel, (Ricochet Rounds, Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Flared Magwell, Light Mag, Appended Mag), Pugilist, Osmosis
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE first-choice utility roll for endgame content, particularly soloing. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Excellent, pretty much best-in-class stats, and the precision frame means you don't really have to worry about Recoil Direction, so boost your gunfeel stats with your barrel and mag. You can turn this into a Legendary mini-Monte Carlo with Pugilist in the first trait column and pair this with Osmosis in the second for an additional primary energy weapon option when you use your grenade - useful as a utility roll, and for soloing activities in particular. This won't replace a Demolitionist/Osmosis The Last Breath, and you only really need one Osmosis auto rifle in your Vault, but you never know - Bungie might just add melee kills to proc... Recommended MW: Handling, Stability or Reload Speed, with a damage-boosting (Major or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-Solo, Controller, MKB|tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-MinorSpec, PvE-EndGame, PvE-Solo, Controller, MKB
dimwishlist:item=2869466318&perks=1774574192,1840239774,1968497646,691659142

// Jurassic Green (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore), (Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds), Perpetual Motion, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE first-choice roll for endgame content. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Dreadful stats compared to any other energy rapid-fire pulse rifle as at v6.2.5.1, but it's the only solar one currently available. Wonky recoil direction of 50, so you'll need to straighten that out as much as possible with a Recoil Direction barrel, Stability Barrel or a bit of both. Take your choice of the combat-effect mag perks in your mag slot. For endgame use, Perpetual Motion boosts gunfeel stats passively and Frenzy provides a decent 15% damage boost in combat. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-MinorSpec, PvP-EndGame, Controller, MKB|tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-MinorSpec, PvP-EndGame, Controller, MKB

dimwishlist:item=2603335652&perks=1428297954,1885400500,3661387068,4104185692
dimwishlist:item=2603335652&perks=1392496348,1428297954,1885400500,4104185692

// Jurassic Green (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore), (Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds), Subsistence, Frenzy
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE first-choice roll for general content. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Dreadful stats compared to any other energy rapid-fire pulse rifle as at v6.2.5.1, but it's the only solar one currently available. Wonky recoil direction of 50, so you'll need to straighten that out as much as possible with a Recoil Direction barrel, Stability Barrel or a bit of both. Take your choice of the combat-effect mag perks in your mag slot. Subsistence keeps your mag topped up and Frenzy provides a decent 15% damage boost in combat. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-MinorSpec, Controller, MKB|tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-MinorSpec, Controller, MKB

// Jurassic Green (PvE first-choice roll)
// (Arrowhead Brake, Chambered Compensator, Polygonal Rifling, Smallbore), (Armor-Piercing Rounds, High-Calibre Rounds, Ricochet Rounds), (Subsistence, Perpetual Motion), (Golden Tricorn, Incandescent)
//notes:Inspired by DMB PvE Podcast 37. PvE first-choice roll for non-endgame content, particularly for solar subclasses. The Origin Trait, gaining better ADS and strafe speed when on your own, might be useful when you're away from your fireteam, but think of it more as a useful added extra when it's procced. Dreadful stats compared to any other energy rapid-fire pulse rifle as at v6.2.5.1, but it's the only solar one currently available. Wonky recoil direction of 50, so you'll need to straighten that out as much as possible with a Recoil Direction barrel, Stability Barrel or a bit of both. Take your choice of the combat-effect mag perks in your mag slot - any of them should work fine. Subsistence keeps your magazine topped up or Perpetual Motion boosts gunfeel stats passively. In the second column, Golden Tricorn provides a reliable 15% damage boost with one stack, or a full 50% at two stacks after a solar ability kill, or play with solar subclass scorch and ignite stacks with Incandescent. Recommended MW: Handling or Stability, with a damage-boosting (Minor or Taken Spec) mod. Tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-MinorSpec, Controller, MKB|tags: PvE, PvE-God, PvE-MinorSpec, Controller, MKB
